story:
(*English to Follow Below)

 מוזיקה חיה & הופעות | Happy Hour | שפמים

Be.Unplugged הוא אירוע אמנים המשתפים פעולה להעלאת מודעות וכספים למטרות חברתיות. החודש, אנו מתמקדים ב״מובמבר״, יוזמה חובקת עולם התומכת בבריאות הגבר.

בואו והראו לנו את השפמים שלכם!

//למה לצפות //

// הופעות חיות // אמנים מקומיים מדהימים מבצעים אשר יעוררו את תשוקתך ויבדרו החושים שלך כדי ליצור ערב ״מובמבר״ שאתה בטוח תזכור.

// הפי האוור // משקאות טעימים& מאכלים מיוחדים החל מהשעה 20:00.

// אחי, איפה השפם שלך? // הצטרפו לגברים ברחבי העולם ב '״נובמבר ללא גילוח" כדי לעזור לשנות את פני הבריאות של הגברים.  האריכו את זקנכם והצטרפו לתחרות המדהימה שלנו!

// לחוש את האשכים שלך // אתה עושה את זה בכל מקרה. אתה יכול גם ללמוד איך לעשות את זה בדרך הבריאה.

// שפץ את הזקן שלך // קבל טיפוח מהספר שלנו, שיעצב & ויספר אתכם כל הלילה [תרומת 30 ש"ח]. הרשמת נקודה כאן: http://bit.ly/2ez7nux

 //בואו לחוות את שוק האמנים המקומי שלנו // גלו ותמכו ביוצרים מקומיים, ברי קיימא, הוליסטיים והאמנים הטובים ביותר בתל אביב.

תמיכה בבריאות הגבר // תמורה מן הכרטיסים, מספרה & השוק ייתרמו לקרן מובמבר// 

:למידע נוסף על היוזמה כאן

  www.movemberfoundation.org.

// שפם מהתא // צלם תמונה עם האחים והאחיות שלך לשפם בכדי להנציח בזכרון את משמעות האירוע שלנו.

// האם אתה מעז להתנתק // (.Be)להיות. 100% מנותק. הבא לנו את הפלאפון עבור חווית   Unplugged והיכנס להגרלה לזכיית בפרס . [קש זכוכית ממוחזרים אישי מהודר עם כיסוי & מנקה]

.כוס אישית // הביאו את הכוס שלכם! או שתוכלו לשכור אחת באירוע. לא יהיה פלסטיק במקום//

:כרטיסים // קנה כאן//

  https://igg.me/at/beunplugged

מכירה מוקדמת (עד 22/11) - 30 ש"ח

כרטיס רגיל - 40 ש"ח

באירוע - 50 שקל

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

אודות המארגנים

היא יוזמה חינוכית, חברתית ליצירת שינוי חיובי על ידי העלאת מודעות לערכים של כבוד דרך .Be חוויות מעוררות השראה ושיתופיות.

Be.Unplugged הינו אירוע של # BE1 , שבו משתפי פעולה הופכים לאישות אחת למשך יום ומשתלבים במשאבים שלנו כדי לעודד, לעורר ומחזקים זה את זה. חזקים יחד, כל מי שמשתתף מאמינין בערכים המשותפים שלנו של חיים ברי קיימא והוליסטיות כדי ליצור עולם טוב יותר.

Be.Involved

 על ידי שליחת אימייל לכתובת 

we@betheproject.com

 או בקר בעמוד הפייסבוק שלנו.

https://www.facebook.com/betheproject/

----

Be.Unplugged is a collaborative artists event raising awareness and funds for social causes. This month, we focus on Movember, a worldwide initiative to support men’s health.

Come out to the bash and show us your 'stache!

What To Expect //

LIVE PERFORMANCES // Amazing Local Artists and Passionate Performers will entertain your senses to create a Movember evening you're sure to remember.

HAPPY HOUR // Delicious drink & food specials from 20:00.

DUDE, WHERE’S YOUR ‘STACHE? // Join men worldwide in 'No-Shave November' to help change the face of men's health. Grow your face out & enter our Mighty Mo Contest!

FONDLE YOUR BALLS // You do it anyway. You may as well learn how to do it in a healthy way.

PIMP YOUR BEARD // Get groomed by The Barber Shop, who will be studding & primping you up all night. Sign up for a spot here.

EXPLORE OUR LOCAL ARTIST MARKET // Discover and support the best local, sustainable, holistic creators and artists in Tel Aviv.

SUPPORT MEN'S HEALTH // Proceeds from tickets, barber shop & marketplace will be donated to the Movember Foundation. 

MO BOOTH // Get snapped with your Mo Brothers & Mo Sisters to capture our party with a purpose.

DARE TO UNPLUG // Be. 100% Unplugged. Turn in your phone for a truly unplugged evening, and get entered to win a prize. [Exquisite personal recycled glass straw with cover & cleaner]

BYOC // Bring Your Own Cup! Or rent one on-site. There will be no plastics on the premises.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

ABOUT THE ORGANIZERS

Be. is an educational, social initiative creating positive change by raising awareness for values of respect through collaborative inspirational experiences.

Be.Unplugged is a #Be1 Event, where collaborators become one for a day and combine our resources to support, inspire and empower each other. Stronger together, all collaborators believe in our shared values of living sustainably and holistically to create a better world.

Be.Involved by emailing us at we@betheproject.com or visiting our Be. Facebook Page.

_______________________________________________________________________________

story:
Summary

I am an Environmental Science and Policy undergraduate (graduating this semester!) at Humboldt State University in Northern California. I come from the Colorado Rocky Mountains, and have been fortunate to travel and see many incredible things. I've viewed the world from a 14,000 ft peak, gotten sea sick off the Na Pali Coast,  ridden camels in the Judean Desert, marveled at human potential in Tenochtitlan, and enjoyed the 4th of July Fireworks on the roof of my house. I am now working to join a 6-week Environmental Engineering study abroad program in the Dominican Republic this summer.

This program visits Santo Domingo to build Appropriate Technology (sustainable engineering) projects in partnership with the local community. This is done by working with the community to identify needs and available resources, test the resources and methods available, and develop a plan to build a sustainable and durable project that meets the community's needs. Within this program, there is no profit motive. This is entirely for learning and providing innovative solutions.

Past projects include a school house built with walls made out of plastic bottles, a pharmacy with cinder blocks made from local waste products in partnership with a local manufacturer's facility, rainwater catchment facilities, renewable energy projects, and so much more.

While in the DR, I will gain 8-units and build a to-be-determined renewable energy or sustainable resource project based on the community's needs. I will stay with a host family which will allow me to truly immerse myself in the culture and allow me to gain valuable insight on life in the Dominican Republic throughout the project.This is not a top-down project, but a horizontally based opportunity that empowers people across the globe to help each other, hone their own personal skills, and develop individuals and communities that are full of character, expertise, and contribute to the wider society as a whole.

By clicking on the link below, you can watch a 5 minute TED talk about the Practivistas program by its Director, Lonny Grafman:
https://www.youtube.com/embed/pc3C6OwfhOE

Program Costs, Deadline, and Available Resources

Program: $3800
Deadline to pay for Program: Friday, May 15th (THIS WEEK)
Airfare: $750.
Food, travel necessities: $450

I have about $1000 of saved-up money for various travel activities and for any supplies I may need for my trip.

If I am unable to raise sufficient funds to attend this trip, I will donate all of the funds raised to others that are going on this trip unless otherwise instructed.

Why support me of all people?

I have worked as a pizza maker, bagel maker, sandwich maker, law-firm runner, barista, manager, volunteer, organizer, and Co-Director.

Since living in Humboldt for the past three years, I've volunteered in a variety of manners and spearheaded a multitude of successful projects.
Volunteer and relevant experience includes (but is not limited to):
1) Arcata Marsh Interpretive Center Staffer. Provided info to passers-by on this system which serves as the city's Water Treatment System.
2) President of HSU's Natural Resources Club: Coordinated community restoration projects with local non-profits almost every Saturday for two years.
3) Co-Director for the Campus Center for Appropriate Technology (CCAT). This is a student-run, student-funded, sustainable-living demonstration house on campus which is home to a variety of "appropriate technologies" such as rainwater catchment, a greenhouse, cob structures, and a solar charging station for everyday devices. This experience directly translates into the Practivistas program.
4) Student Board Member on the university's Advancement Foundation Board whom I successfully convinced to commit to Divesting from Fossil Fuels (http://gofossilfree.org/usa/the-story-of-divest...) with a fellow organizer and student support. (https://youtu.be/U3s-3rPRuxo <--Short video the university made about their new investment policy which begins with me speaking.)
5) California Student Sustainability Coalition and helped restart HSU's Student Sustainability Coalition.
6) Human chain I organized last year for Earth Day called Hands Across Humboldt (https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hands-Across-Humboldt/645375645538924?fref=ts&ref=br_tf) with the coalition of students who collaborated to put on Earth Week. We just finished our second annual Earth Week this year which was much larger and more successful than last year's as a result of the my efforts with peers last year and a highly expanded collaborative team effort this year with other student leaders on campus.

Challenges

My main challenge is not having an income or time to make any money. I am a full-time student (15-units) and work full-time as a live-in Co-Director of CCAT. This is a work trade that allows me free rent and utilities without higher compensation.. I am so fortunate to have this opportunity, but I work a minimum of 30-hours per week (meetings, coordinating, planning, emails, running Volunteer Fridays, etc.) in this position which leaves me no time for an outside income source. Therefore, I cannot provide any more income for this incredible opportunity.

Broke or already donated? Other Ways You Can Help

#PennyDR

I highly appreciate any support that can be given. This can come in the form of a "share" on your facebook or through indiegogo, retweeting on twitter (@claranette), or a direct conversation with someone you know who may want to contribute!

I also am looking for a specific backpack and a water purifier for this trip, and would gladly accept these items as a form of support.

In the end, by attending this program, I will gain a once-in-a-lifetime experience that will help me to actively engage in improving the global community in a time that requires responsible resource use and sustainable living patterns in both the DR and in the future. By promoting this campaign, you're promoting sustainable living and helping those around you to live more sustainably!

story:
Forivor’s super-soft luxurious organic bedding plays with the idea of transformation to transport you between two different lands.

Designed in the UK, our beautiful reversible bedding features a unique hand-drawn illustration on each side and is accompanied by a set of illustrated Character Cards that provide facts about nature and storytelling cues. 

One side of the bedding depicts a British woodland, where wildlife hides in the undergrowth and up in the branches of the trees for children to find. Turning over the bedding reveals a transformed nighttime world. A place of wonder, where glow worms light up the enchanted forest and fantastical creatures play in secret burrows underground.

 

Our Enchanted Forest single duvet and pillow case (as shown above and below) are made from the softest organic cotton satin with a simple hidden button closure on the duvet and classic envelope style pillow slips.The duvet measures 140 X 200cm and the pillowcase is 75 X 50cm.

 

The duvet set comes in a Forivor suitcase (see below) and is accompanied by a set of Junior Character Cards. The cards draw on the popularity of collectable cards, providing interesting and memorable facts about wildlife on one side, encouraging children to explore and understand the world around them. The other side introduces the transformed creatures of Forivorland, their secrets and magic powers. Storytelling cues and questions encourage children to create their own bedtime tales.

As well as creating magical childhood memories, oral storytelling plays an important role in the development of a child’s creative mind, memory development and language skills. We believe that by encouraging children to be storytellers who are passionate about nature, we can help nurture a generation of responsible guardians for the planet.

The Enchanted Forest Quilted Blanket is made from super-soft 300 thread count organic cotton satin and stuffed with a bouncy organic cotton wadding that makes it unbelievably soft for young delicate skin. 

It measures 105 X 150cm and is perfect as a blanket or playmat for babies or as a duvet for toddlers and young children. 

 

Our Baby Character Cards accompany the quilted blanket and feature large black and white illustrations with lyrical descriptions of animal sounds and characteristics for parents to enjoy reading and learning with their young children.

 

Bring a touch of treetop magic to your child's bedroom with our Hammock Hangers cushion. Made from soft organic cotton the beautifully illustrated hammock continues off the cushion with the hammock strings becoming playful ribbons. On the reverse you'll find two cheeky mouse tails.

The cushion measures 30cm X 60cm and has a hidden zip closure. Filler included.

Hand-embroidered by Sewa Delhi Ruaab women's cooperative, this exquisitely detailed wall hanging brings Forivor's characters to life and makes a stylish addition to nurseries and children's bedrooms (but you don't need a child as an excuse to have one in your home)!

Both the Enchanted Forest Duvet Set and the Quilted Blanket are presented in our hardwearing organic cotton Forivor Suitcase (as shown in the animation at the top). In the suitcase you'll find Character Cards encased in their own sturdy cotton canvas zip-up pouch.

The Forivor suitcase was designed to reduce throwaway packaging and can be used as a first sleepover bag or for play. 

At the heart of Forivor’s philosophy is a commitment to supporting and inspiring the protection of our natural world and all the wildlife that belongs to it, while providing an opportunity to learn and explore our imaginations. 

Forivor’s bedding is designed to last and be passed from one generation to the next, taking some of the stories that have been told with it and creating a legacy of imaginative creative thinkers who are passionate about the planet.

Forivor’s bedding is produced in India by an award-winning factory using rain-fed cotton from small landholders without the use of toxic pesticides that are harmful to human health and wildlife - reducing carbon emissions and helping to protect the natural world we have been inspired by and its future for our children. 

Our Character Cards are printed in Oxford by an award-winning and innovative environmental printer.

We need to raise £5,000 to produce our first collection and get started on our journey, and we can only do it with YOUR help! We have final samples from our partners in India that we are very happy with and know you are going to love. 

In addition to our signature designs that we have featured here, we have also developed a broader collection of repeat prints and patterns across a wider range of interiors products - £5,000 will help us get one step closer to producing these and future collections based on at-risk habitats that we would like to draw attention to with our unique concept.

The textiles industry is the 5th largest contributor to carbon emissions in the US and is responsible for devastating human rights and environmental abuses globally. By supporting Forivor you are helping to grow the market share of organic textiles and as such provide a more sustainable future for people and planet. Please take a look at our website for more information.

Everything is ready to go for the production of our first collection. We've checked our colours, our stitching, the quality of craftsmanship, road tested our products with kids of all ages and gone back to the drawing board a few times. 

We are now 100% happy and confident we have a product which parents and children are going to love. As soon as we pay for our production we have to wait three months for our boxes of duvets and blankets to be produced and one month for them to be slow shipped (to save carbon) from India - then we can send them on to you and start selling on our online shop and to retailers. 

And we'll have you to thank for helping us get our business off the ground!

We are Rebecca Attwood and Alice Ross - co-directors with a mission to inspire magical sleep!

The idea for Forivor, which is named after Rebecca's father Ivor, came to Rebecca after trying and failing to write a story for her goddaughter and coincidentally trying (and failing) to find beautiful organic bedding. She was inspired by her childhood growing up without electricity on the Welsh borders as well as her work with iconic British designer Katharine Hamnett and the Environmental Justice Foundation. Alice's detailed and evocative drawings were the perfect partner for this unique concept and so a dream team was formed. And we both just happen to love anything pickled and a certain shade of dusky pink.

Before the arrival of baby Remie, the office mascot, Rebecca worked to protect people and planet at the Environmental Justice Foundation, leading a variety of creative projects with fashion designers, artists, political figures and philosophers to ensure environmental security as a basic human right in some of the world's poorest countries. 

When Alice isn't in Forivorland she gets to work with the 6 million objects at the British Museum; coordinating projects and sometimes gets to sleep next to giant ancient Egyptian sculptures during sleepovers!

Do you ship internationally? Yes, you will see an option for international shipping when you select your chosen pledge.

What are the duvet and blanket sizes? Children's duvets are 140 X 200cm with a pillowslip measuring 75 x 50cmQuilted blankets are 105cm x 150cm

I would like something personalised or a custom size, can you do it? We would like to help where we can. Please drop us an email at info@forivor.com and we'll let you know. 

Can I choose more than one reward? Yes - you can do this by increasing your pledge amount and dropping us an email to let us know what items you would like. 

When will I receive my Forivor product?You will receive Forivor bedding in October. Other rewards vary - please see detail on each pledge.

Risks & Challenges

We have spent two years perfecting our designs and the supply chain to ensure we have confidence in our supply chain and are offering the finest most luxurious and environmentally friendly product. 

However as with any business that imports goods from overseas there are risks. For example during our sampling process we waited an additional 6 weeks for our sample collection to arrive as the shipment had been caught in the worst flooding in 100 years in Chennai, India. We have factored in additional time should our changing climate be unpredictable again.
story_txt:
Forivor’s super-soft luxurious organic bedding plays with the idea of transformation to transport you between two different lands.
Designed in the UK, our beautiful reversible bedding features a unique hand-drawn illustration on each side and is accompanied by a set of illustrated Character Cards that provide facts about nature and storytelling cues. 
One side of the bedding depicts a British woodland, where wildlife hides in the undergrowth and up in the branches of the trees for children to find. Turning over the bedding reveals a transformed nighttime world. A place of wonder, where glow worms light up the enchanted forest and fantastical creatures play in secret burrows underground.



 

Our Enchanted Forest single duvet and pillow case (as shown above and below) are made from the softest organic cotton satin with a simple hidden button closure on the duvet and classic envelope style pillow slips.The duvet measures 140 X 200cm and the pillowcase is 75 X 50cm.
 
The duvet set comes in a Forivor suitcase (see below) and is accompanied by a set of Junior Character Cards. The cards draw on the popularity of collectable cards, providing interesting and memorable facts about wildlife on one side, encouraging children to explore and understand the world around them. The other side introduces the transformed creatures of Forivorland, their secrets and magic powers. Storytelling cues and questions encourage children to create their own bedtime tales.

As well as creating magical childhood memories, oral storytelling plays an important role in the development of a child’s creative mind, memory development and language skills. We believe that by encouraging children to be storytellers who are passionate about nature, we can help nurture a generation of responsible guardians for the planet.






The Enchanted Forest Quilted Blanket is made from super-soft 300 thread count organic cotton satin and stuffed with a bouncy organic cotton wadding that makes it unbelievably soft for young delicate skin. 

It measures 105 X 150cm and is perfect as a blanket or playmat for babies or as a duvet for toddlers and young children. 
 
Our Baby Character Cards accompany the quilted blanket and feature large black and white illustrations with lyrical descriptions of animal sounds and characteristics for parents to enjoy reading and learning with their young children.



 


Bring a touch of treetop magic to your child's bedroom with our Hammock Hangers cushion. Made from soft organic cotton the beautifully illustrated hammock continues off the cushion with the hammock strings becoming playful ribbons. On the reverse you'll find two cheeky mouse tails.
The cushion measures 30cm X 60cm and has a hidden zip closure. Filler included.

Hand-embroidered by Sewa Delhi Ruaab women's cooperative, this exquisitely detailed wall hanging brings Forivor's characters to life and makes a stylish addition to nurseries and children's bedrooms (but you don't need a child as an excuse to have one in your home)!



Both the Enchanted Forest Duvet Set and the Quilted Blanket are presented in our hardwearing organic cotton Forivor Suitcase (as shown in the animation at the top). In the suitcase you'll find Character Cards encased in their own sturdy cotton canvas zip-up pouch.

The Forivor suitcase was designed to reduce throwaway packaging and can be used as a first sleepover bag or for play. 



At the heart of Forivor’s philosophy is a commitment to supporting and inspiring the protection of our natural world and all the wildlife that belongs to it, while providing an opportunity to learn and explore our imaginations. 
Forivor’s bedding is designed to last and be passed from one generation to the next, taking some of the stories that have been told with it and creating a legacy of imaginative creative thinkers who are passionate about the planet.
Forivor’s bedding is produced in India by an award-winning factory using rain-fed cotton from small landholders without the use of toxic pesticides that are harmful to human health and wildlife - reducing carbon emissions and helping to protect the natural world we have been inspired by and its future for our children. 
Our Character Cards are printed in Oxford by an award-winning and innovative environmental printer.


We need to raise £5,000 to produce our first collection and get started on our journey, and we can only do it with YOUR help! We have final samples from our partners in India that we are very happy with and know you are going to love. 
In addition to our signature designs that we have featured here, we have also developed a broader collection of repeat prints and patterns across a wider range of interiors products - £5,000 will help us get one step closer to producing these and future collections based on at-risk habitats that we would like to draw attention to with our unique concept.

The textiles industry is the 5th largest contributor to carbon emissions in the US and is responsible for devastating human rights and environmental abuses globally. By supporting Forivor you are helping to grow the market share of organic textiles and as such provide a more sustainable future for people and planet. Please take a look at our website for more information.

Everything is ready to go for the production of our first collection. We've checked our colours, our stitching, the quality of craftsmanship, road tested our products with kids of all ages and gone back to the drawing board a few times. 
We are now 100% happy and confident we have a product which parents and children are going to love. As soon as we pay for our production we have to wait three months for our boxes of duvets and blankets to be produced and one month for them to be slow shipped (to save carbon) from India - then we can send them on to you and start selling on our online shop and to retailers. 
And we'll have you to thank for helping us get our business off the ground!

The idea for Forivor, which is named after Rebecca's father Ivor, came to Rebecca after trying and failing to write a story for her goddaughter and coincidentally trying (and failing) to find beautiful organic bedding. She was inspired by her childhood growing up without electricity on the Welsh borders as well as her work with iconic British designer Katharine Hamnett and the Environmental Justice Foundation. Alice's detailed and evocative drawings were the perfect partner for this unique concept and so a dream team was formed. And we both just happen to love anything pickled and a certain shade of dusky pink.

story:
I'm starting a company.  With you.

The idea:

Your bucket list meets Groupon. You build your bucket list on our website, share it with your friends and family, and we connect you to local partners who can make your ambitions happen - easily, quickly, and at an incredible discount!

Whether it's learning to play guitar, learning to surf, or visiting Europe, WetterFeet will make it easy to find friends to do it with and partners who can help you do it cheaply!

This is your chance to be part of a start-up without having to quit your day job.  In addition to helping pick a name, vote on website design, and helping on many other aspects, you can also be the first to try out the service and take classes with our first partners (paid for by me!).

So please, let me buy you a burrito and join the 500 Burrito Project.  (Don't want a burrito?  Just go to:  http://alpha.wetterfeet.com and plug in your e-mail to be a part of the project!)

Why $5 bucks?

I just want to get a burrito with you!  Mostly, I just want you to be a part of this journey, so if you don't like burritos or you'd rather be out catching a wave or skiing a slope than having lunch with me, just throw a couple bucks in the kitty for support!

What you'll get:

* For every $5 you donate (maxiumum $25), I will buy you a burrito, in person, sometime in the future.  Or not.  Up to you!

* More importantly, behind-the-scenes access to helping shape a company from the ground up! You'll be an armchair entrepreneur and the first to see new features and shape the future of the company!

What I'll Get:

* Your feedback and support! I'll be sending out e-mails with the latest on what I'm doing and getting your feedback on everything from website design, what to call the company, how to market the company, what customers to go after...everything!

* When we launch, you will receive exclusive perks as founding adventurers including priority access to deals, a personal adventure concierge for you and one friend to help you achieve your bucket list, and lots more!

 

I can't do this alone, so I'm recruiting my most important friends and family to join me and experience the crazy adventure of doing something you've never done from the ground up...all from the comfort of your laptop or mobile device.

Most of you know, if I'm good at anything it's doing insane things with no prior experience and making them happen! (see: sailing around Asia having never set foot on a boat before).

 

Don't Have $5 bucks?

Or don't trust the interwebs?  No worries.  You can still play along:

  • Go to:  http://alpha.wetterfeet.com and enter your e-mail to be in the loop!

story:
Tina's History

When my sister Tina's aneurysm burst 20 years ago she was married with a two-year-old daughter.  She went through brain surgery and extensive rehab but she still cannot use her left arm and has diminished use of her left foot.  Soon she was divorced and lost custody of their daughter but she didn't give up.  Tina has a small home and works at various part-time jobs to supplement her disability check.  She is a loving, generous person that always shares with others in need but now she needs help herself.

Her Need:

Tina needs a car to get to work.  She believes $3000 will be enough to cover the funding fees and buy an older car and insurance.  She already has the handicap equipment to accommodate her needs and friends to install it so that will not be an extra expense.  We know many are struggling, but any gift amount will be appreciated.  If she does not reach the entire goal, she will still be thankful for whatever funds are given and they will still be applied to a used car.

You can make a difference!

Whether you can contribute or not, you can still help! Would you please use Indiegogo's convenient share tools to share this campaign with your friends?  We will be grateful for whatever help you can give!

Thank You!

story:
About Us

Southern Papercraft is a homegrown Southern company that specializes in handmade wedding invitations as well as printable invitations for any event. Invitations are a commemoration of special celebrations and also the first glimpse of your event that guests will get. We have worked hard to streamline the wedding invitation ordering process with our innovative suite packages that make pricing and customizing a suite easy.

The owner, Christine decided to take her love of weddings and turn it into a business! She was selling simple invitations on Etsy when she was asked if a Save the Date that she designed came with invitations and RSVP's. Although that customer never purchased invitations, Christine got the notion that she wanted to design invitations! One day later, Southern Papercraft was born, the domain was registered and Christine hasn't looked back since! 

Help make achieving her dream easier by donating to help her buy supplies for the business!

What We Need

We are still a small company and have been funded so far directly out of the pocket of our college student owner, Christine. This has caused her a few sleepless nights, but this company really makes her happy, so she keeps on keepin on.

What your money will buy us:

  • $200 will go to web hosting for 3 years through Bluehost.com. We are currently on a free trial from 1and1.com and hate it.
  • $50 will go to a PayPal plugin for our website, so we can sell our invitations online!
  • $600 will go towards a bridal show exhibitors booth (fees, samples, decor, set up, gas to get there, etc). I haven't decided which one yet, but bridal shows are the best way to get out there and find brides!
  • $200 will go to a new printer, so that we don't have to rely on FedEx Office. Because their prints suck. We are looking to purchase this beautiful machine here.
  • $100 will go towards ink for the printer. I was a Girl Scout, I like to be prepared.
  • $50 will go towards paper and envelopes. Sometimes I'll be getting plain cardstock, sometimes sparkly cardstock and sometimes specialty papers from a sweet local store in Dallas called Paper Arts.
  • $50 will go to any other associated taxes/fees/shipping costs that will comes with the above purchases as well as any extras that might come up along the way. That whole preparedness thing again. Is that a word? IT IS NOW.

Read more about what the money is going to on my blog.

The Impact

For me to have my own printer in my house (so that I can create invitations WHENEVER I WANT!) would be amazing.

Currently I am running back and forth to FedEx Office, getting dissapointed with the print quality and coming back home to adjust the colors and going back to get the prints. Very annoying. And did you know they charge me $1.25 per print?!

Having my own printer (and one that is paid for!) would significantly allow me to lower my costs per invitation suite and thusly attract more buyers! 

Read more about what the impact would be on my blog.

I need business, so the main chunk of this campaign's funds will be going to an entry into a bridal show. I am looking for one that is popular, but not too expensive, so that we can still have an awesomely decorated booth! I have seen fees that range from $250-$1,400, so I will plan accordingly! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help, but can't contribute monetarily (probably because you are one of my college friends and also have no money) then PLEASE share this campaign on as many networks as you can! More eyes on our campaign will help!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read all of this. I know it's a lot. I also appreciate any help that you give to my little cause! :)

Other Notes

The printable invitations given away as perks in this campaign will consist of 2-3 proof versions of your invitation and 1 high resolution PDF and 1 high resolution JPEG emailed to you when they are completed. You are responsible for the printing of these documents and they do not come with envelopes.

The stationery/cards given away as perks consist of 2-3 proof versions emailed to you and the number of stationery/cards you have been awarded printed and mailed to you--with envelopes.

 

ALL SHIPPING IS INCLUDED IN PERK AMOUNT

story:
Our Story

In 2009, the US became unemployed.

A family of 6, 2 dogs and cat moved from Florida to Washington to start a new life.  The father was an unemployed General Contractor and the mom was an unemployed Economics teacher with a brand new MBA.  They had run out of choices, so they chose to move.

This is their story, this is my story.

We weren't the only ones devastated by a sudden shift in our comfy middle class lifestyle, a lot of others were in the same boat.

Unable to find employment in Washington, I decided to start making soap, terrifically natural, beautiful, abundantly fragranced soaps.

What started as coffee money is now providing a living for myself and helping another woman, Jody, a single mom of two.

As of today, Snohomish Soap products can be found in all 9 PCC's in the Seattle area and by mid-October, all 28 Haggen stores throughout the northwest.  In the spring, we'll be launching on Walmart.com.  

We have two markets we are targeting: Natural Markets like Whole Foods and PCC and National Retailers like Kroger, Walmart, and Walgreen's.  These 2 distinct markets have one type of customer in common!  Those customers who are looking for products produced locally and ethically!  These are what folks are calling “conscious consumers”

The problem is, how does a local, craft soap company scale, make a social impact (really important to us) and remain local.  We do it by building a national network of authentically local soap manufacturing sites with moms making soap from their homes.  Its a scalable, sustainable model.

These women will provide the manufacturing needs of the smaller regional retailers and for their community farmers markets.  That's where I started!  Its been a terrific way to connect to my community and build meaningful networks.  We'll stick with my branding, my packaging, my formula.  But, we'll brand it with "their" location...for example...Philly Soap Company, Tacoma Soap Company, etc.

The big retailers will continue to be supplied by our manufacturing site in the Puget Sound region.

The cost to get each site up and running is minimal, but we do need a vehicle for deliveries, training, etc.  Thats where you come in!

We're asking for $35,000 to get this amazingly simple "back on your feet" plan rolling..

Everyone uses soap, and almost anyone can make soap.  Would you throw in a little (or a lot) to help us get these struggling families moving towards recovery?   Its a WHOLE NEW MODEL and ITS GONNA WORK!

Thanks!

story:
Please donate and support this effort for the DiMartino family.  I have known a member of the family Gina for several years.  We have worked together previously, and I have met many members of this wonderful family.

They were unfortunate enough to be at the blast site of the Boston Marathon on April 15, 2013. 

Please donate to this cause to help with any related medical bills that they may come across.  As of the writing of this campaign, Gina was in surgery for leg injuries.  Her mother was running in the marathon and Gina was there to cheer her on.

Thanks to everyone for the support, and please spread the word.

 

Thanks to everyone that donated!!!
story_txt:
Please donate and support this effort for the DiMartino family.  I have known a member of the family Gina for several years.  We have worked together previously, and I have met many members of this wonderful family.
They were unfortunate enough to be at the blast site of the Boston Marathon on April 15, 2013.  
Please donate to this cause to help with any related medical bills that they may come across.  As of the writing of this campaign, Gina was in surgery for leg injuries.  Her mother was running in the marathon and Gina was there to cheer her on.
Thanks to everyone for the support, and please spread the word.
 
Thanks to everyone that donated!!!

story:
About the photo above: Children who had been in child care during a council meeting of parents, teachers, and staff entered the room as council was drawing to a close. We ended the meeting with a "children's council" lovingly witnessed by the adults.

A door opens...

I've been leading circles and council meetings for many years now. Council is a powerful way to contribute to the healing and repair of our broken culture. I've held council in many settings and have taught hundreds of people the foundations of council. This is the kind of work that I am born to do, and I do it well. 

Now I have an opportunity to take my work as a council leader to a new level. But I need help from you, my community.

About a month ago I received an email from a mentor who is one of the top international teachers and leaders of the Way of Council. She told me she is ready to pass the torch, and is looking for someone to step into her shoes. She was including me on the short list of those who she felt might be ready to do the job.

What an honor, to be recognized in this way by someone who is a personal hero and inspiration. 

But, she said, in order to have a shot at this, there are two things I must do. One was to attend the international Gathering of Council Carriers, which happened a couple of weeks ago. I was there. It was wonderful. 

This is where I need your help

My second task is to complete a weeklong intensive training that is for dedicated and experienced leaders of council. It is scheduled for mid-September. It's going to cost about $2500 to attend this training. 

I'm a freelance worker. I don't have a regular salary or a budget for training. The kind of work I do is vital to our times, but is not of a type that our culture rewards with salaried jobs and pensions plans. So I don't have financial resources to pay the cost of this training. I need your help. But it's not just about me...

Council can help our culture heal

If you've ever been in a council-style meeting you know how effectively council:

  • Encourages deep listening to others and to our own hearts.
  • Supports us in speaking our truths.
  • Helps heal hurts in their relationships.
  • Opens pathways to discover our deep wisdom.
  • Encourages deep connectedness among people and with the land and all its inhabitants.
  • Helps participants develop a very effective, ecologically-grounded, compassionate style of leadership.

After leading hundreds of council meetings in many settings, I've seen time and time again that there is deep power in this work. The Way of Council expresses perfectly the kind of shift in thinking and working together that we need if we are to become a truly just and sustainable culture.

How I will give back: A four-day training in council leadership

Besides continuing in my lifelong commitment to serving the cause of culture repair and community healing, I will give a four-day training in the art of council leadership.

  • This training will be open to anyone who contributes at any level. It will be held in Santa Rosa.
  • I will schedule it collaboratively with donors to maximize the numbers who can attend; those who cannot will be able to attend any of my daylong introduction to council trainings, which I give monthly. 
  • My goal is to consolidate my learning by giving it away immediately; and my vision is to seed our communities with a core group of council leaders who are themselves a community of change agents.  
  • This will be the same training I have taught at Sonoma State University, where tuition for the course costs over $350. My students there have unanimously agreed that the training is itself a profoundly rewarding and life-changing experience. 

If you contribute at the $50 level or more, and don't want to attend the training yourself, you may designate someone else to attend in your place.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe training in council leadership is not for you. Consider spreading the word about this campaign to others who might be interested. It's a great opportunity for teachers, organizational development consultants, group leaders, wilderness guides, pastors, and anyone else who is interested in helping groups communicate and function well.

If you know of a situation where a council-style meeting might be helpful, get in touch with me. Let's discuss what the options are. 

Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your support.

story:
Welcome to the Hojikoto Hojo Campaign

The purpose of this project is to begin a trade in the herbal tea kinkilibaa with the Barrow Kunda collective in West Africa. Kinkilibaa is a leaf that grows wild in the bush, and has been drunk for its taste and curative effects for generations in the Senegambia, Mali, Guinea, and beyond.  Our focus in the states will be marketing the tea in Madison, Wisconsin, but if it is successful, we hope to expand the market for kinkilibaa to other regions of the United States.

Why Kinkilibaa?

Peanuts have been grown in the Gambia since at least the 1600's, and they have been the primary cash crop in The Gambia since the British colonial government instituted them as such during the 19th century.  Today, however, a mold that grows on Gambian peanuts contains a chemical called aflatoxin which is believed to have a number of detrimental effects to health. (Put under heading of "Why Kinkilibaa?")

As a result, the peanuts that small-time famers in The Gambia grow are not able to be sold to a broad global market. The Gambian government buys them in the hope of selling them to neighboring West African states or Asian markets, often at a loss.  A common goal of foreign development agencies is to develop new products to increase trade opportunities for Gambian farmers.  Examples of such products are shea butter, cashews, and honey, yet these all require much more time, money, and expertise than the average Gambian farmer possesses--including the farmers in Barrow Kunda. 

Kinkilibaa, on the other hand, grows wild and is easily cultivated, harvested, and dried with local methods.  It weighs very little, so it is easy to transport, and  a number of kinkilibaa groves already exist within walking distance of Barrow Kunda. 

How I got interested in kinkilibaa

I'm Brendan Loula, and the idea for this project stems from my time as a Peace Corps volunteer serving in Barrow Kunda, The Gambia, from 2008-2011.  During my service, I had the pleasure of working with the Village Development committee, women's groups, and many enterprising community members on a variety of small health and development projects.  However, one of the biggest frustrations I came away with after my service was the lack of financial opportunities for Gambians. 

I was introduced to kinkilibaa not for its value as a tea, but for the value of its wood in making tools.  I wanted to make a musical instrument called a berimbau (I play capoeira- that's a whole other story), and my friend Mamadi told me that kinkilibaa  wood would offer the best combination of flexibility and strength.  We went out and harvested a couple straight limbs from a huge grove of trees, and Mamadi cut off some leaves and small branches as well.  When we returned to his house and stripped the limbs of bark, Mamadi's wife Sira brewed the leaves and branches into a tea.  I am a tea drinker in general, but I was somewhat wary of bush teas, as many of them that I had tried tended to have an unpleasant, medicinal taste.  This, however, was mellow and sweet, and I drank the cup down pretty quickly.  After that, I regularly harvested kinkilibaa for myself, as well as drinking it with my friends and host family for special occasions, such as Ramadan and Eid-al-Adha. 

Since returning to the states, I have remained in contact with my friends in Barrow Kunda, and I have been thinking about kinkilibaa as a commercial product for some time.  After spending a couple years thinking about it, I decided it was time take a shot at bringing this product to the states in the hopes of establishing another commodity for trade with The Gambia (with regular availability of the tea for myself being an extra perk). 

    

What are we going to do with the money that you donate?

The money will go towards two things: first funding the initial trip to The Gambia to communicate with village leaders. This is vital to the success of the project, as social expectations in The Gambia mandate that you must seek proper permissions before doing business.  During the trip we will also set up some basic infrastructure, and finding the best, least expensive transport routes. Second, the money will be used for packaging and an advertising campaign here in Madison.

If we don't reach our funding goal, we will still use the funds we receive to try to work the shipping out remotely with the contacts we have on the ground in The Gambia.  However, for cultural and logistical reasons, doing the negotiations and planning on site is preferable. 

What is the final result?

Simple.  You get continued access to a great new tea product, and the members of the Barrow Kunda collective get a new opportunity to make money, making everyone's lives better.  If the project continues to be successful, will expand operations in the US and set up other cooperatives in The Gambia, and maybe even Senegal.  

 


If you are really strapped for cash, but still want to help:

- Use the sharing tools attached to this site to spread the word!  Feel free to share the project with anyone who is interested.

- If you are in the Madison area, get in touch with me to see about upcoming promotional events.  We can always use more interested friends!  

My e-mail is joeloula@gmail.com

story:
Great news for our Recovery through Recreation campaign! Two of Hillsides most ardent champions of creating lasting change in the lives of children, Tori and Al Mordecai, have agreed to support the campaign by matching all funds up to $2,500. Help support the cause, and remember any contribution you make will be matched dollar for dollar by the Mordecai family. Spread the word and share with your friends and family.

Hillsides is a 501(c) (3) non-profit dedicated to improving the overall well-being and functioning of vulnerable children, youth, and their families. Our vision is to create lasting change in the lives of the children and youth we serve.

 At Hillsides we take pride in developing and implementing programs that give our children increased chances at stability, happiness, and an improved quality of life both now and in the future. 

The children in our Residential Treatment Services at Hillsides come from backgrounds of extreme poverty, neglect, and trauma. These factors affect the children in adverse ways, ranging from a lack of empathy and social skills to an inability to express emotions in an appropriate manner.

All children have developmental needs that when met increase their chances for success and happiness. Sadly, our children come from backgrounds where these needs were not met. As a result they have started their lives at a developmental deficit.  It is our job to do everything that we can to improve their lives, both in the short and long term.

This project will enable us to help meet the developmental needs of the children by giving them structure and limits as well as having them engage in positive social interactions with staff and peers in a safe, controlled environment. Adding games, equipment, and entertainment features to our bare-bones recreation center will enable us to develop incentive programs tailored to meet the specific needs of each individual child.  It will also increase the children’s physical activity and help them gain a sense of competence and achievement.  Mastering new physical challenges will lead to increased self-esteem, self-concept, and confidence. As children experiment with their successes and failures, they learn to trust themselves and others.  

That is why we are asking for your help in equipping our recreation center. This is one step in helping us confront various issues affecting our children, ranging from obesity and low self-esteem to behavioral and developmental challenges. In building up our recreation center, we will have an added tool to use in the children's therapeutic rehabilitation.

By contributing to our campaign, you will have a direct and profound impact on the development and improvement of all at-risk youth under our care. Ultimately, your contributions to our Indiegogo campaign will benefit not only the children and their families but be a net positive for society as a whole.  

Helping us fund this project will be helping us build better tomorrows.

Our funding goal is $5,000. Below is the breakdown of where the money will be going.

  • Ping Pong Table
  • Foosball Table
  • Air Hockey Table
  • 2 Desktop Computers
  • Wii with 4 Controls
  • X-Box One
  • 3 Bean Bags
  • 2 Round tables
  • Dry Erase Easel
  • Gym Equipment
  • 50 inch T.V.
  • An Acoustic Guitar
  • Djembe
  • Assorted Team- building games/activities

If we don't reach our goal, we will spend whatever has been donated to get us as close to our vision as possible.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

The Hillsides Recreation Department

story:
UPDATES: As of October 2014, we have successfully donated 25 laptops!


Who We Are and What We Do

TechBridge is entirely student run. We are a high school volunteer group in the San Francisco Bay Area. Our mission is simple: to equip highly motivated foster children with computer hardware to help them pursue higher education and employment opportunities. This all began with our founder, Jennifer Kao, who is now a sophomore at University of California, Berkeley.

You might wonder why a group of high school kids want to help children. Nowadays, most schools require the use of computers for homework, like projects and essays. We know. We want to help students from low-income families and communities that don’t have access to computers because we know how hard it is to keep up with school and homework without one. 

Additionally, we found that it was easier for foster youth to stay connected and find more opportunities if they had access and knew at least the basics with things like Word Doc, PowerPoint and Email. This would help level out the inequality and provide foster youth with more options and equal opportunity to further their educational or occupational career.

Each week, we have student volunteers come in to help out at Green Citizen. GreenCitizen is an eco-waste center that recycles electronic items in the United States under stringent environmental and health regulations. The hours we earn go toward donating laptops to the foster youth in our area.

We’ve also organized events to connect with foster youth. An Easter InnVision (a shelter home in South San Francisco) event was held where we were able to donate toys and stationary to children there. But, more importantly, it was inspiring to play with the children there and see them have fun.

Why, with the volunteer hours, do we still need funding? Other than funds that will go toward more events where we can connect with foster youth, we are also trying to expand our horizons. Recently, we have started to partner up with a local grade school with children who have virtually no access to technology and are new immigrants here in the Bay Area. We want to provide these children with Raspberry Pi(s), which are small computer boards that are relatively inexpensive. However, these smart, small devices require peripherals that need to be accounted for as well. Your contributions will go directly towards these two projects.

So, What Happens?

Each part of your donation will go towards supporting our new project as well as events such as our Easter InnVision event this coming Spring (May 2015). Your donation will also go towards setting up a new computer lab at a local school with tablets and Raspberry Pi(s) to get the kids there oriented with technology. Every little sum counts and would immensely help us in expanding our horizons and connecting with our community. We hope that in doing so, we are able to provide equal opportunities to future workers and job hunters with skills necessary to succeed.

How (Else) You Could Support Us

Thank you for reviewing our campaign, and we hope you support us even by making a donation. 

Other ways you could get involved in bridging the technological divide would be to spread the word about our volunteer group and, if your teen lives in the Bay Area, they could help out as a volunteer, too! Check out our website for more details: http://techbridgeinitiative.wordpress.com

story:
Hello Everyone!

For those who know me I am not one to readily ask for anything, almost ever, but this is something that would be of good use to me and I really need. Right now I'm using two laptops which are currently not mine, which is working but not the best situation since both laptops are always also needed by their owners. 

Also, as many of you know, I'm leaping into an endeavor to start my own business in the e-commerce sector, namely lingerie. yes, I know, I don't exactly exude sex appeal, but I believe lingerie just isn't about that. I'm very excited to delve into this and the other millions of things I would love to do with life, but its becoming more and more difficult without having my own laptop.

Since my birthday is coming up really soon (October 4), any contribution towards this gift would mean the world to me! 

Now I do feel weird making this all about me, so I've decided that whatever amount made above the goal amount all will go to an organization I've been volunteering with, Room to Grow. I have seen first hand how they are helping low income parents help their children by providing social services, books, clothing, and baby items during the first 3 years of the baby's life. 

I ESPECIALLY love that they give each child at least 6-7 books every appointment until the child leaves, giving that child about 130 books by the time he/she graduates from the program! Check them out at www.roomtogrow.org.

What Is Needed: 

So with the amount raised this is what I would receive:

  • MacBook Pro 
  • Software for daily and professional use (i.e. Microsoft Office, Adobe CS6)
  • Printer
  • AppleCare Protection Plan 
  • Indiegogo fees.
  • If the goal is not reached, whatever is reached will still go towards the laptop. Everyone will still get updates on when the laptop is purchased and pics! Again any money made above the goal will be given to Room to Grow (minus Indiegogo fees).
  • You would all receive my undying gratitude if this happens!

The Impact

With a new laptop, I would be able to put in more hours and be more efficient at what I am doing. Hopefully sooner than later you would be able to see the fruits of my work.

Thank you for helping my birthday be the best! 

Thank You!
story_txt:
Hello Everyone!
For those who know me I am not one to readily ask for anything, almost ever, but this is something that would be of good use to me and I really need. Right now I'm using two laptops which are currently not mine, which is working but not the best situation since both laptops are always also needed by their owners. 
Also, as many of you know, I'm leaping into an endeavor to start my own business in the e-commerce sector, namely lingerie. yes, I know, I don't exactly exude sex appeal, but I believe lingerie just isn't about that. I'm very excited to delve into this and the other millions of things I would love to do with life, but its becoming more and more difficult without having my own laptop.
Since my birthday is coming up really soon (October 4), any contribution towards this gift would mean the world to me! 
Now I do feel weird making this all about me, so I've decided that whatever amount made above the goal amount all will go to an organization I've been volunteering with, Room to Grow. MacBook Pro

Printer
AppleCare Protection Plan 
Indiegogo fees.
If the goal is not reached, whatever is reached will still go towards the laptop. Everyone will still get updates on when the laptop is purchased and pics! Again any money made above the goal will be given to Room to Grow (minus Indiegogo fees).
You would all receive my undying gratitude if this happens!



The Impact

Thank You!

story:
Help Yeyo and Aerin go to Giftival

Your dear friends, Aerin Dunford and Sergio Beltrán (aka "the Yeyo") have been invited to participate in GIFTIVAL, an incredible gathering of friends and practitioners of gift culture. The event takes place in just one month, from October 11 - 14th in Istanbul, Turkey.

Here's a brief summary of the encounter:

GIFTIVAL is a 5-day collective inquiry/gathering/festival for visionaries and practitioners from around the world exploring new economies and gift culture. Those of us who are committed to living in and bringing forth a gifting paradigm believe it is time for us to celebrate our work, to share our stories and to deepen our learning and understanding of the gift and its place for us.

Sharing our Gifts

Our gracious hosts in Turkey* have offered to cover our on-the-ground expenses during the gathering. But we need your help to get there. We seek 10 generous souls who can gift $100USD each to cover our airline tickets to Istanbul. (Of course you may offer less if you'd like ; )

We do not offer anything in particular in return--as this would be quite obviously be more of the same business-as-usual, "transaction culture" predominant in these times.

Instead, what we promise is that each person who makes an offering to our campaign will recieve a surprise gift of some kind between November 2013 and October 2014.

The Impact

Sergio and Aerin deeply believe that the inquiry into gift culture, grounded in real-life experiments taking place around the world, is one of the most important conversations we can have at this time. As we chose to walk out of ways of living that are dependent on endless growth, consumption and cycles of debt and scarcity, we must learn to live our futures now. Giftival offers us the opportunity to do just that. Please support this conversation and practice.

Çok teşekkür ederim!
Aerin + Yeyo

* Thanks to Filiz Telek, Manish Jain, Dick Durning, Lina Cramer, and Ayşegül Güzel for making Giftival possible!

story:
Who We Are and What We Need

Food Roots is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to building the local food system on the North Coast of Oregon. During our seven years of existence, demand for fresh, nutritious and delicious, North Coast grown food has increased significantly. In an effort to meet this demand and expand the regional food system, Food Roots is preparing to embark on our most ambitious project yet: North Coast Grown. This program will increase specialty crop production here on the North Coast by providing local farmers and farm workers with education, networking, and a suite of tools to both increase sales and production for existing farmers and to help establish new farms.

The core of North Coast Grown—and the crucial first step of the program—resides in the construction and use of three 30' x 96' High Tunnel Hoop Houses. These three hoop houses will provide nearly 9,000 square feet of indoor growing space. This space will be available to local farmers, will increase year-round production of fresh, local fruits and vegetables, and will provide a demonstration and training site for new and existing farmers. In the long term, these hoop houses will serve as the base upon which we plan to build a local farm incubator program.

Construction of these hoop houses will cost $78,000 in total. However, due to strong community and institutional support, we already have $71,000 of the funds committed. All we need from you is the final $7,000 in matching funds that will make this entire project happen. With the $7,000 we plan to raise via this campaign, we'll be able to release the additional $71,000 in funding from our various partners, build three High Tunnel Hoop Houses, and begin to implement the ambitious North Coast Grown project.


North Coast Grown: The Full Details

Of course, building the hoop houses is just the critical first step of the entire North Coast Grown project. The $7,000 we raise here, in other words, will not just build these three hoop houses, but will initiate the entire, 21-month North Coast Grown project, which is budgeted at approximately $240,000 and includes the $78,000 to build the hoop houses, a $99,997 grant via the United States Department of Agriculture Specialty Crop Block Grant Program, and support and funding from Food Roots, the Port of Tillamook Bay, and a variety of other local and regional community partners. What that means is that, if we can raise just $7,000 during this campaign, we'll be able to implement a nearly quarter million dollar project to grow and support the regional food system along the North Coast of Oregon.

How will this work? Well, during its initial 21-month phase, North Coast Grown will increase specialty crop production—specifically, fresh fruits, vegetables, and medicinal and culinary herbs—here on the North Coast by providing local farmers and farm workers with a number of new tools and support programs, including:

  • Education and training for farmers and farm workers in production, marketing, and business practices
  • Access to hoop house space for year-round specialty crop production
  • On-the-job training in agricultural occupations for both youth and adults
  • Access to a matched savings program to provide money for starting a farm or food business
  • A land bank database to match new farmers with local land available for lease or sale
  • A tool bank to share hand tools and farm equipment among local farmers
  • And an online marketplace to match local farmers with food buyers, wholesalers, distributors, and suppliers
All these tools, put together, will improve the economic viability of local farms by helping them to grow more food, open new markets, build connections and support within the local community, find customers, gain affordable access to land and tools, and increase the availability of local and skilled labor. Small-scale farming is a challenge; the North Coast Grown project aims to make it less challenging, more accessible, and more profitable for our North Coast farmers.


The Full Impact of Your Contribution

The North Coast Grown project is an incredible opportunity and a chance to make a huge impact with a comparatively small contribution. Once we've raised $7,000 in matching funds, we can release the additional $71,000 to build the three High Tunnel Hoop Houses. Once we've built those hoop houses, we will be able to implement the full, $240,000 North Coast Grown program. In other words, if we can raise $7,000 here, we'll leverage it to implement a 21-month, $240,000 project that will significantly support and grow the local food system here on the North Coast of Oregon—and that, ultimately, we will work to build into a local farm incubator program. We can essentially multiply your contribution 30+ times over. But we can only do that if we receive your contribution in the first place. We're not asking you to fund this entire program. We already have an incredible amount of community support and committed dollars. All we're asking is for that final amount to push us over the edge, release over $200,000 in additional funding and support, and begin to provide a wealth of tools and assistance to our current and future farmers here on the North Coast.

To contribute, click the red "Contribute Now" button at the bottom of this page. If you prefer to mail in your contribution, you can do so at this mailing address:

Food Roots
PO Box 1275
Tillamook, OR 97141

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends and family. Spread the word about this project on Facebook, on Twitter, on whatever social media platform you're on. Even—especially—if it's that old one, where you talk to people with real, audible words, face to face. Tell them why you think this is a good project. Tell them why local food matters and why they should support it, wherever they are.

If you feel compelled, "like" Food Roots on Facebook. Visit our website. Get involved.

We hope you'll donate. We hope you'll spread the word about North Coast Grown and encourage others to donate. But there's something else you can do, too, and it's incredibly important. You can support your local food system.

Grow a garden. Shop at a farmers market. Join a CSA. Volunteer at a local farm. Buy your food from local farmers. Cook your own meals, from whole ingredients, from scratch, whenever you can. Eat local, eat seasonal. Play in the kitchen; make yogurt, or butter, or your own granola, or bake something. Pickle, preserve, or can something from your garden or from a local farm. Play in the dirt; grow some of your own food, show your friends and family your garden, teach your children that playing in the dirt is a lifelong affair, that it's integral, that it will make them happy and healthy. Never forget that food nourishes you, that it's the base of your health, and understand how broad that concept goes. Remember the degree to which food is at the root of everything, and act accordingly.

Thank you.

story:
Dear reader,

We are the Ottawa-Outaouais Industrial Workers of the World, a small member-run branch of the larger international I.W.W. (AKA Wobblies).

We've started a crowd-funding campaign to raise funds for organizing and fighting for labour justice in Ottawa. Over the past several years we have met with workers, both members and non-members, who were dealing with wage theft, which is a wide-spread problem experienced mostly by non-unionized workers across the province, and worked with them to help reclaim their hard-earned wages from employers who violate the Employment Standards Act (examples: 1, 2, 3).

We take these cases on strongly guided by the principles of solidarity, direct action, and worker empowerment. Currently we are working on a case involving an unfair and unjust firing.

All our work is done by members on a voluntary basis.

We will be using the funds we receive for legal fees, sign-making equipment, photocopying, mailing, etc. All these things which allow us to run efficient campaigns and challenge unfair labour status quo, one case at a time.

All that being said, check out our perks!

In addition to the book perk:

We have an extensive collection of books on radical labour topics, let us know if something else sparks your interest and we'll try to get it to you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone,

First of all I would like to thank you for giving your time to read this, and understand the difficulty my sister and her family are going through.

My sister, and her family (her husband and (almost) 2 year old son) have lived in Calgary for a few years as well as myself. Her husband works in construction, and has for quite a number of years. He lost his job about 4 months ago, and was forced to find another job - as you may know, Calgary isn't the most job booming city right now, and especially not at this time. As a result, he was forced to accept a job that would require him to be away from home, in Regina, A LOT of the time, I mean 3 or 4 weeks out of the month, not only is this hard on him - but even harder for my sister to raise the baby alone and not have her partner there with her each and every night. In an effort to hopefully change this as it had become too much for my sister to bear, he was able to get on a job for the same company but in Edmonton. Well Edmonton is at least in Alberta, and isn't too far from Calgary - so they decided they would make the move to Edmonton from Calgary as they could be together every night, and he would be able to see his son everyday. My sister was ecstatic - this is what she had dreamed of for years since he started working Construction, to be able to see him every single night like most couples.

They began searching for a house in Edmonton at the begging of May when they decided to make the big move. They searched and searched and had troubles finding a house within their price range that was large enough for them, when finally they came across one house - it was perfect, the perfect size, a new area, fairly new and affordable! The only problem was they wanted a short term tenant. After my sister got into contact with the "homeowners", and explained the situation asking if they would be willing to sign a longer term lease (as they were looking for 1 or 2 month terms), they had agreed as they were expecting a child and thought it would be easier to have a long term tenant rather than a short term tenant. Because my sisters husband works away, he was away working with the vehicle and my sister was organizing the move while he was working - she was unable to actually go and see the place physically. The landlords sent lots of pictures, we had looked at it on google street view, and it was a very nice house. The "landlords" then contacted my sister saying they had ended up in the hospital with complications in the pregnancy but were released - and had an appt in Calgary in the coming days and brought up the idea that they could meet for coffee to exchange the keys when they came to Calgary. Everything about this seemed to legit, and real. They then sent a lease to my sister and asked her to sign it, return it, and they would sign it and return it to her as well with both signatures - and to also email transfer her the damage deposit (2100$) so they would guarantee it was theirs and begin making moving plans. So she did.

She sent it all, signed and everything. She had still kept in contact with my sister following this - but never returned the signed lease. They were supposed to gain possession of the house on May 22, 2014 and gave notice to their current landlords that they would be leaving the 22nd of May, and had theirs utilities shut off for that day as well. Everything was a go, until the night of May 21st - they received an email from the "landlords" saying the basement sump had flooded and renovations needed to be completed before they could move and gave them a new possession date of June 1, 2014. They still loaded everything into a trailer, and sent it to Edmonton to sit until moving day, as they had to leave their current home. Since that night, they have had no communication with the supposed "landlords" and all attempts to communicate have failed. My sister had a friend whom lives in Edmonton go to the address they were given, and knock on the door to see who was there, if anyone. To her surprise, an elderly women answered the door. She explained to the lady what was going on, and what had happened and that their address is being given out and someone is supposed to move in. She had absolutely no idea about it, and said they have lived there for a few years and had no intentions on moving.

This is when we realized it was all a scam. My sister and her family are now lost, scared and worried. They have an almost 2 year old son who needs a stable home to be in, and they need the comfort of a home. Right now, they are couch surfing as they are stranded with no money, and no home.

It is truly disgusting, and sickening to think there is people in this world who will go through such lengths, and cause so much sorrow in someones life simply because they cannot contribute by working or other means. It is so sad. I'm just a student myself, our parents do not have a lot of money - and we feel so trapped. We are in this together, we're family.

By contributing to reaching this 4,000$ goal, you would be changing their life - seriously. I would be forever grateful, as would they. This money will strictly be put towards a damage deposit towards a new home, and the first months rent at a new home so they are able to get back on their feet and provide all the love and care their little boy, and my nephew needs. I realize we all live paycheck to paycheck in this crazy world, but anything will help.

And again, thank you so much - from the bottom of my heart.

Dylan Forseth

What We Need & What You Get

I am aiming to raise a total of 4,000$ CAD. This money will be put towards a damage deposit for a new home, and the first months rent.

This will allow them to get back on their feet and provide the care for their son. You will have the satisfaction of knowing you have made a significant impact on someone's life, and future.

The Impact

This amount of money could be the difference between homelessness and being able to live comfortably. This act done upon such innocent people is so disturbing, and I hope as a community we can help someone who has lost everything for absolutely no reason, or explanation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, please invite your friends and family - anyone you know to read the story and contribute you all make a difference, and your all amazing!

Share, Share, Share!

If you have any questions, need clarification or ANYTHING - please do not hesitate to message me. Thank you again.
