My sister and her family are now lost, scared and worried. They have an almost 2 year old son who needs a stable home to be in, and they need the comfort of a home. Right now, they are couch surfing as they are stranded with no money, and no home.It is truly disgusting, and sickening to think there is people in this world who will go through such lengths, and cause so much sorrow in someones life simply because they cannot contribute by working or other means. It is so sad. I'm just a student myself, our parents do not have a lot of money - and we feel so trapped. We are in this together, we're family.By contributing to reaching this 4,000$ goal, you would be changing their life - seriously. I would be forever grateful, as would they. This money will strictly be put towards a damage deposit towards a new home, and the first months rent at a new home so they are able to get back on their feet and provide all the love and care their little boy, and my nephew needs. I realize we all live paycheck to paycheck in this crazy world, but anything will help. And again, thank you so much - from the bottom of my heart.Dylan ForsethWhat We Need & What You GetI am aiming to raise a total of 4,000$ CAD. This money will be put towards a damage deposit for a new home, and the first months rent.This will allow them to get back on their feet and provide the care for their son. You will have the satisfaction of knowing you have made a significant impact on someone's life, and future. The ImpactThis amount of money could be the difference between homelessness and being able to live comfortably. This act done upon such innocent people is so disturbing, and I hope as a community we can help someone who has lost everything for absolutely no reason, or explanation. Other Ways You Can HelpPlease, please invite your friends and family - anyone you know to read the story and contribute you all make a difference, and your all amazing! Share, Share, Share!If you have any questions, need clarification or ANYTHING - please do not hesitate to message me. Thank you again.

story:
Join our primate family!

Be part of the first family owned craft brewery in Fairfax County started by a primate born & raised in Fairfax County!

Twinpanzee Brewing Co: Craft beer brewed by primates with discerning taste and style.

Join the primate family! Twinpanzee Brewing Co is the first family owned craft brewery in Fairfax County started by a primate born & raised in Fairfax County!  Our nano brewery will be just that; a small scale brewery using a 1.5 BBL (approximately 47 gallons) system that will serve craft beer in our own tasting room.  We're cashing in our 401Ks, taking out loans, pooling our savings and self-funding so we can bring you small artisan batches of craft beer using the highest quality ingredients and years of brewing knowledge.  Our love of unique flavor combinations will bring some of the most distinctively delicious brews you'll ever try!

So who are the folks behind Twinpanzee Brewing Co?  We're made up of just four people.

  • Antonio: Head Primate & Brewer - A true local that was born, raised and schooled in the Fairfax County area.  Father of twins who is constantly amazed and inspired by his boys. He'll use his years of "researching" many many beers and home brewing to create some of the tastiest brews you'll ever enjoy. Promise!

  • Maha: Momma Primate & Assistant Brewer - Amazing super mom, world class chef with a phenomenal palate. She loves bold flavors and will use her culinary palate to create some of the most amazing beer recipes.

  • Adan: Twin Primate "A" - Our little teddy bear who single-handedly came up with the name "Twinpanzee".  He loves singing, drawing, books and anything Lego related.

  • Zachary: Twin Primate "Z" - The athletic little man of our family who has big plans for the brewery including a Lego play area for visiting kids and in-house made root beer. He enjoys drawing, swimming, silly jokes and building massive Lego structures.

Our twin primate boys are our inspiration and the four of us are working hard to bring you the BEST craft beer in Northern VA. 

Here's how YOU can join our primate family: Because we're self-funding our nano brewery, we really need you to join our primate family with a pledge. Each pledge will bring us closer to our 1st goal of $15K.  The more people you can recruit to join our family, the faster we can zooooom from $15K to our ambitious $100K goal.  We're a bit ambitious, but the more pledges we receive, the more craft beer we'll be able to brew for you.  Here's how the Twinpanzee Brewing Co plans will change as we hit each of our goals:

**** Current Donation Level ****

Goal #1 - $15K

Reaching our first goal will mean that we will be able to build out and open our nano brewery with a 1.5 barrel brewing system and 2-3 fermenters.  Due to the small size and limited funding, our tasting room will be open only one day a week.  Although $15K is a great starting point, we're confident that as more VA craft beer fans join our primate family we will move far beyond this first goal.  At this point the head primate will send all members of our primate family a handwritten "Thank You" note and will add all primate family members to a list where you'll be part of special offers, discounts and "family only" events.

Goal #2 - $50K

$50K will allow us to open our tasting room for a total of two days a week as the extra funds would allow us to purchase additional fermenters, brite tanks and kegs to increase our capacity.  We would continue using the 1.5 barrel brewing system and would brew everyday to keep up with the increased demand (because you will loooove our beer!).  Upon hitting the $50K mark, the head primate will do a happy dance and will:
- Send out hand written "Thank You" notes to members of our primate family
- Create a special "thank you" video for primate family members
- Share two (2) of our favorite all-grain recipes to brew your own Twinpanzee brew
- Add all primate family members to a list where you'll be part of special offers, discounts and "family only" events.

Goal #3 - $75K

Reaching the $75K mark would ensure that we could comfortably open our tasting room at least three days a week and supply enough beer to all our thirsty patrons. The additional funds would allow us to purchase larger fermenters (3 BBL) for brewing double batches on our 1.5 BBL system. The additional fermenters would also allow us to brew some Triples or Lagers which require longer fermentation time. When we hit the $75K goal, the entire primate family will do a happy dance and the head primate will:
- Send out hand written "Thank You" notes to all members of our primate family
- Create a special "thank you" video for primate family members
- Share a total of three (3) all-grain recipes to brew your own Twinpanzee brew
- Add all primate family members to a list where you'll be part of special offers, discounts and "family only" events.

Goal #4 - $100K (and beyond!)

If we're able to zoom past the $100K goal, we would be able to purchase a larger 6BBL brewing system, larger 6 BBL fermenters and could open our tasting room for more than four days a week.  You would be helping us jump into the big leagues as our brewing capacity would allow for local distribution via kegs and cans.  We're confident you will get us to this goal so that we can bring Twinpanzee Brewing Co beer to thirsty patrons outside of the Northern VA area.  Heck, after we reach the $100K goal the Head Primate has volunteered to:
- Shave his head and include a picture of his cue ball head with a hand written "Thank You" note to all members of our primate family
- Create a special "thank you" video for primate family members
- Share a total of five (5) all-grain recipes to brew your own Twinpanzee brew
- Add all primate family members to a list where you'll be part of special offers, discounts and "family only" events.

We also have a ton of GREAT rewards for your donations.  Please see the REWARDS area below for pictures and for more information.

Join our primate family & spread the word

We need you to spread the word about our IndieGoGo campaign and recruit new members for our primate family!  Please share this project's page or feel free to share this following URL which will re-direct you to our IndieGogo page:

Twinpanzee.com/fund/


How do I make a pledge?

Please follow these easy steps to make a pledge:

1. CREATE a IndieGogo account
It's easy! You just need an email or sign in with Facebook!

2. Grab your credit card or PayPal info 
Unlike other crowdfund sites, you can use any credit card or your PayPal account to make a pledge!  Awesome!

3. PLEDGE at what ever level you would like
Any pledge will help! 

4. THIS IS THE MOST IMPORTANT STEP! SHARE SHARE SHARE!  Please share this campaign with your family, friends, co-workers, etc. We need you to recruit people to join our primate family! Please send this fundraiser page to as many people as you can

CHECK  US  OUT  ON  FACEBOOK  AT:
http://www.facebook.com/Twinpanzee


Please help us thank Take A Penny Productions for creating our AWESOME video! You can learn more about them at:
https://www.facebook.com/takeapennyproductions


REWARDS

As a way to thank you for your very generous pledges, here are some samples of the rewards we're offering:

Craft beer brewed by primates with discerning taste and style.

TWINPANZEE is a trademark of the Twinpanzee Brewing Co.


Risks & Challenges

Laws, licenses, permits...oh my! As we continue to move forward in planning our brewery, we've found that one of the most challenging aspects of starting a brewery (regardless of the size) is obtaining the proper permits, licenses and dealing with the many laws.

Breweries are closely monitored and heavily regulated at both the state and federal level. In addition to the normal business licenses and permits required of everyone in Virginia, we also must meet the requirements of Federal TTB (formerly ATF) and the ABC of Virginia.

If that wasn't enough, the amount of time it takes to obtain all the necessary permits and licenses are astounding. Imagine paying a monthly lease and not being able to open your doors to the public and sell your brews until you have the right license/permits. We're at the mercy of our state and federal government but will do our due diligence to ensure all of our requests are in order to expedite processing. As we've learned from other brewer friends, once you submit the paperwork we have virtually no control over how long it takes for approval.

story:
Overview

Hi: I’m Jim Parsons founder of WheelchairJimmy.com and the WheelchairJimmy YouTube Channel. I created the website to improve the lifestyles and travel opportunities for persons with disabilities. We have created a unique travel advisory website geared to make disabled travel more fun, accessible, convenient and hassle free.

During my career, I have traveled the globe in a wheelchair but have encountered about every accessibility issue imaginable: multiple steps at the front door, restrooms that are not accessible, properties located on dangerously steep streets, historic buildings which are not accessible, and the dreaded small hydraulic lifts that half the time don’t work. Today, many hotels, restaurants, cruise ships and city attractions say they are accessible or ADA compliant, but it’s just not so. Our government’s definition of “ADA Compliant” is over 25 years old, and believe me, needs an upgrade!

Our strategy has been to build a database, a wheelchair accessibility index and a unique user-friendly website with detailed accessibility reviews on thousands of facilities worldwide. We advise wheelchair travelers which hotels, restaurants, cruise ships, city attractions and mass transportation are wheelchair friendly and importantly which properties to avoid. 

At this point we have created the engine and processes but we still need to build out the content management platform, extend our digital technology initiatives including data driven interactivity, mobile and tablet usability and add new cities. To accomplish our goals we need your help, donations and support. 

The wheelchair community needs a trusted name in accessible travel. 

Together we can make the world more fun and accessible!


Our Needs and Your Sponsorship

As part of our travel database methodology, we interview 100% of the facilities on our website and have to date interviewed over 1,000 hotels, restaurants, cruise ships and city attractions in 8 major U.S. cities and the country of New Zealand. To better "scale" the project, we  need to extend our development team to enhance our dynamic content management platform. This will allow both internal resources and consumer travelers, via crowd sourcing, to upload images, reviews and content while we expand coverage to new cities.

We could also use a couple extra helping hands. Part-time initially. Over time we will hire some helpers, mostly disabled persons - creating the WheelchairJimmy Militia - to review and rate properties around the world and add social networking content. 

We want to build our community of wheelchair and scooter users and their families, and will promote our fund raising with WheelchairJimmy Militia T-Shirts, unique advocacy bumper stickers, portraits with WheelchairJimmy, personal sponsorship placement on our website and the opportunity to trudge along and ride with Jimmy on his city rating visits.

The founders expect to take NO salaries well into the foreseeable future. All revenues and eventual profits will be reinvested into the business to further our mission. 


Our Business Strategy

  • Develop the WheelchairJimmy Brand Name as the Most Trusted Name for Disabled Travel: Over the next several years we intend to actively develop strategic relationships to generate revenue with multiple hotels, restaurants, city attractions and cruise ship owners to build our brand name.
  • Develop a Dynamic Social Networking Site for the Disabled and Build Content: We anticipate building our community by providing substantive content on relevant topics about living life with a disability.
  • Expand the Database of Hotels, Restaurants, City Attractions, Cruise Ships and Mass Transit: We believe today’s technology can be used to build and manage a comprehensive, scalable, accessible database relatively quickly and inexpensively.
  • Develop the WheelchairJimmy.com Mobile App: This will be coordinated with engineering our website content management platform.
  • Generate Ad Revenues from our Website and Mobile App: We believe there are numerous product placement and licensing opportunities relating to the disabled community and increasingly older demographic marketplace. We have already created revenue sharing affiliation agreements with Hilton Hotels, Intercontinental Hotels (Holiday Inn et al) and CityPass (city attractions).

TIMELINE AND BUDGET

We have created the engine, look, feel and functionality for our website but we still need to build out the content management platform and extend our digital technology initiatives. So first and foremost we will make our website "efficient and scaleable". We also need to upload the remaining cities we have interviewed, expand coverage to new cities and add a crowd sourcing feature. Here's our 4-year timeline:

As we expand to new cities and add content, we'll need to expand the WheelchairJimmy Militia, expand the revenue base by securing strategic marketing and licensing partners and raise additional capital.


OUR MANAGEMENT TEAM

WheelchairJimmy.com founders all have existing businesses and commitments but will dedicate substantial time to the Company and are committed to the success of the Company. The team includes:

·  Jim Parsons is currently CEO of Kingston Capital LLC, a Seattle based investment-banking firm (www.KingstonCapital.net). Jim has arranged over $10 billion in corporate financings over his 40-year career and was a co-founder of Sprint PCS affiliate UbiquiTel (acquired by Sprint-Nextel in 2006). He was previously Managing Director of the Corporate Finance Division of U.S. Bancorp and head of Bank of America’s Entertainment, Media and Health Care industries lending group. Jim received his Bachelor of Science degree in Marketing from Indiana University and his M.B.A. from Indiana University. Jim is on the Board of Directors and is Trust Treasurer for the Rotary Club of Bainbridge Island.

·  Michael Turta is a Seattle-based investor and entrepreneur, currently the
founder and CEO of KeyMetric - a leading Digital Analytics company with the
first analytics solution to track mobile and telephone responses back to
the exact advertising campaigns, search engine terms and pay per click keywords
that generated the sales conversion. Mike has been the General Manager of the
Interactive Media Group for Click Path/ Who’s Calling, a leading interactive
company with revenues in excess of $100 million, and Executive Vice President
with Agital – a digital content and analytics solution for businesses and supply
chains. He has consulted for many Fortune 500 firms, and is currently a member of multiple industry councils including Web Analytics Association, DMA Search Engine Marketing Council, DMA Marketing Technology and Internet Council and DMA Analytics Council and often speaks at industry events around the globe.

·  Steve Forbes is currently President of Equity Funding Group LLC (NV LLC) and has 20 plus years of executive experience within Internet, e-Commerce and telecom business sectors as well as airline management. Steve was the founder of Y3K, an Internet shopping mall, President of Fox Communications and Who’s Calling North, managing telecom, Internet, and VoIP innovation. At Alaska Airlines (1975-’93), he held positions as an Analyst, which included aircraft acquisitions; and in earlier positions as a sales representative, adding roughly $100,000,000 in annual sales, and additionally managed the Flight Attendants (1,100 F/A’s) and Reservations (425 CSA’s) departments and call centers around the world..

The WheelchairJimmy.com founders are fully committed to our mission and have made great progress with our own time and capital over then past 18 months:

 We can't do this alone. We need your help and importantly need to build the wheelchair user community. Here’s an opportunity whereby You too can help make a difference! Please join us with your Support and Sponsorship! We need $50,000 to take WheelchairJimmy to the next level of success. Together we can make the world more fun and accessible!

 

indiegogo /  Perks  /  Email Friends

So please go to www.indiegogo.com, pick the level of your Support, select your Perk, then Share your support with your friends on email, Facebook, Twitter and Linked-in. Alternatively, go to www.wheelchairjimmy.com and we will direct you to indiegogo. And if  you cannot make a donation at this time, please repost and repost our message to your friends to help us get the word out. Roll-on America!

Michael Turta is a Seattle-based investor and entrepreneur, currently thefounder and CEO of KeyMetric - a leading Digital Analytics company with thefirst analytics solution to track mobile and telephone responses back tothe exact advertising campaigns, search engine terms and pay per click keywordsthat generated the sales conversion. Mike has been the General Manager of theInteractive Media Group for Click Path/ Who’s Calling, a leading interactivecompany with revenues in excess of $100 million, and Executive Vice Presidentwith Agital – a digital content and analytics solution for businesses and supplychains. He has consulted for many Fortune 500 firms, and is currently a member of multiple industry councils including Web Analytics Association, DMA Search Engine Marketing Council, DMA Marketing Technology and Internet Council and DMA Analytics Council and often speaks at industry events around the globe.
· 
Steve Forbes
is currently President of Equity Funding Group LLC (NV LLC) and has 20 plus years of
executive experience within Internet, e-Commerce and telecom business sectors
as well as airline management. Steve was the founder of Y3K, an Internet shopping mall, President of Fox
Communications and Who’s Calling North, managing telecom, Internet, and VoIP
innovation. At Alaska Airlines (1975-’93), he held positions as an Analyst, which included aircraft acquisitions; and in earlier positions as a sales representative, adding roughly $100,000,000 in annual sales, and additionally managed the Flight Attendants (1,100 F/A’s) and Reservations (425 CSA’s) departments and call centers around the world..

The WheelchairJimmy.com
founders are fully committed to our mission and have made great progress with our own time and capital over then past 18 months: We can't do this alone. We need your help and importantly need to build the wheelchair user community. Here’s an opportunity whereby You too can
help make a difference! Please join us with your Support and Sponsorship! We
need $50,000 to take WheelchairJimmy to the next level of success. Together we can make the world more fun and accessible! indiegogo /  Perks  /  Email Friends
So please go to www.indiegogo.com, pick the level of your Support, select your Perk, then Share your support with your friends on email,
Facebook, Twitter and Linked-in. Alternatively, go to www.wheelchairjimmy.com and we will direct you to indiegogo. And if  you cannot make a donation at this time, please repost and repost our message to your friends to help us get the word out. Roll-on America!

story:
Job Advocate is a revolutionary web based and mobile application that
enrolls professional job seekers as entrepreneurs and provides a resource
center to coordinate benefits, receive payments, track taxes, offer expert
consultations and seek projects. Job Advocate will be using intuitive
technology to create better job matches and increase overall user experience.

THE PROBLEM

The freelance marketplace industry is currently seeing enormous growth. In fact, demand is currently set to outpace supply. A recent study by Staffing Industry Analysts (SIA) stated that
mid-market and enterprise companies are turning to online freelancers at record
pace.

The SIA team reports that 10% of all firms are now employing a contingent workforce. This is a dramatic increase from SIA’s study the previous year, where estimates were at 3%. In fact, it is projected that by 2020, freelancers are expected to make up 50% of the full time workforce! Contract workers help businesses reduce costs while receiving exceptional work.

Currently the online freelance platforms focus primarily on IT, software development and multimedia professionals overseas. There is a true need for a US-based platform that offers professional services such as finance, management, accounting and legal work.

THE SOLUTION

Job Advocate is a revolutionary web based and mobile application that enrolls professional job seekers as entrepreneurs and provides a resource center to coordinate benefits, receive payments, track taxes, offer expert advice, and seek projects. Job Advocate will be using intuitive technology to create better job matches and increase overall user experience.

 

 

JOB ADVOCATE BENEFITS 

  • Saves time and money for employers who do not wish to
         add to payroll;

 

  • Seamlessly connects employers and freelancers through
         innovative matching technology;

  • Offers a resource center full of tools to assist
         freelancers in creating, maintaining and growing their independent
         businesses;

  • Documents, protects and stores all payments made
         through the Job Advocate platform.

THE FREELANCE ONLINE EMPLOYMENT SERVICES COMPETITION

The online freelance employment industry has developed rapidly in the past decade. General freelance marketplaces are now the largest platforms. As the industry’s first movers, these marketplaces established brand recognition, grew their user base and made many acquisitions. Job Advocate will compete in this segment but will offer added features and focus on job categories that its competitors do not.

COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE
Advantage #1

Innovative prediction and matching technology that will use algorithms and metatags to create convenience and save time and money for both parties.

Advantage #2

Job Advocate will focus on unmet needs in employer demand. This will mean recruiting freelancers with a focus in such professional skills as finance,  accounting, management and marketing. These are underserved markets on competitor sites.

Advantage #3

Resource center that attracts and aids freelancers in starting and operating their businesses.

 

HOW IT WORKS

Job Advocate will enlist both employer and freelancers on its marketplace platform. Job Advocate will be a full-service marketplace and its technology will offer added benefits such as talent screening and matching, which will be an added convenience for employers and freelancers. This will also help Job Advocate to combat information asymmetry, which is prevalent in existing services.

The Job Advocate platform will be the “middle man” for each job posting and consequent hiring. Communication, work and invoicing will all be stored through the company’s cloud-based storage system. In addition to finding contract work, freelancers will have access to a resource center, which will host legal resources, tax advisory, benefit services, payment services, a personal coach resource, and more. It is Job Advocate’s goal to partner freelancers so that they may become independent, productive, educated, and aware of their job market value. 

 

TARGET INDUSTRIES

Job Advocate will open its marketplace to many types of freelancers, but with a focus on skilled and licensed professionals. While its largest competitors (Elance, Freelancer and oDesk) are known to primarily emphasize IT, software development and design and multi-media, Job Advocate will focus on the future of freelance business—white collar workers.

 37% of job postings on Elance come from the industry segment of IT and Programming, while only 2% comes from finance and management. This is in disparity to the demand in the market. The Global Skills in Demand chart shows that 88% of companies are looking for skilled workers in the area of finance and management, followed by sales and marketing. Job Advocate will focus on enrolling users who meet the criteria demanded by the market.

In today’s world, more and more traditional workers are turning to freelancing due to the limited available jobs, the independence and quality of life brought on by freelancing, and the ability to control how much money is charged per job. Job Advocate believes that it can locate and convert these ready and available skilled workers and create an in-demand freelance marketplace.


WHO ARE FREELANCERS?

The number of freelance workers in the US is rapidly growing. A 2010 Intuit survey projects that more than 40 percent of the U.S. workforce would be contingent workers by 2020. More recently, a lobbying group called It’s My Business estimated there are 10.3 million independent contractors working in the U.S. today. Freelancers Union, meanwhile, says 42 million workers, or one-third of the current US labor-force are already freelancers.

These freelancers come from many different backgrounds and are looking for flexibility and freedom in their work. Following the recent economic downturn, the employment rate has recovered at a frustratingly slow pace, except in one area: temporary, contingent, and independent workers. Between 2009 and 2012, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, the number of temporary employees rose by 29%. During the labor market crash of 2008, many previous full-time employees became freelancers out of necessity before realizing the benefits that come along with being independent. A glimpse into the mind of this target market can be seen to the right.

 

COMPANIES HIRING FREELANCERS

Companies of all sizes and industries are now hiring freelance workers. As can be seen on the previous page, companies are now looking to contract out more professional and licensed services such as finance and management. These skills apply to all types of businesses.

While in the past freelancers have focused on marketing their services to penny-pinching start ups and SMBs, today more and more large corporations with higher budgets are entering into the marketplace. They are looking for experienced professionals for contract work in order to limit payroll while completing projects in a timely manner.

42% of employers said they anticipate hiring more freelancers in 2014 than the previous year.

It is projected that by 2020, freelancers could make up 50%of the full time work force.

Employers are demanding more white collar, professional freelancers.

 

ONGOING MARKETING STRATEGY

Once Job Advocate is fully operation and competing within the market, it will implement a continued marketing strategy. This strategy will  involve traditional media, events and networking, online advertising and social media marketing.

 

USER ACQUISITION

Job Advocate will use its sales and marketing plan to acquire new users. In year 1, the website will enroll over 40,000 freelancers and over 16,000 employers. This will increase to a total of  2.5 million freelancers in year 5 and over 400,000 employers.

The average employer will post 5 jobs per year by year 5, and an average of 40% of posted jobs will be awarded. These numbers are more conservative than industry standard for the sake of proper risk planning in the business plan.


FINANCIAL SUMMARY

Job Advocate is targeting significant growth over the next several years, and is seeking an investment of $500,000 to support this growth. The company is searching for investment partners in order to bring the platform to market and support the company's growth plan, vision and management style. 

The majority of funds raised will go directly to driving the completion and launch of version 1.0, and early customer acquisition and  development.

Within one year of giving up everything and moving to sunny Los Angeles from down under, everything turned to custard and I found myself miles from home, in a long term hotel, with shattered dreams.

After a short time of healing, I secured myself a cozy little apartment, and I packed up all my worldly possessions into a suitcase and my professional makeup kit and moved to Hollywood, ready to start my life over again.   I now find myself traveling an extra hour and a half per day to get to and from my mediocre office job, to keep a roof over my head.  All the while thinking "If only I had a car".

Now by having my own monster wagon it would dramatically reduce time wasted, waiting on the public transport system, valuable time that could be used creatively.  It would also enable me to travel to many exotic locations for makeup shoots, cart the tons of sfx products and materials  and get home safely at the end of a long 12 hour day on film set.

Ideally I wish to be able to dispose of the body.. oops.. the tedious day job and become a full time special effects makeup artist.  Yes I know these things take time..  and I'm starting this new adventure now!

It would be fun to cruise to each location in the "Carnage FX" hearse, although I am not picky and I will accept any reliable set of wheels I can afford.  However a hearse has plenty of space for the many products that a sfx artist needs to transport, including that corpse....   ..ahhh..    ..umm..  eerrrr I mean props!

PLEASE NOTE:

** All perks can be delivered free of blood if that is what you desire, I understand not everyone loves it.

** For those of you that don't know, the picture above is of George, he moved in with me one Halloween, and still he waits patiently. 

** SPOILER NOTE:  All blood, fingers, images and video mentioned in the perks are fake and for entertainment purposes only.

** No humans (or animals) will be or have been harmed in outcome of this.

story:
Did you ever feel like you had a story inside?  I always wanted to tell my story.  My art allows me to do this.  I met Nieta Greene fell in love and got married in 2009. 5 months after we were married I was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis.  It was a devastating blow and from that point forward my wife became my primary caretaker. She suggested that I paint to improve the dexterity in my fingers. I began to create a new genre of art all of my own.  Through my disability, I taught myself to sculpt letters out of tissue and than into words. 

Nieta Greene and I are the Co-Founders/Co-CEOs of Speak Your Truth, LLC.  Affordable art for the soul is our concept. We began Speak Your Truth in 2011. The story I tell in each painting is perseverance.  In 2013, I was diagnosed with End Stage Renal Disease.  I am currently on dialysis.  The wait for a transplant in the state of NY is approximately 5-7 years.  We are training for at home dialysis currently.  Being able to do dialysis at home offers a unique opportunity for the business.

This campaign is about raising funds to make our home an effective work space for Speak Your Truth. Speak Your Truth sponsors events with a pop up format for artists.  We provide entertainment at our events such as spoken word and music.  Speak Your Truth’s art is priced under $1000.

The goal of our crowd funding campaign is $5000.  Funding will go toward a desktop computer ($2500) which has to have the feature of voice activation for the times when I am unable to type, printer and scanner ($500), reclining chair and table ($500) for dialysis, a GPS ($100), artist supplies ($200), a camera and lighting set ($1000) so that we can take our own pictures, and building a website ($200).  If we don’t reach our entire goal we will trim the GPS, scanner, printer, camera and lighting set.  

Paintings can be perceived as a luxury items not a necessity.  A problem solving strategy that Speak Your Truth has developed is a product line of art products that are under $50. 

If you can not contribute financially we are always looking for new ideas and stories that have yet to be told.  We are always looking for artists for group shows.

Nieta Greene maintains Social Media, PR and personal agent.   My art has shown across the United States and published in domestic and international magazine as a result of her work.  I have been invited for representation at a prestigious Chelsea gallery.  She has been the ingenuity behind the new line of products that Speak Your Truth offers. 

Speak Your Truth can impact the world.  It will make people think.  I was diagnosed with a terminal disease with no cure at 33 and had a myelin degenerating disease as well.  I sit in my chair for dialysis 5 days a week for 3 and ½ hours.  I choose to speak my mind we want to encourage others to do the same.  I am using my art to bring attention to awareness of kidney donation and life on dialysis.  Crochet for a Cause is a project that Speak Your Truth has begun to develop.   It involves giving handmade blankets to dialysis patients as a gift. There is also important research as scientist move toward a synthetic kidney that needs funding.

story:
You can donate via our website:


www.africanvoices.com

 

Mail: African Voices, 270 W. 96th Street, New York, NY 10025

 

READ THE NEW YORK DAILY NEWS ARTICLE ON OUR 2012 "FROM COVER TO COVER: 20 YEARS OF AFRICAN VOICES" ART EXHIBITION AT THE SCHOMBURG CENTER RESEARCH IN BLACK CULTURE:

 http://www.nydailynews.com/lifting-voices-20th-ann-exhibit-article-1.1231884

 

TWEET for LITERATURE - Power of $5

POWER of FIVE: YOU + 5 Friends = $30.

We’re back with a new Power of $5 campaign. Our new campaign celebrates Black literature and is called TWEET for LITERATURE!

African Voices is launching a fun drive to raise awareness about the power of literature while raising funds for our Spring 2014 issue. Throughout the month of February to Feb, 28, 2014, we would like you to tweet about your favorite authors and books and donate $5 to support our literary magazine.

Be creative! Share your book list or host twitter chat book discussions on the books you are reading. Just remember to use the hashtag: #tweetforliterature. Encourage friends and family to donate $5 to help us support the next generation of writers.

As a literary magazine devoted to publishing poetry and stories by writers from the African Diaspora, we hope TWEET for LITERATURE will celebrate the proud tradition of such great writers as Ralph Ellison, Langston Hughes, Zora Neale Hurston, Sonia Sanchez, Junot Díaz, Alice Walker, Chinua Achebe, Amiri Baraka, Toni Morrison, Louis Reyes Rivera and James Baldwin. And the list goes on. Our campaign is being launched during Black History Month with hope that people will tweet about our rich literary tradition, which is belongs to the global community.

TWEET for LITERATURE KEY POINTS

• Tweet & Donate $5 (or more) using hashtag #tweetforliterature

• Share Campaign with 5 friends and ask them to donate $5

• Tweet information about your favorite author (i.e. quotes, favorite book, historical facts)

• Start twitter chats & online book discussions while encouraging people to donate

• Have fun! Let’s reach 10,000 people online with our new Power of $5 drive


About African Voices

Founded in 1992, African Voices is one of the few surviving print literary magazines devoted to publishing literature and art by writers of color. In addition to publishing a quarterly magazine, the organization sponsors writing workshops for young people and adults, literary readings and other cultural programs including the Reel Sisters Film Festival (www.reelsisters.org), a festival that presents films produced, directed or written by women of color. For more information visit www.africanvoices.com.

Fundraising Goal: $12,500

We have listed our fundraising goal as $10,000 so we can get the full benefit of any contributions raised via Indiegogo. 

Please do not stop pushing for us when we surpass $12,500, we still have 3 issues to publish in 2013. The money raised will support forthcoming issues!

Here's a summary of some costs the campaign supports:

CONTRIBUTORS' FEES: $2,500

EDITING & COPY EDITING: $2,500

PRINTING, DESIGN & POSTAGE: $7,500 (Digital & Print editions)

Total for one issue (44 pages): $12,500

The Impact

The IMPACT is that you will EMPOWER the writers, artists and readers who cherish the magazine through your contribution.

PLEASE feel free to give more than $5 to support African Voices. The reason we're asking for $5 is we want as many people to join in as possible. Times are challenging for many people but the average person has a five spot to spare. 

Your contribution will help us continue our mission to preserve our art, history and culture.

WHAT YOU GET

A positive feeling for supporting a great cause!

EVERYONE gets a digital issue of our Spring 2014 issue!

Contributors making a $60 donation will receive a copy of Venus Jones' Lyrics for Langston!


Contributors giving the $60 and $160 level will get a beautiful unframed or framed poster of our Spring 2013 issue featuring Mirlande Jean-Gilles art work "Autumn In the City." Or you may request one of the other equally phenomenal magazine covers from our website. The posters are 18"x24" (you may request an 8"x10" poster).




Author's Spotlight: Venus Jones, Lyrics for Langston

African Voices is very grateful to Venus Jones, a talented poet and subscriber to our magazine, for participating in our fundraising drive. She is the author of Lyrics for Langston, a poetry collection inspired by the late legendary writer.

Venus produced a special video supporting our drive and is the young woman in the photo holding up our 20th Anniversary issue. If you donate $60, you will get a copy of her book as a special gift!

Please support this wonderful young writer and rising talent!

Venus Jones has opened for Def Poetry on Broadway, and her work has appeared in Poet Lore, UK’s X Magazine, Spoken Vizions and anthologies including, How I Freed My Soul, A Time to Rhyme and A Generation Defining Itself. She’s an Austin International poetry slam finalist and former MTV correspondent. Ms. Jones is the author of four CDs and two books entitled She Rose and Lyrics for Langston. She’s also an accomplished model and actress, who’s worked on feature films and starred in countless commercials and print ads. 

Venus is versatile, inspiring people of diverse ages, backgrounds and faiths. Her favorite quote is “People don’t care how much you know, until they know how much you care.”


Visit www.venusjones.com

ABOUT US - OUR STAFF:

PUBLISHER/FOUNDER

Carolyn A. Butts, the executive director and publisher of African Voices, has 20 years of organizing programs in the areas of arts, education, business and film. A former New York Post reporter, Carolyn was featured in Ms. Magazine’s October/November 2001 “Women to Watch” column for her outstanding achievements. Carolyn is also the founder the Reel Sisters of the Diaspora Film Festival & Lecture Series (www.reelsisters.org), an annual Brooklyn-based festival for women of color in the film industry.

MANAGING EDITOR

Maitefa Angaza is the managing editor of African Voices, an acclaimed, nationally distributed Black arts magazine. She is a co-producer of the documentary In Our Heads About Our Hair (2012) and author of Kwanzaa: From Holiday to Every Day, (Dafina Books, 2007), which climbed to #1 on amazon.com holiday books page.

POETRY EDITOR

Mariahadessa Ekere Tallie is a poet, writer, educator, New Yorker and world-wanderer.  Her poetry and fiction have been published in several journals including: Crab Orchard Review, Bomb,  Long Shot, Paris/Atlantic, Drumvoices Revue, and Carapace. Her works have been anthologized in Listen Up! (One World/Ballantine), Catch The Fire!!! (Penguin/ Putnam), Bum Rush The Page: A Def Poetry Jam (Random House), Role Call (Third World Press), Beyond The Frontier (Black Classic Press), The Body Eclectic (Henry Holt), Revenge and Forgiveness (Henry Holt), and The Book of Hope (Beyond Borders).

ART DIRECTOR

Derick Cross (aka D. Cross) is a multi dimensional visual and performance artist who creates imagery in order to reach deep inside the viewer of his artwork. His work is part of the collections of Erykah Badu (Singer), Ed Lewis(Founder of Essence Communications), Ruby Dee (legendary actress), Judith Jamaison (Alvin Ailey director & legendary dancer/choreographer) and Bashiri Johnson (world renowned percussionist & music producer), among others. He is the Art Director ofAfrican Voices. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a $5 contribution, please pass on our invitation to FIVE friends who can! 

• Share this campaign on all your social media networks and tweet about the Poer of Five!

• Subscribe to African Voices for $20 (4 issues a year)

• Advertise in our Spring 2014 issue

• Buy one of our beautiful posters at www.africanvoices.com

• Contact us about volunteer opportunities at 212-865-2982 or africanvoicesmag@gmail.com

 

*DONORS LIVING OUTSIDE USA: Supporters living outside of the United States will be asked to pay for additional shipping costs for perks.

Or you may request one of the other equally phenomenal magazine covers from our website. The posters are 18"x24" (you may request an 8"x10" poster).Author's Spotlight: Venus Jones, Lyrics for Langston
African Voices is very grateful to Venus Jones, a talented poet and subscriber to our magazine, for participating in our fundraising drive. She is the author of Lyrics for Langston, a poetry collection inspired by the late legendary writer. Venus produced a special video supporting our drive and is the young woman in the photo holding up our 20th Anniversary issue. If you donate $60, you will get a copy of her book as a special gift!Please support this wonderful young writer and rising talent!Venus Jones has opened for Def Poetry on Broadway, and her work has
appeared in Poet Lore,
UK’s X Magazine, Spoken Vizions and anthologies
including, How I Freed My Soul, A Time to Rhyme and A Generation Defining Itself. She’s an
Austin International poetry slam finalist and former MTV correspondent. Ms.
Jones is the author of four CDs and two books entitled She Rose and Lyrics for Langston. She’s also an accomplished model and actress,
who’s worked on feature films and starred in countless commercials and print
ads.  Venus is versatile, inspiring
people of diverse ages, backgrounds and faiths. Her favorite quote is “People
don’t care how much you know, until they know how much you care.” Visit www.venusjones.com
ABOUT US - OUR STAFF:PUBLISHER/FOUNDERCarolyn A. Butts, the executive director and publisher of African Voices, has 20 years of organizing programs in the areas of arts, education, business and film. A former New York Post reporter, Carolyn was featured in Ms. Magazine’s October/November 2001 “Women to Watch” column for her outstanding achievements. Carolyn is also the founder the Reel Sisters of the Diaspora Film Festival & Lecture Series (www.reelsisters.org), an annual Brooklyn-based festival for women of color in the film industry.MANAGING EDITORMaitefa Angaza is the managing editor of African Voices, an acclaimed, nationally distributed Black arts magazine. She is a co-producer of the documentary In Our Heads About Our Hair (2012) and author of Kwanzaa: From Holiday to Every Day, (Dafina Books, 2007), which climbed to #1 on amazon.com holiday books page. POETRY EDITORMariahadessa Ekere Tallie is a poet, writer, educator, New Yorker and world-wanderer.  Her poetry and fiction have been published in several journals including: Crab Orchard Review, Bomb,  Long Shot, Paris/Atlantic, Drumvoices Revue, and Carapace. Her works have been anthologized in Listen Up! (One World/Ballantine), Catch The Fire!!! (Penguin/ Putnam), Bum Rush The Page: A Def Poetry Jam (Random House), Role Call (Third World Press), Beyond The Frontier (Black Classic Press), The Body Eclectic (Henry Holt), Revenge and Forgiveness (Henry Holt), and The Book of Hope (Beyond Borders). ART DIRECTORDerick Cross (aka D. Cross) is a multi dimensional visual and performance artist who creates imagery in order to reach deep inside the viewer of his artwork. His work is part of the collections of Erykah Badu (Singer), Ed Lewis(Founder of Essence Communications), Ruby Dee (legendary actress), Judith Jamaison (Alvin Ailey director & legendary dancer/choreographer) and Bashiri Johnson (world renowned percussionist & music producer), among others. He is the Art Director ofAfrican Voices. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are unable to make a $5 contribution, please pass on our invitation to FIVE friends who can! • Share this campaign on all your social media networks and tweet about the Poer of Five!• Subscribe to African Voices for $20 (4 issues a year)• Advertise in our Spring 2014 issue• Buy one of our beautiful posters at www.africanvoices.com• Contact us about volunteer opportunities at 212-865-2982 or africanvoicesmag@gmail.com *DONORS LIVING OUTSIDE USA: Supporters living outside of the United States will be asked to pay for additional shipping costs for perks.

story:
Dear Friends,

We want to share this last bit of good news with you. Together with donations which came in through other non-electronic means, we raised a total of 3,725 US$ for our work with vulnerable adolescent girls in Bolivia. We are so thankful for your solidarity and generosity. God bless.



We need your help..

Who

We are a multidisciplinary team consisting of psychologists, social workers and educators, supported by local and international volunteers.

We work with adolescent girls who have suffered from ill treatment, violence or abuse.

What

The Restoration Shelter is a home, a safe place from violence and a space to heal, grow and keep going.

Its primary objective is to bring healing and hope. Our staff work to help the girls overcome their traumas and gain the courage and means necessary to face life again with all its ups and downs. But new friendships and opportunities provide the hope and motivation to keep going.

The Restoration Shelter is a project run by the Bolivian non-profit organization Mosoj Yan.

When

The Restoration shelter has been running day and night for the past 16 years.

The girls usually stay at the Shelter for 1 to 2 years, depending on their individual restoration process.

Note: The Restoration Shelter continues to be a place of refuge and help for the girls even after they leave; 9 out of 10 girls who pass through our Shelter keep in touch and come to visit when they need help, advice or just want to see a friendly face. Many also come back to encourage the girls currently at the Shelter.

Where

We work in Cochabamba, Bolivia, in the very heart of South America. See The Issues for more information.


How we work

Working through individual and group therapy sessions

Learning through self-esteem and capacity building workshops

Undergoing medical check-ups and eating nutritious meals

Doing homework together and keeping up in school

Broadening horizons through swimming lessons and photography projects

Developing values, goals and resilience

Sharing good and bad times

Working with family and restoring family relationships

Facilitating training and income generation


The issues

Our Restoration Shelter continually receives calls from the local child protection authorities, requesting a home for an adolescent girl who has suffered ill treatment, violence and/or sexual abuse or is at high risk of doing so. Unfortunately Bolivia still has one of the highest rates of violence and abuse against women and children in Latin America, second only to Haiti.

A recent study shows that 7 out of 10 women in Bolivia have experienced some form of domestic violence; but 77% of women experiencing recurrent violence do not press charges. They often have nowhere else to go or are afraid. The same is true for adolescent girls. Between 2007 and 2011 only 96 cases of gender based violence in Bolivia were prosecuted.

We are now also receiving cases of human trafficking..

Why your help is important

We receive financial support from the local child protection authorities and two donors but it is not enough to cover all the costs involved, which is why we are constantly looking for new donors and fund raising opportunities.

Your donation will support the continued functioning of the Shelter. To provide our girls with the home and care they deserve we need to cover the following costs on a monthly basis: basic services including electricity and water; building maintenance; nutritious meals and snacks; hygiene and personal care products; clothes; school uniforms and materials; transportation costs; workshop and occupational therapy materials; as well as salaries of the psychologist, social worker, and three educators (the occupational therapy and crafts teacher, school tutor and resident mom).

This year we have also had a number of outstanding costs, including: repairs and new tires for the Shelter’s van and an emergency appendicitis operation on one of our beneficiaries. Rising food prices are another concern.

On the other hand, the demand placed on our Shelter is increasing. Local child protection authorities often have more cases then we can take on. We currently have the capacity to take in 16 girls at a time; we could take in more if we could get more funding.

This is where your support comes in. Be part of restoring a life, bringing new hope and better opportunities to an adolescent girl in Bolivia. Together we can make a difference.

Invest in a girl´s life..


Our perks - an added value

Our perks are handicrafts or artistic expressions made by the girls themselves. Your donation thus also supports our occupational therapy sessions and mini art projects, whose purpose it is to help the girls develop skills, facilitate self discovery and build self-esteem.

Knowing that someone will be wearing their earrings or hanging their photographs on their wall is a tremendous self-esteem builder and a motivation to keep going. 


Other Ways You Can Help

There are many other ways you can help. One of them most important being helping us get the word out. Please share our campaign with your friends, family and colleagues. With your support we will be able to reach more people and ultimately our goal..


Special thanks..

Many, many thanks to our friends from Grain & Compass who put together this spectacular video for us.

story:
Biography:

Picture Provided By: Ian Hoops BeerQuestABV

Our names are Jack Heekin and Tom O'Brian. We grew up in Cincinnati, and would love your help in opening a beer bar and growler to-go shop, in Cincinnati. 

In 2011, we started a small company in downtown Cincinnati called, ‘The Pedal Wagon’ and have been happily running tours for almost 2 years. It’s been an incredible ride, but we’ve had this pesky passion, which we just can’t shake.

Last December, with nothing but adventure in mind, we travelled 6429 miles; from home to California, California to New Orleans, New Orleans to New York, New York to home. On our journey, that passion reared it’s gorgeous head.

What stood out the most to us was the craft beer industry: an community full of creative, and most notably, passionate people. From there, we set out to create a venue that does them, and their devoted supporters, justice.



What is HalfCut, really?:

With HalfCut, our number one goal is to offer you the best lineup of local and rare beer in Cincinnati. That goal centers on two customer experiences: "to-go" beer, and "the beer parlor". No matter what experience you’re looking for, knowledgeable, beer-loving brewistas will help you at the counter, and walk you through the tap list and bottled beer offerings to make sure you find something you love.

To-Go: Come inside and indulge in the sampling process, or grab your beer to go at our 12th street pick-up window.

Growlers: Using the growler as a container gives you fresh, draft quality craft beer. Take it home, bring it to a party, down it before a business meeting… we don’t judge.

Mix-6 Packs: Mix-6 packs offer a tasty spread for the adventurous beer lovers out there.

Beer Parlor: Using inspiration from across this wonderful country, we’ve worked to craft the perfect space for you to imbibe. Come in for a couple drinks, and indulge in good conversation, and good company. You may just bump into a tap takeover, beer class, or sampling night.

 Why HalfCut needs your help:

We want to create a craft beer mecca, which shines light on the local and regional brewers, with you, the beer drinker, on the front of our mind.

Revamping a building constructed in 1884 has been full of surprises. Some of those surprises have put us in a position where we may have to compromise our vision. We don’t want to compromise… so here we are!

 The Fruits of your Labor:

Draft System

Advanced direct draw tap and growler fill system.

What that means for you:

  • Your beer stays fresher, longer
  • Faster fills means less time between you and your beer
  • Less waste means lower prices

Larger Walk in Cooler

Downtown Cincinnati has a limited selection of “to-go” craft beer. Let’s change that…

A large walk in cooler means more space for us to fit a wider variety of bottled beer. With a larger cooler, you never have to have the same mix 6 pack or 22oz bomber.

GOAT GIFTS FOR YOURSELF / SOMEONE SPECIAL

Shipping Details

Greater Cincinnati Area: If fully funded, we will deliver all gifts to you home on December 19th or December 20th for just $5. We will also post pickup hours if you'd rather come down to our location in OTR.

Outside of Cincinnati: You will be responsible for the cost of shipping your gift. Contact tom@halfcut.com for details. Note: gifts delivered outside of Cincinnati won't arrive at your home until after the holidays.

HalfCut T-Shirt:

One “HalfCut” T-Shirt created by nationally renowned illustrator Keith Neltner, of Neltner Small Batch--- $20.00

 GOAT GLASS:

One refillable “HalfCut” GROWLER & Two 16oz “HalfCut” PINT GLASSES to enjoy your favorite beers at home. $25.00

Text on Front & Back of Growler

 HalfCut STARTER KIT:

One refillable “HalfCut” GROWLER ---Two 16oz “HalfCut” PINT GLASSES to enjoy your favorite beers at home. ---One “HalfCut” T-SHIRT designed by nationally renowned artist, Keith Neltner ---Your first fill is on us! $65.00

THE HalfCut GROWLER CLUB: 

Your Exclusive MEMBERSHIP includes: ---Access to one Growler Fill from a "rare" keg each month, and because this is America, the club gets to vote on their keg. Only 25 memberships available! ---One refillable "HalfCut" GROWLER ---Two 16oz “HalfCut” PINT GLASSES to enjoy your favorite beers at home. ---One “HalfCut” T-SHIRT designed by nationally renowned artist, Keith Neltner

STYLES STUDY HALL 

***STYLES*** STUDY HALL: 6 passes to a unique private introductory tasting class on style varieties. Whether you're a full blown styles geek, or have only scratched the surface, we welcome you to join us for some fun times and fun brews.. Snacks and drink included. ALL PARTICIPANTS ALSO RECEIVE---One refillable “HalfCut” GROWLER ---One 16oz “HalfCut” PINT GLASSES to enjoy your favorite beers at home. ---

***STYLES***RECESS: 12 passes to a unique private introductory tasting class on style varieties. Whether you're a full blown styles geek, or have only scratched the surface, we welcome you to join us for some fun times and fun brews.. Snacks and drink included. ALL PARTICIPANTS ALSO RECEIVE---One refillable “HalfCut” GROWLER ---One 16oz “HalfCut” PINT GLASSES to enjoy your favorite beers at home. ---

HOPS STUDY HALL:

***HOPS*** STUDY HALL: 6 passes to a unique private tasting class on hop varieties. The hop class aims to train palates to recognize specific hop flavors and aromas. We will tie the featured hops to the dominant hop profiles of the specific beers we are offering at that time. Each person will also receive one refillable "HalfCut" GROWLER & Two 16oz "HalfCut" Pint Glasses to enjoy your favorite beers at home. 

***HOPS*** RECESS:12 passes to a unique private tasting class on hop varieties. The hop class aims to train palates to recognize specific hop flavors and aromas. We will tie the featured hops to the dominant hop profiles of the specific beers we are offering at that time. Each person will also receive one refillable "HalfCut" GROWLER & Two 16oz “HalfCut” PINT GLASSES to enjoy your favorite beers at home. $700

YOUR ICONIC TAP HANDLE: 

For our first year in business, we will brand one tap handle in your honor. $1,000

Brand:

HalfCut: 

Halfcut was a slang term used in the 1920s to describe the state of mind you find yourself in after having a couple beers; that feeling of indulging in great conversation and being comfortable in your own shoes. We think being “HalfCut” is the perfect state of mind.

The Goat: 

 The goat symbolizes the curiosity that leads someone to journey “over the mountain”. Whether it be the novel experience of visiting somewhere new, or just tasting a new flavor of beer, it's all waiting to be discovered over the mountain.

story:
The Tuskegee Biogas Technology Mardi Gras Blackout!

Dozens of proposals were submitted. 4 finalists were chosen. Separated, studying in different countries, Tuskegee University students Phillip Stringer and Ashley Ware placed 2nd in the nation for the “Ford Motor Company HBCU Community Challenge”, and earned a $10,000.00 grant to implement their Tuskegee Biogas Technology (#TBT).

This fundraiser will help support an event to highlight a great opportunity for the ‘Skegee Fam to learn about a new and innovative opportunity for them to step up and standout as leaders in sustainable community development.  The importance of this campaign is that the student body will be able to fellowship, and for many have their first experience with positive energy of Mardi Gras! 

Contributions will help bring the smells, taste, and sounds of Mardi Gras to the Tuskegee University campus.  Yet, this isn’t just another reason to get together and party.  The focus of the event will be to inform students that they have the unique chance to become apart of the award winning Tuskegee Biogas Technology project.  Your contributions will help to empower our student body to become tomorrow’s future experts in green design and sustainable practices as they participate in the development of the Shady Grove Blueberry Patch.

Our Commitment to Action

The project goal is to empower the community by encouraging peers to become leading experts in the pressing issues of Mobility, Alternative Energy, Sustainability/Water and Systematic Approaches to Meeting Community Needs.  The methane formed from organic is used as a source of synthetic gas to create energy via biogas technology. This renewable energy source can provide energy for small town rural communities and replace the need to use fossil fuels.  Business and S.T.E.M. students will work together to create a sustainable enterprises capable of funding themselves.  Alongside this objective, we are bringing the community into the current push for lowering environmental impact.

Students will work to address specific challenges. What is the problem or issue we are working to address? Who is our target population?

With the project, both the campus and local community are the target populations.  We intend to spread awareness about the concept of taking a systematic approach to utilizing biogas as a renewable energy source, maintaining environmental health, and economic profitability.  Building a sustainable community requires efforts in research and education.  Fortunately, Tuskegee University can help with these efforts.

The project will also meet urgent and unmet community needs in a number of ways.  For the town of Tuskegee, the price of energy is above average and there is an absence of job providers.  Thus, the cost of living is relatively high and residents must travel outside the community to work.  The project will have a major impact on the community because it can help reduce the burden of energy costs.

What activities will our group undertake?

To address the issue of energy cost in the Tuskegee community we have developed a biogas operation to create methane as an energy source.  The pilot operation is taking place at the Shady Grove Blueberry Patch.  The collaboration with this small business meets our needs in regards to supplies and infrastructure. Its foundation has been in place for decades, starting in the 80’s.  The current owner has agreed to allow us access to the property and it’s resources in exchange for help maintaining the blueberry patch.  Our goal is develop leadership skills in Tuskegee University students as they promote the use of this green energy throughout the county. 

Planning, decision-making, communicating, and teamwork are all skills required to be a responsible student leader.  Even though a student leadership role is a learning experience without a grade, it is still one of the most beneficial extracurricular activities.  With our project, participants are able to take on roles just as they would in a corporate team or on a research project.  Also, this will serve as a chance for our generation to experience African Americans farms that is continuously decreasing with time and as economic resources are reallocated to other social groups. 


What We Need & What You Get

As we wait for the Ford funding to be released, we would like to begin reaching out to students.

Here’s our major expenses for the event:

  • Food and Party Supplies
  • DJ and Campus Security 
  • Tickets and Flyers
  • Renting Logan Hall

Here's our rewards for our supporters:

Chance to win the $50 Grand Prize!!! for every supporter entered

$5+ Gets you a $2 discount off the ticket 

$10+ Get a second bowl free, and the $2 discount

$50+ We'll give you a T-shirt, free admission, and all the other perks are included!

The Impact

    Some may ask why should I support this event? What do I gain as a contributor and how does the world benefit?

    Our response to you is, why not help support a cause that reconnects the youth with the local community in a way that has been lost in the present generation?  It is important to know that the principals of the Tuskegee Biogas Technology project are: unity in effort, progression of the community, and the lessons of hard work.  Each of which are fundamental traits found in strong communities and are instilled in the students that participate.

    Our major success thus far is our national finalist experience competing in the the “Ford Motor Company HBCU Community Challenge”.  Panel judge and Tuskegee Alumni, Tom Joyner spoke with us at length and even mentioned that he gave us a perfect score.  This proves that our project is more than possible and that others have faith in its ability to make a positive impact.

    We hope that you are willing to come enjoy our TU Mardi Gras Blackout and learn more about what we are doing to reconnect the community

      

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't help by contributing financially that's okay because we understand.  However, you can help by spreading the word and encouraging others to participate.
story_txt:
The Tuskegee Biogas Technology Mardi Gras Blackout!Dozens of proposals were submitted.
4 finalists were chosen. Separated, studying in different countries, Tuskegee
University students Phillip Stringer and Ashley Ware placed 2nd in the nation
for the “Ford Motor Company HBCU Community Challenge”, and earned a $10,000.00
grant to implement their Tuskegee Biogas Technology (#TBT).
This fundraiser
will help support an event to highlight a great opportunity for the ‘Skegee Fam
to learn about a new and innovative opportunity for them to step up and
standout as leaders in sustainable community development.  The importance of this campaign is that the
student body will be able to fellowship, and for many have their first
experience with positive energy of Mardi Gras! 
Contributions
will help bring the smells, taste, and sounds of Mardi Gras to the Tuskegee
University campus.  Yet, this isn’t just
another reason to get together and party. 
The focus of the event will be to inform students that they have the
unique chance to become apart of the award winning Tuskegee Biogas Technology
project.  Your contributions will help to
empower our student body to become tomorrow’s future experts in green design and
sustainable practices as they participate in the development of the Shady Grove
Blueberry Patch.

Our Commitment
to Action

The
project goal is to empower the community by encouraging peers to become leading
experts in the pressing issues of Mobility, Alternative Energy,
Sustainability/Water and Systematic Approaches to Meeting Community Needs.
 The methane formed from organic is used as a source of synthetic gas to
create energy via biogas technology. This renewable energy source can provide
energy for small town rural communities and replace the need to use fossil
fuels.  Business and S.T.E.M. students will work together to create a
sustainable enterprises capable of funding themselves.  Alongside this objective, we are bringing the
community into the current push for lowering environmental impact.

Students
will work to address specific challenges. What is the problem or issue we are
working to address? Who is our target population?
With
the project, both the campus and local community are the target
populations.  We intend to spread awareness about the concept of taking a systematic approach to utilizing biogas as a renewable energy source, maintaining environmental health, and economic
profitability.  Building a sustainable community requires efforts in
research and education.  Fortunately, Tuskegee
University can help with these efforts.The project will
also meet urgent and unmet community needs in a number of ways.  For the
town of Tuskegee, the price of energy is above average and there is an absence of
job providers.  Thus, the cost of living
is relatively high and residents must travel outside the community to work.
 The project will have a major impact on the community because it can help reduce
the burden of energy costs.

What
activities will our group undertake?
To
address the issue of energy cost in the Tuskegee community we have developed a
biogas operation to create methane as an energy source.  The pilot operation is taking place at the
Shady Grove Blueberry Patch.  The collaboration
with this small business meets our needs in regards to supplies and
infrastructure. Its foundation has been in place for decades, starting in
the 80’s.  The current owner has agreed
to allow us access to the property and it’s resources in exchange for help maintaining the blueberry patch.  Our goal is
develop leadership skills in Tuskegee University students as they promote the
use of this green energy throughout the county. Planning, decision-making,
communicating, and teamwork are all skills required to be a responsible student
leader.  Even though a student leadership role is a learning experience
without a grade, it is still one of the most beneficial extracurricular
activities.  With our project, participants are able to take on roles just
as they would in a corporate team or on a research project.  Also, this will serve as a chance for our
generation to experience African Americans farms that is continuously decreasing with time and as
economic resources are reallocated to other social groups. 
What We Need & What You GetAs we wait for the Ford funding to be released, we would like to begin reaching out to students.
Here’s our
major expenses for the event:

Food and Party Supplies
DJ and Campus Security 
Tickets and Flyers
Renting Logan Hall
Here's our rewards for our supporters:Chance to win the $50 Grand Prize!!! for every supporter entered$5+ Gets you a $2 discount off the ticket $10+ Get a second bowl free, and the $2 discount$50+ We'll give you a T-shirt, free admission, and all the other perks are included!
The ImpactSome may ask
why should I support this event? What do I gain as a contributor and how
does the world benefit? 
Our
response to you is, why not help support a cause that reconnects the youth with
the local community in a way that has been lost in the present generation?  It is important to know that the principals
of the Tuskegee Biogas Technology project are: unity in effort, progression of
the community, and the lessons of hard work. 
Each of which are fundamental traits found in strong communities and are
instilled in the students that participate.
Our major
success thus far is our national finalist experience competing in the the
“Ford Motor Company HBCU Community Challenge”. 
Panel judge and Tuskegee Alumni, Tom Joyner spoke with us at length and
even mentioned that he gave us a perfect score. 
This proves that our project is more than possible and that others have
faith in its ability to make a positive impact.
We hope
that you are willing to come enjoy our TU Mardi Gras Blackout and learn more about what we are doing to reconnect the community  Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help by contributing financially that's okay because we understand.  However, you can help by spreading the word and encouraging others to participate.

story:
Short Summary

Hi fellow small business owners, contributors and to all those kind folk who support small business.

We are a (South African) National Small Business Support Organisation. Our goals are to connect, support and provide a platform for small businesses and professional sales people - to network and mentor each other in order to grow, prosper and create new business opportunities, and in so doing - create a job for our fellow countrymen and women.

  • South Africa currently has an unemployment rate of over 30%
  • Every job we create, every business we save, every client we refer to a small business owner contributes to solving this problem.
  • Our custom developed software links and make this possible - and this is where we need your help.

As we are in africa - lets describe it like this - How do you eat an elephant?  - Well easy ... one bite at a time - and this is how we tackle unemployment, one new opportunity, one new job created at a time.

What We Need & What You Get

We need financial assistance to finalise development our versions 2 & 3 of BizLink - our business referral software

  • We have successfully launched our first version of BizLink - but now through experience and user feedback, we wish to launch updated versions with far greater functionality and reach.
  • BizLink delivers personalised referrals to clients and small businesses that need them most - this ensures that SME's stay in business and protect jobs
  • All funds will be utilised to launch version 2 of BizLink
  • As we are a self funded company - like most small ,businesses our funding is limited.
  • With your help we can deliver a practical solution to a very real challenge 


The Impact

All contributors will receive feedback from us at Just Ask and we will publish your profile on our Small Business Hero's wall on our website - whilst we don't produce a tangible "thing" we do save families and protect businesses - you can too.

  • Your contribution will directly benefit a small business owner & help create or protect a job
  • We currently serve over 250 SME's and are taking on over 5 new business owners a day
  • Please feel free to visit our website ( www.justask.co.za ) and you can verify our credentials with the South African Small business chambers of commerce & industry  or view www.rcci.co.za to confirm our services and contribution to small businesses, please feel free to contact the head of the Small business chamber linda at Linda Blackbeard  - manager@rcci.co.za

Risks & Challenges

The risk to this project in almost nil - as we have already self-funded and launched version one - we simply require the additional funding to launch and code versions 2 and 3 - these being much bigger projects than our initial version and vision

  • Versions 2 & 3 can be coded and implemented within three months
  • All the concept & framework work has been designed - We now need to code, test and upgrade version 1
  • The importance of this software is that it will allow us to seamlessly provide our Just Ask Small business members with the ability to receive leads and referrals from fellow team members the general public and directly from us at just Ask. It is these business referrals and business opportunities that keep a business in business and in turn provides job opportunities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are a small business owner - you will immediately recognise the importance of protecting and helping fellow small business owners - please leave comments, tips and advice on your successful business rules , do's & don'ts and if you are able to contribute to our "Shout Out" we truly appreciate and value your kind support

  • If you are unable to contribute financially please
  • Back our Young Entrepreneurs programs 
  • Become a mentor & Pay It Forward - by contributing tips and encouragement to others who can contribute to our fund raising needs
  • Share your success with both us and Indiegogo

Many thanks from the Just Ask T.E.A.M. - Together Everyone Achieves More

story:
At a young age, I have been mesmerized by the creation of art and its history. I am now a high school art student with a big opportunity that could benefit my future. This opportunity is a once in a lifetime chance to go to Greece to study art, ancient architecture, and culture with my peers and well respected art teacher. From this trip, I will gain more knowledge of art, become worldlier through experience, and improve my chances of getting into one of my dream colleges.

           

  By contributing to my educational trip, you are allowing me to experience and see all Greece has to offer. With your help I will see many famous ancient monuments, such as the Parthenon and Temple of Apollo and explore the vineyards and olive groves to Delphi. See the Agora and observe wonderful artwork in the Acropolis museum. I'll learn about the overall history of Greece and their authentic customs. This trip is being provided my an educational travel agency teamed with my school to ensure students are fully enveloped in learning about art and history in Greece, while keeping them safe and adding to their experience.

          Perks at Work

  For all those who want to be more involved I have created some fun and exciting perks! For a small donation of $15, I’ll pick out a unique post card and write a personal message then send it to you. With a donation of $50, you will be surprised with a mystery souvenir in the mail that I pick out just for you! A donation of $100, I will send you 20 photographs of the breath taking landscapes, cities, and ancient monuments of Greece taken by yours truly. If sadly I do not reach my goal, your contributions will be put into my college savings account and help me into an art college.

         Sharing is Caring

  If you want to help increase my chance of hitting my goal, please spread the word! You can use social media or tell someone you know about my campaign. I would greatly appreciate it! Thank you so much for your time and consideration!
