story:
Who We Are

Transition Town Peterborough is a registered non-profit dedicated to helping Peterborough become less dependent on fossil fuels with a more sustainable and resilient economy, and vibrant culture.

The Festival

The Purple Onion Festival is a celebration of Peterborough's rich local food, culture, and all the people that make it a great place to live.

We believe that by strengthening the agricultural, cultural and economic ties within the community, we move towards a vision of Peterborough that will benefit all citizens, regardless of future events. We want to help prepare Peterborough for the challenges of tomorrow, in all areas of human wellbeing - physical, social, emotional, economic, etc.

The Kawartha Loon

Part of our effort to make Peterborough resilient is the creation of a local currency. We have named ours the Kawartha Loon. Local currencies strengthen a local economy by encouraging all people (producers, retailers, service providers, consumers, non-profits, and government) to not only work together and trade with each other, but keep the wealth created in the community.

Ideally, a high percentage of each dollar spent will remain in circulation in the community, generating further wealth and encouraging the consumption and production of local goods and services. 

We have begun the feasibility phase of the Kawartha Loon, and will be presenting the $1 and $5 bills at the festival as a trial - They will not be ready for circulation in the community, but will be accepted at the festival on par with Canadian dollars. Even though you buy them at a discount!

The exchange rate will be $10 CDN for $11 KL ($10 CDN minimum) and you can exchange any leftover Loons when you leave the festival.

The Peterborough Community Credit Union is our banking partner, and will have banking agents on hand to handle the exchanges at both ends of Millenium Park.

What We Need

The Purple Onion Festival needs $5,000 to accomplish its goals and produce the best possible festival. The money will be used for:

  • Host tent, table and chair rentals, sound equipment
  • Clothing and equipment for volunteers
  • Printing the Kawartha Loon Currency

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We are always looking for volunteers! Email Fred at: ttpeterborough@gmail.com if interested.
  • Spread the word! Tell your friends and family to see what we're all about!

story:
UPDATE 5/7 - We're at 24% of our goal - won't you help us make it all the way?

Also thought you might like to see what the finished floor would look like on top of our sprung floor.  While most yoga studios have bamboo or light oak floors we are going for something very warm and dramatic - check out Tobacco Road Acacia:

This is NOT our space but check out what it will look like installed - beautiful!

Short Summary

The Cobra Club is a community center of sorts - combining a yoga studio that offers calm, meditative classes, and a café that serves beer, wine and a curated menu of locally-sourced comfort foods. The Cobra Club will fill a necessary niche in the rapidly evolving neighborhood of Bushwick, Brooklyn and is aimed at local patrons who find that they have to commute to other neighborhoods and boroughs to enjoy themselves. Founders Nikki Koch, Julia Huffman and Dana Bushman have 20+ years of experience in the arts, hospitality & service industries combined, and through the Cobra Club hope to introduce new people to the benefits of yoga in a non-competitive environment with a focus on self-awareness and injury prevention.

Welcoming to all levels, from total beginners to practiced yogis, the Cobra Club will provide an environment that supports and embraces each and every person's unique body and personality. The Cobra Club also aims to take the stigma out of yoga that the practitioner has to be flexible and able to do complicated and physically demanding poses, while leading a perfectly Zen life of abstinence outside of the yoga studio. Julia, Nikki and Dana recognize that everyone is human, and that vices, in moderation, can help ease difficulties and lead to happier lives. 

What We Need & What You Get

The floor under the yoga studio is concrete, and we want to install a sprung floor system  to help prevent injuries. If you've never seen or heard of a sprung floor, you probably haven't spent a lot of time in a dance studio. Here's a picture of a partially-built sprung floor so that you understand the mechanics:

We are in the process of building out the studio, and we would love your support  contribution.  As a token of our appreciation we are offering various options at each contribution level - either an amount of free yoga classes or a dollar amount in free bar tab - your choice!  For our remote contributors you can either gift you classes/tab to a local or look at our higher contribution packages for a Cobra Club t-shirt in your desired size.  The t-shirt will feature our logo:

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially but that doesn't mean you can't help!  

  • Please get the word out and tell your friends about our campaign - make some noise for us!
  • Check out our site at http://cobraclubbk.com for more information about our business, our blog and ways to contact us.

Thanks for reading and hoping to see you at The Cobra Club soon!

story:
Short Summary

We are a team of 7 young people enthusiasts about Football who decided to make a social media platform specially designed for soccer fans. Our personal need to discuss and share soccer related content without the ‘noise’ of irrelevant information and the spam of unwanted ads inspired us to build AllonBall.

We digitalize the sense of community and unity that soccer fans build around their favorite team and offer them a unique value proposition; the chance to share experiences and discuss about their favorite team without the hassle of not being in the same physical space.

 In contrast to other well-known social media platforms that are built around users’ profiles, in Allonball.com every soccer club has its own Club Page with the Club logo and basic info. The Club Page has an advanced news wall, social media plug-ins, discussion forums, supporters/fans lists, events, supporter’s club lists, the Club Promotional Area (CPA) and other engaging tools.

We are planning to expand our services and to offer our value proposition to other sports as well, such as American football, NBA, or Rugby.

What We Need:

We are currently seeking an amount of $10.000 for the following:

  • $4.000 for web development
  • $4.400 for mobile apps
  • $1.200 language translations
  • $400 for member invitations 

Our Vision:

Our Vision is to connect all fans and supporters of professional soccer clubs, creating a unique place to discuss, blog, get informed  & inspired, and above all celebrate our team’s achievements. The web environment is extremely user friendly and awaits you to start building it into largest web community for the most famous and popular sport ever made. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if you can't contribute to our campaing, this doesn’t mean that you can’t help. We would really apreciate if you spread the word & make some noise about allonball.com :) 

Cheers

story:
What is Wazi Project?

Our mission is to establish a dialogue between today’s and tomorrow’s decision-makers.

Why Wazi Project?

The under 30s make up more than 50% of the world’s population, have strong opinions on current issues and constitute tomorrow’s decision makers and workforce. More than that, the internet generation has access to an unprecedented wealth of information and is developing a new critical framework through which it looks at global society’s challenges. We believe that there is an increasing desire and a very real need for companies, institutions and governments to hear and consider these ideas in their decision making.

To this end, Wazi Project provides a channel for the voice of global youth through its innovative social research and the global dissemination of alternative views and solutions to current problems.

What services does Wazi Project provide?

Wazi Project differentiates itself from other research companies in that it establishes a dialogue to understand future trends rather than to carry out detached and dispassionate surveys to feed the endless stream of existing statistics.

Our services include:

  • Youth opinion surveys aimed at 13 to 31 year olds, providing corporate and non-corporate clients with a clear understanding of youth concerns and expectations.

  • A quarterly magazine containing findings of that quarter's survey results and complemented by opinion pieces from experts and stakeholders that are directly concerned by the issues at hand. This magazine will initially be online but we hope to develop it into a print magazine with your help.

  • PR and media efforts as an additional and optional service. We help our clients boost their citizenship programmes if they so wish by publicly linking their organisation to the newsworthy outcomes of the commissioned research and pushing these findings to our media contacts

Why do we need your contribution?

The key to our success is to create a huge global database of young people who are interested in taking our surveys and giving us their opinion on today's social issues. We believe that once our community is established, reaching out to today's decision-makers and engaging them in a dialogue with tomorrow's decision-makers will become much easier.

Our current strategy:

We are recruiting young people around the world to work as correspondents for us and push out Wazi Project to youth locally. As we have no funds, these positions are currently unpaid making it hard to recruit or to set clear targets for our volunteers.

We are running non-commissioned surveys at the moment to determine what today's most pressing issues are in the eyes of global youth. We expect the results to be eye-opening as many of the topics raised are quite controversial. With our results we intend to generate a media buzz to help establish Wazi Project as an authority on youth research.

All of this would be made much easier if we had the appropriate tools, the funds to reward our correspondents appropriately, the help of professional designers and web developers as well as a highly interactive website and a print magazine.

Your help will be used to:

  • Grow and remunerate our database of young correspondents in order to have a world-wide reach;

  • Develop sales and marketing materials to reach out to partners and clients: this will include working with professional designers to create business cards, flyers, pamphlets, etc;

  • Develop our website from a rather static page to a highly interactive one where young and old can find a place to engage in dialogue or debate;

  • Launch a print version of our quarterly magazine and create a distribution network in order to disseminate our findings globally;

  • This is just a start. But we feel that getting Wazi Project going will result in a snowball effect: once we get enough people on board there won't be any way of stopping us and the world will need to listen.


How else can you help

We welcome any type of contribution that you want to make. There are many ways to help out.

First of all, you could help create a buzz around Wazi Project. You can like our Facebook page, talk about it with friends and family or use the Indiegogo share tools.

If you fall into our target group (13 to 31), another great way to help us is by taking one of our surveys. Not only are you helping us grow, but you are also making an active contribution in shaping the world into a more informed, transparent and compassionate place.

Apply for a position as correspondent for Wazi Project. Our correspondents are inspiring and well-connected young individuals who support and facilitate our work around the world by representing us in their assigned geographical area. Simply contact us at correspondents@waziproject.com to find out more and see if you fit the bill.
story_txt:
What is Wazi Project?
Our mission is to establish a dialogue between today’s and tomorrow’s decision-makers.
Why Wazi Project?
The under 30s make up more than 50% of the world’s population, have strong opinions on current issues and constitute tomorrow’s decision makers and workforce. More than that, the internet generation has access to an unprecedented wealth of information and is developing a new critical framework through which it looks at global society’s challenges. We believe that there is an increasing desire and a very real need for companies, institutions and governments to hear and consider these ideas in their decision making.
To this end, Wazi Project provides a channel for the voice of global youth through its innovative social research and the global dissemination of alternative views and solutions to current problems.
What services does Wazi Project provide?
Wazi Project differentiates itself from other research companies in that it establishes a dialogue to understand future trends rather than to carry out detached and dispassionate surveys to feed the endless stream of existing statistics.
Our services include:


Youth opinion surveys aimed at 13 to 31 year olds, providing corporate and non-corporate clients with a clear understanding of youth concerns and expectations.


A quarterly magazine containing findings of that quarter's survey results and complemented by opinion pieces from experts and stakeholders that are directly concerned by the issues at hand. This magazine will initially be online but we hope to develop it into a print magazine with your help.


PR and media efforts as an additional and optional service. We help our clients boost their citizenship programmes if they so wish by publicly linking their organisation to the newsworthy outcomes of the commissioned research and pushing these findings to our media contacts

Develop our website from a rather static page to a highly interactive one where young and old can find a place to engage in dialogue or debate;

Our correspondents are inspiring and well-connected young individuals who support and facilitate our work around the world by representing us in their assigned geographical area. Simply contact us at correspondents@waziproject.com to find out more and see if you fit the bill.

story:
A young family I am very close to has had a very difficult year.  Their Dad lost his job and was out of work for 2 months.  He has since gone back to work and they are trying to get back on their feet.  Their landlord informed them if they do not pay all of their back rent by the middle of February he will evict them.  They have been paying toward their back rent every week when they get paid.  Both parents work and they work opposite shifts since there is no money for day care for their 2 young boys.  These people are great parents and work their butts off to take care of their family.  Their youngest son is allergic to gluten and all nuts.  This creates added expense for food.  They receive a minimal amount in state assiatance but with all of their son's allergies they run out very quickly. 

This young family has overcome so many obstacles and it breaks my heart to see them facing eviction just when they thought things were getting better.  We are hoping to help them keep their home.  Any extra funds collected will go to food for the family. 


Thank you in advance for your help and your prayers.  Both are greatly appreciated!  Happy Holidays!!

story:
Summary

Hello my name is Dana.  I am a newly divorced mother of two school aged children.  I need some help to get back on my feet.  I divorced from an abusive marriage for a better life for my children.  I am currently seeking a full-time job in order to support my family and I and have fell behind on the mortgage and utility bills.  Please help me pay my overdue gas and electric bill before it gets turned off. I will provide a picture of my most current bill.   

I believe in giving back and truly appreciate any help that one could provide. I am a gracious person and this is my last resort.  

What We Need & What You Get

Items to be paid  

I need approximately $1,000 to satisfy the full bill to keep the services on.  

I have one perk, an Amazon Gift Card in the amount of $25.00 and personal thank you cards for donations of $5.00.  

If I do not recieve the full amount all monies will still be used for the PSE&G (gas and electric bill).  

The Impact

You are helping my children and I tremendously!  I more than appreciate this.  They will be comfortable for the cold weather.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Every donation is appreciated, if 1,000 people provide $1.00 we will be able to satsify the bill.  If you are unable to help, please share my campaign with others.

story:
Why this Cause

My heart simply aches for the mad mad love affair America has with assault weapons. I work as a social worker. I live in an urban community. I have attended more funerals for children as a result of violence than I care to mention. When 20 1st graders and 6 educators were gunned down in an elementary school on December 14, 2012, I asked myself what can I do to stop the senseless and violent deaths of our children.  After weeks of sleepless nights, Protection not Weapons was born.

My goals with Protection Not Weapons are

  1. Raise awareness about gun violence and children.
  2. Highlight programs and people who are working to make things better.
  3. Raise money to support those programs so that their work can expand.

What We Need & What You Get

Protection Not Weapons is a grassroots organization. Our first quarter fundraising goal for 2013 is $2,013. With that money we will

  • Host 2 awareness events in our community to increase members knowledge about the impact gun violence has on children.
  • Donate 75% of the dollars raised to local organizations dedicated to gun related injuries and death among children.

As a result of supporting Protection Not Weapons you will be eligible for a Bronze, Silver or Gold MVP (Most Valuable Partner) Membership. Depending on your level of support, your MVP Membership will entitle you to

  • Priority seating for you and 3 guests.
  • Special event privileges (i.e. face painting, added entries in auction drawing)
  • Refreshments during events.

The Impact

As a social worker I have seen many effective programs disappear from lack of funding. Groups like www.MomsRising.org started small and prove that 'the little people' can make a big impact on policy and programming.

Protection Not Weapons is a grassroots organizing aimed at making a difference for community based programs and pioneers working to address gun violence and children. We will

  • Provide financial support to help alleviate costs for programs doing the work.
  • Offer a platform for people working to end gun violence can be heard.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about Protection Not Weapons.
  • Like us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/ProectionNotWeapons
  • Follow our blog at www.protectionnotweapons.wordpress.com

story:
Video note:

Please over-look the amateur nature of our first video, as we are not videographers, yet, anyways!  :)   Thank you, Judy


Hello,

Thank you for your interest in this very heart felt and inspirational campaign. 

My name is Judy Trabbold, and I am very passionate about helping people to be healthy, and to be inspired to be all that they are meant to be.  I have been working in the Health/Wellness field for 25 years, including the Addiction/Recovery field.  I am a Naturopath, Certified Community Health Educator and Certified Holistic Health Consultant.   I have 2 wonderful grown children and 2 awesome grandchildren.  After being widowed at an early age,  and having raised my children, I can now devote full time to this inspirational healing mission that I am very enthusiastic about sharing with people!

I am also a long standing Horsewoman with 40 + years of equine ownership and experience.  I am currently a member of the Rolling Rock HorseMasters, an International program and Division of Rolling Rock Hunt Pony Club in my area.  As a HorseMaster adult member, I realize the importance of our volunteer efforts to help support the Pony Club youth organization as it fosters life skills, as well as, equestrian.

In my younger years, I volunteered at a therapeutic equine facility for handicapped children and I was able to experience first hand the connection that these youth felt with the horses and I could see their spirits lift with joy, hope and inspiration, it was truly a heartfelt experience for me. 

More recently, I have facilitated a wellness support group in my community that met weekly for more than a year, and in that time many, many people were able to get the support and help they needed to become healthy again!  This positive response from the community was very fulfilling and inspirational for me.

I am very grateful to have been able to be a part of these healing experiences.

I have also experienced the awesome and amazing healing energies of the horse many times through out my own life.  I am very compelled and passionate about bringing forth and sharing this powerful healing synergy between Horse and Human! 

Thank you for your interest in DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM.

                                              *****************


Healing with Horses at DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM is a nature based wellness initiative that embraces the healing energies of horses, as well as, music, art, nature, nutrition, etc - allowing women to nurture and reconnect to their authentic selves so as to Live, Love, and Give fully and wholly to themselves, family, community, and world!

This women's program is called the 'Goddess Gate' at DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM.   The Goddess Gate is a multi-dimention, transformational  natural program that nourishes the whole person - The Spirit -The Mind - The Body & The Soul, so as to enhance awareness and elevate perception of a healthy life to provide for optimal vitality and inspirational life!

At DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM we feel that horses and their healing energy are the perfect and appropriate healing vessel for building self esteem, self respect, leadership qualities, and care giving abilities. 

Bonding with such a majestic animal lends itself to a life-time of embodying the horse energy and attributes known as "Horse Medicine".

When a woman is living her authentic self, her heart energy (love) is resonating her most highest and strongest energy out into the world.  This vibrational frequency when combined with the energy as she plays the musical instrument is the compelling force of the 'Dancinghorse', and that which draws the 'Dancinghorse' to her.   This beautiful scenario between the horse and human is a wonderful interaction; and even more so, this incredible dance is also a metaphor for her energies(music) creating the reality(dance) of her life! 


.                                                               *

                                       SYNERGY  WITH  NATURE

                                                                *


Our supporting Programs at  DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM include:


1.  "NOURISHING W/ NATURE'S NUTRITION" - The healing power of super nutrient dense food is explored, and recipes are demonstrated and served.

2.  "THE SUN FOOD CHART" (c) -  Life Giving / Super Nutrient Chart.

3.  "THE WONDERFUL WAYS OF THE WOMAN'S HORMONAL SELF".  -  We address, embrace, and nourish our female and male hormones for healthy harmonic balance. 

4.  "DANCING ON THE EQUAL SIGN".  -   [E=MC2 ] - ENERGY frequencies               ( thoughts, feelings, and emotions)  EQUAL  (transform)  into the MATTER of your reality! 

5.  "BIOLOGY OF BELIEF".  -  Scientifically proven to heal DNA, and more!

6.  "HORSE BONDING MEDITATION".

7.   "MUSIC EXPRESSION W/ DANCING HORSE".

8.  "THE WISE WOMAN'S PATH".  -  Embracing the wisdom of your life.

9.  "EQUINE RYTHMIC DANCE". 

10. "MEDITATION IN MOTION YOGA".  - Free Flowing movement to music.

11.  "ART IN NATURE".   -  Observing and using the healing frequencies found in nature including rocks, crystals, plants, metals, wood, etc.  to bring about our own creative healing energies.

12. "PRANCING HORSE TEA TIME".  - A reflective time to enjoy a "Special Tea" as you relax in the Goddess Gazebo over-looking the "Dancing Field". 

13. "EARTHING AND HERBS".  -  Tuning and grounding your energy to that of the earth's frequency while barefoot walking and wild crafting (picking) weeds/ wildflowers.

14. "GRATITUDE CIRCLE".   


                                                                 **********


DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM offers: 

Day-Workshops

And

Weekend Retreats.   


                             ~  SET  -  YOURSELF  -  FREE

 

                                                    AT

                   DANCING   HORSE   HEALING  FARM


In our hopes to provide this inspirational healing program to women who may benefit from it, we are contacting our local woman's shelter, and Big Sister organizations.  We hope to receive enough funding through this campaign to directly apply funds to scholarships for women who are in need of such an uplifting intervention, but have no resources to pay.  We feel that the horse's healing energies and the supportive programs offered at DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM will enable women to transform and thrive in their lives!


                                                                ~

We are hoping to hold our first workshops at DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM in October, after the provisions for the farm are finished and programs are fully in place.  Currently, we have 3 women on our waiting list and much positive interest from the community.  Also, just lately, 2 people have offered to volunteer to help with the Vision of the healing farm; this offer of help from these special people just from mention of the healing with horses program, left me filled with gratitude and validation for this very meaningful healing mission.

It seems as though many people these days are recognizing and embracing the synergistic energy of horse and human, and experiencing the very unique healing and empowering qualities of the horse.   This is what I call "Horse Medicine!"

                                  An awareness who's time has come! 


                               Judy and Sassy (aka - Dancing Horse)

                                                                 *

This campaign is very important to me in many ways:

It's important firstly because I want to share this blessing and experience of healing with horses with people that could truly benefit from it.

Secondly, I have felt the healing powers of horses many times through out my life.  I am very grateful for the horses and the good people that helped me through some very difficult times in my life.  So, now, I am in a good place in my life, my kids are grown, I have a beautiful farm and I really have a strong desire to give back and share what I have experienced with horse healing energy, in the hopes to help others and really make a difference in their lives.  And hopefully the healing love continues generation to generation and so on. - This is my greatest wish.

Lastly, over the years, my children and their music have showed me the "Dancing Horse", and this is too beautiful and magical to NOT be shared!

Thank you!



By supporting and/or contributing to this campaign of Healing with Horses at DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM, you will be helping to uplift, inspire, and heal women thru a nature - based wellness program that will provide for many women and teenage girls the chance to transform their lives and be their healthy authentic selves. 

The magnitude of your support is that by helping women to heal and be true to themselves, their healthy higher living will then naturally overflow and enhance all other areas of their lives, including family and other relationships.  This is very important because the healthy woman now has the ability and the tools she needs to teach and be a living example to the next generation, and then those future women to the generation following and the "healthy cycle" continues on.............  This healthy cycle will automatically extend out to community through normal daily living and interactions with friends, neighbors, co-workers, etc.... As communities become healthier and grow exponentially, together we can heal the Earth!  

The journey of a million miles begins with one step.  :)

Thank you so much!! 


Kentucky Derby Day!  Three generations:  Jessica, SJ, and Judy.  :)


                                                         *


Campaign Funding Needs for DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM:

$  755        Indiegogo fees

$2,500      (5) Healing with Horses Scholarships (Scholarship program includes:  selective supportive programs, organic meals, take-home materials,  t-shirt & mug.)

$1,200     Insurance

$1,500      Farm road maintenance / public accessability

$   400      Perks for campaign

$   800      Round pen for bonding with horse

$   800       Website/maintenance and server

$1,000       Farm help and maintenance

$1,200        Therapeutic Pony

$  400        Supplies / CD's, books, info, etc for the Support Programs

$  200         Posters

__________________________________________

$10,755    Total


*If we do not reach our funding goal, we will cut back where ever possible and still find a way to offer scholarship programs.

*If we exceed our funding goal, we will continue to supply the needs for the healing farm, such as:  tractor, healing gardens, feed and supplies for horses, specific supplies for the healing programs(musical instruments, art supplies, educational literature and CD's etc.), barn maintenance, posters, marketing, and so on.   And definitely more scholarships!


                                                                      *

       Other Ways To Help                                                           

Please feel free to share this campaign through e-mails and social media, etc. with Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word.  Thank you


Thank you so much for your interest and support in any way for this very heartfelt, inspirational campaign of

HEALING WITH HORSES AND INSPIRING WOMEN!


Authentically,

Judy Trabbold

"GRATITUDE CIRCLE".                                                                     **********DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM offers:  Day-Workshops AndWeekend Retreats.                                ~  SET  -  YOURSELF  -  FREE                                                     AT
                   DANCING   HORSE   HEALING  FARM In our hopes to provide this inspirational healing program to women who may benefit from it, we are contacting our local woman's shelter, and Big Sister organizations.  We hope to receive enough funding through this campaign to directly apply funds to scholarships for women who are in need of such an uplifting intervention, but have no resources to pay.  We feel that the horse's healing energies and the supportive programs offered at DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM will enable women to transform and thrive in their lives!                                                                ~We are hoping to hold our first workshops at DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM in October, after the provisions for the farm are finished and programs are fully in place.  Currently, we have 3 women on our waiting list and much positive interest from the community.  Also, just lately, 2 people have offered to volunteer to help with the Vision of the healing farm; this offer of help from these special people just from mention of the healing with horses program, left me filled with gratitude and validation for this very meaningful healing mission.It seems as though many people these days are recognizing and embracing the synergistic energy of horse and human, and experiencing the very unique healing and empowering qualities of the horse.   This is what I call "Horse Medicine!"                                  An awareness who's time has come!                                Judy and Sassy (aka - Dancing Horse)                                                                 *This campaign is very important to me in many ways: It's important firstly because I want to share this blessing and experience of healing with horses with people that could truly benefit from it.Secondly, I have felt the healing powers of horses many times through out my life.  I am very grateful for the horses and the good people that helped me through some very difficult times in my life.  So, now, I am in a good place in my life, my kids are grown, I have a beautiful farm and I really have a strong desire to give back and share what I have experienced with horse healing energy, in the hopes to help others and really make a difference in their lives.  And hopefully the healing love continues generation to generation and so on. - This is my greatest wish.Lastly, over the years, my children and their music have showed me the "Dancing Horse", and this is too beautiful and magical to NOT be shared!Thank you!By supporting and/or contributing to this campaign of Healing with Horses at DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM, you will be helping to uplift, inspire, and heal women thru a nature - based wellness program that will provide for many women and teenage girls the chance to transform their lives and be their healthy authentic selves.  The magnitude of your support is that by helping women to heal and be true to themselves, their healthy higher living will then naturally overflow and enhance all other areas of their lives, including family and other relationships.  This is very important because the healthy woman now has the ability and the tools she needs to teach and be a living example to the next generation, and then those future women to the generation following and the "healthy cycle" continues on.............  This healthy cycle will automatically extend out to community through normal daily living and interactions with friends, neighbors, co-workers, etc.... As communities become healthier and grow exponentially, together we can heal the Earth!  The journey of a million miles begins with one step.  :)Thank you so much!!  Kentucky Derby Day!  Three generations:  Jessica, SJ, and Judy.  :)                                                         *Campaign Funding Needs for DANCING HORSE HEALING FARM:$  755        Indiegogo fees$2,500      (5) Healing with Horses Scholarships (Scholarship program includes:  selective supportive programs, organic meals, take-home materials,  t-shirt & mug.)$1,200     Insurance $1,500      Farm road maintenance / public accessability$   400      Perks for campaign $   800      Round pen for bonding with horse$   800       Website/maintenance and server$1,000       Farm help and maintenance$1,200        Therapeutic Pony$  400        Supplies / CD's, books, info, etc for the Support Programs$  200         Posters__________________________________________$10,755    Total*If we do not reach our funding goal, we will cut back where ever possible and still find a way to offer scholarship programs.*If we exceed our funding goal, we will continue to supply the needs for the healing farm, such as:  tractor, healing gardens, feed and supplies for horses, specific supplies for the healing programs(musical instruments, art supplies, educational literature and CD's etc.), barn maintenance, posters, marketing, and so on.   And definitely more scholarships!                                                                      *       Other Ways To Help                                                            Please feel free to share this campaign through e-mails and social media, etc. with Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word.  Thank you Thank you so much for your interest and support in any way for this very heartfelt, inspirational campaign of HEALING WITH HORSES AND INSPIRING WOMEN!Authentically,Judy Trabbold

story:
Welcome to Open Source Maker Labs!

Open Source Maker Labs is a high-tech digital fabrication lab, where members can learn, collaborate, innovate, design, and build almost anything! Makers have access to a wide range of tools, equipment, resources, and workspace.  In short:

We Make Makers!

We believe the Maker Movement is more than just individuals pursuing a hobby.  Makers are life-long learners, who are passionate about their interest and want to share their projects.  This is where innovation, invention, and jobs start!

Help us expand to support the growing Maker Community in North San Diego County!

Thanks to the fantastic support from our community, we have built a great lab in the Vista Business Park. We have been hosting some incredible team projects, from robotic tracked vehicles to liquid-fueled rockets. We're finding more opportunities to support team-based maker challenges for cutting-edge projects and inventions. We can provide the equipment, training, and mentoring for these incredible teams, but often they lack a basic ingredient - funding for their project.

We're using our Indiegogo InDemand campaign to provide a mechanism for "microfunding" these teams. By selecting perks specific for a team, you can directly support the team of your choice.

What are team-based maker challenges?

Making covers an incredible range of skill sets and technologies, but too often when we hear about making, it's usually associated with a few basic skills - typically 3D printing and LEDs. Maker challenges put all of these skills and many others into the context of solving problems:

Design and build, or significantly repurpose, a product that will solve a problem, need or want.

Team-based maker challenges are about tackling the toughest problems, and have several common characteristics:

  • They attempt to solve a problem with a new or novel approach
  • There is a definite time limit
  • The problem is large enough that it takes a team to solve it
  • May take place in a competition format.

In addition to using a combination of many technical skills, team-based maker challenges also require many non-technical skills: ingenuity, teamwork, communications, tenacity, courage and commitment.

 (here's THE most important paragraph...)

This last set of skills won't be found in any course catalog from your local schools, but employers are constantly seeking people that can demonstrate those skills. The end product is not as important as the path you took to get there. This is where team-based maker challenges come in. They give you the chance to exercise and demonstrate those skills.

What kind of challenges do you host at OSML?

Lots! Here are some examples (past, present and future):

  • FIRST Robotics
  • Intercollegiate Rocket Engineering Competition/SEDS-UCSD
  • Power Racing Series
  • RoboSub Underwater Autonomous Vehicle Competition
  • NASA 3D Printing Challenge

and more to come...

What can I do at OSML?

Are you an entrepreneur with a great idea?  Prototype and build it in our lab!
Create, build, learn! We have large, open workspaces filled with cool tools: electronics shop, CNC machines, 3D printers, laser cutters, welding and soldering tools, drawing and modelling programs, and computer lab.

 

 

 

 

 

Learning-Friendly

Want to learn a new skill? Take one of our many interactive classes taught by experts. Sign up for classes such as Arduino and Raspberry Pi programming, virtual machines, electronics and circuit design, CNC, and welding.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                                            

Why “Open Source”?

 

 

Open source accelerates innovation through freedom of collaboration.
When people think Open Source, they generally think about software where many people contribute to a product (such as Linux).  But there is also Open Source hardware, where people have access to the design of the components, like Arduino, and other areas like Open Science and Open Education.
At Open Source Maker Labs, we value the Open Source philosophy and promote an environment where Open Source hardware, software, science, and education are used.

Lifelong Learning at OSML


We share ideas on new and unique applications of technologies to encourage invention and prototyping. Many of these activities include 3D printing, electronics, robotics, and the use of advanced CNC tools. OSML has a strong focus on using and learning practical skills and applying them creatively – it’s the freedom to innovate, create, and invent – to make whatever you can imagine! We offer classes and workshops that are fun and interactive. If you're a beginner, or want to learn an entirely new skill set, we'll get you started. If you're a pro and are looking for adventure, take on one of our tech challenges and hone your skills. We encourage a collaborative environment where our members can meet and share their knowledge and experience. Members have an opportunity to work together on larger, more complex projects that require different skills and talent.

 

 

 

 

Supporting our Maker Community

OSML has been active in the San Diego Maker community, and we’re grateful for enthusiastic response we have received. We played several key roles in bringing together San Diego’s first Maker Faire in October 2015 at Balboa Park, and we're involved in several volunteer groups are working together to bring TWO Maker Faires to San Diego County in 2016.


This spring, we've been busy supporting FIRST Robotics Competition Team 4014 and the UCSD SEDS team with mentoring, equipment and technical support. We need to expand now to support the local maker community, students, and entrepreneurs – you can be a part of that!

 

 

 

 

Actually, It Is Rocket Science....

 

The UCSD SEDSteam has designed and built a 3D-printed engine powered by liquid oxygen and kerosene for their current rocket, Vulcan-1, and they do frequent tests and builds to improve the design and structure of their rocket. In 2015, they ran a successful crowdfunding campaign on Kickstarter, raising $21,882 to pay for an industrial 3D print in inconel (a nickel alloy) of their custom designed engine. They learn CAD on the fly and teach each other how to use power tools and fabrication machines. Through involvement in SEDS, these students learn how to be self-advocates for gaining new skill sets and understanding how the components of the industries work, making them much more competitive as they enter the aerospace job market.

The UCSD SEDS team needed more space and fabrication capabilities than what was available on campus, so they went in search of a makerspace - this led them to Open Source Maker Labs. Becoming a build space for SEDS naturally fit in with many of our goals here at the lab, and since we currently host two FIRST Robotics teams and several entrepreneurs developing product prototypes, we ended up with three generations of engineering teams working together.

 

What's in the lab now?

 

  • Sherline 8620 4-axis CNC Mill & Lathe Systems
  • 80 watt CO2 laser cutter, 24"x36" bed
  • Two Afinia H480 3D printers
  • Type A Machines Series 1 3D Printer
  • Probotix FireBall X90 CNC Router
  • Lincoln POWER MIG 140C Welding System (with aluminum spool gun)
  • Porter Cable 12 Speed Floor Drill Press
  • SafetySpeed H5 panel saw
  • Hitachi compund miter saw
  • DeWalt 14 Inch Chop Saw
  • 10 Classroom Laptops (Dell Inspiron 17Rs)
  • 5 HP Proliant DL140 Servers
  • 10 Weller Soldering Stations and 20 soldering irons
  • 8 Tektronix oscilliscopes
  • Arduino, Raspberry Pi, BeagleBone, Breadboards, Electronic Components
  • 4,000 lb capacity forklift

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our Location and Facility

Our location is in Vista, North County San Diego near the SR 78 corridor. We have easy access to major freeways, and are close to Cal State University - San Marcos, Palomar College, Mira Costa College and several high schools. We are close to a variety of retail and industrial suppliers, as well as potential business partners. We are in a light industrial facility with 4700 square feet of space that includes a fabrication lab, an electronics workshop and a computer lab/design studio.

 

 

 

 

 

The OSML Team

 

 

Dan Hendricks leads the management team as the company's President. OSML is based on his vision of an open-source meeting place that is equipped with the hardware and software tools to encourage the growth of ideas and innovation. Dan has over 30 years of experience in the Navy, with a bachelor of science degree in mathematics from the Naval Academy, and a master of science degree in computer science from the Naval Postgraduate School. Since leaving active duty, Dan has worked in both the private and public sector in roles of increasing responsibility in program management and budgeting, network architecture, systems engineering, and computer security. Dan is a registered Professional Engineer (Electrical) in the state of Washington, and is a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP). He is a member of IEEE, IEEE Computer Society, and IEEE Communications Society. In preparation for starting the business, Dan completed the Kauffman FastTrack NewVenture program for veteran entrepreneurs and was a participating team member in a StartUp Weekend. He is alos on the board of directors for the San Diego Makers Guild.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Mary Alice Hendricks is Vice President of OSML. She earned her master’s degree in Public Administration from the Monterey Institute of International Studies and has experience managing grants and contracts from state and federal sources for a variety of clients both in the United States and in Third World countries. As grants and contracts compliance officer, Mary Alice was responsible for tracking program progress, monitoring and approving all budget expenditures, filing all progress and final program reports, and working closely with funding agencies to ensure the success and sustainability of the grants. Her work as the executive director of the San Diego Young Artists Symphony has helped develop her leadership skills in managing programs and people and placed her at the front of successful fund-raising efforts.

 

 

 

 

 

Ellen Hendricks is studying Mechanical Engineering at the University of California, San Diego. Her interest in making began in her sophomore year of high school, when she joined San Pasqual High School's FIRST Robotics team. She went on to High Tech High North County and formed a new robotics team with her dad and brother. As president for two years, she led the team to the semi-finals in the San Diego FIRST Robotics Regional Competition. During her junior year of high school, Ellen participated in the COSMOS program and interned at the Center for Research on Biological Systems at the University of California, San Diego, where she learned about the use of maker spaces in professional settings. She earned a scholarship from the Society of Women Engineers and intends to combine her Mechanical Engineering degree with her passion for educational reform to bring the Maker Movement into schools.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Bryan Hendricks is currently a senior in high school, and is studying Computer Engineering at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo. He began making with Legos when he was young, and this interest evolved into a passion when he joined the San Pasqual High School FIRST Robotics team with his sister in his freshman year of high school. He went on to form the High Tech High North County FIRST Robotics team with his sister, acting as vice-president for two years and president for one. Bryan had summer internships at the SPAWAR robotics lab and at Meziere Enterprises. While he isn't sure exactly what he wants to do after college, he knows that he'll have options with a degree in Computer Engineering.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Ariel Therrien joined our team in June of 2015, but has been an unofficial part of the lab since we opened. Some of her work can be seen around the space, including the Maker Highlight posters created for Maker Faire 2015 and many of our laser cut trials and creations. She spends most of her time in school, but on weekends she can be found updating social media, writing blog posts, and generating content for OSML. Our Marketing Manager is also quite proficient with our laser cutter and 3D printers, and is working on developing her skills in other areas around the lab. Ariel is also a third year Marine Biology major at Palomar College and University of California, San Diego. While her main focus is in biology and oceanography, she hopes to learn as much as she can at the lab. She is usually involved with as many group projects as possible, along with the set-up and maintenance for many of our machines. Ariel loves to discuss what she’s working on in the lab, as well as her other passions, which include oceanography, herpetology, and knitting.

 

 

 

 

How Can I Help?

Even if you aren't a financial contributor, there are lots of ways you can help to make a difference in our maker community:

  • Do you have some great skills that you'd like to share? Ask about being one of our instructors here.
  • Have a really awesome project that you've built and would like to tell others about? Be a guest presenter at one of our Meetups.
  • Tell all your friends and colleagues about us! Connect with us on Facebook and tell people about us!

story:
A simple solution for a big problem

We are a team of 8 bachelor graduated students and we are attending the MSc in Engineering at the University of Padova. We have been chosen, after a selection done by a panel of experts at the European Space Research and Technology Center (ESTEC), to participate to the student program Rexus/Bexus; this project, coordinated by the European Space Agency, allows students from European universities to carry out scientific and technological experiments on research rockets and balloons. Our experiment has been selected to flight in October 2014 on the Bexus stratospheric balloon! However, before talking too much, let's start from the beginning.

Since the dawn of space exploration, a thermal control system (TCS) for spacecraft has been required in order to survive to the extreme conditions of space. TCSs permit to insulate payloads from this extremely cold conditions, but anyhow, due to their own heat generation, payloads need to be protected also by overheating. This task was committed to heat radiators.

Nowadays radiators exist in several different forms, designed for every space mission depending on the function to perform. For this reason it is difficult to compare different heat radiators, but anyway it is possible to underline that most of space/planetary missions use passive radiators, simple bare metal plates, coupled with devices that allow a sort of active control of the system. These are mostly: heaters, mechanical actuators or devices that involve the presence of fluids.
The presence of these devices generates several issues, depending on the type, such as the strong affection of the electric supply budget, containment measures for fluids or the use of mechanical actuators with gears and connections.

We designed a new radiator concept which does not involve any of these devices nor the problems related to them (no typical mechanical actuators with gears , no fluids, low power required) nevertheless it allows an active control of the system varying its equivalent thermal resistance. 

This concept avoids the typical issues of space radiators.



In addition, space exploration requires to reduce the mass, sizes and electrical power demand of spacecrafts and probes; this objective could be achieved through the miniaturization of spacecraft subsystems, but this solution is usually constrained by performance requirements, reliability and other system drivers. Therefore, new ways are to be tested, and one of these is the development of new technologies, such as new kind of actuators. For this reason we decided to use actuators based on Electro-Active Polymers.

Electro-active polymers (EAPs) are a particular class of polymers, widely studied in the last decade, which show a deformation in response to an electric stimulation; this particular behaviour encouraged new studies to test their potentialities as actuators. Among EAPs, dielectric elastomers (DE) exhibit the most promising properties. The natural ease of preparing and shaping such DE materials, coupled with their low mass and large displacements, show that they have the potential to enable new technologies, like actuators often referred to as artificial muscles.
In summary, the advantages of DE actuators are several: they are characterized by a low density (mass reduction, inertia forces reduction), they have a limited number of moving parts (reduced complexity, reduced costs, higher reliability) and they provide a direct conversion of electrical energy into mechanical energy.

We decided to explore a new path for active thermal control. We had the innovative idea to switch the way in which the heat passes through the radiator, by varying it from conduction to radiation.
In detail, our radiator we present is composed by three overlapped parallel plates constrained so that is possible to separate them or put them in good thermal contact. This switching operation, the actuation between the open/close condition of the plates, allows to vary the system equivalent thermal resistance and so to control the heat dissipated to the environment.

The simplicity of this concept, along with its high adaptability to variable environmental conditions, makes it suitable for a lot of future aerospace applications, especially for planetary probes without attitude control (i.e. balloons, airships and rovers on Mars, Venus and Titan).

Trust us, it works

We made several FEM simulation using Matlab® in order to understand how the system works and what his performances are.

The results are extraordinary: we are able to control the temperature of the dummy payload in an effective and rapid manner.

We also simulated a stratopheric balloon flight up to 30 km, with all random thermal loads considered (Sun, planetary albedo, convection, etc).



As you can see from the graph, we are able to guarantee the thermal steadiness of the payload (between 7000s and 10000s). 

In the peak at 6000s is shown how effective is this kind of radiator to warm the payload in case of need and, after that, how quickly it can dissipate heat if required.

We are supported by:


  • European Space Agency



  • Deutsches Zentrum für Luft- und Raumfahrt



  • Swedish Space Corporation



  • Swedish National Space Board



HELP US! SUPPORT US! WE REALLY NEED IT TO ACHIEVE OUR DREAM!

These sponsors will provide us the stratospheric balloon, however we have to build and develop the new technology we want to test.

The CISAS and DII departments of University of Padova will help us for about 30% of  direct costs, the remaining is at our charge.

We estimate that the total cost will be about 30000 €, due to the components that have to withstand heavy thermal and structural loads.
Any support that you give will enable us to make a major step towards our goal.

The path to success? Together with us!

Tie your name or your brand to POLARIS experiment. We will do several conferences, pubblications and trips in which you can obtain visibility to the main european space agencies and aerospace industries.

Your brand/name will be also written in our documentation and attached to the experiment during the flight.

Find us, follow us, like us

Website      http://polarisexperiment.com/
Facebook   https://www.facebook.com/polarisexperiment

 


This is a great chance to follow and support a real miniature space mission, from the design to the launch
story_txt:
A simple solution for a big problem
We are a team of 8 bachelor graduated students and we
are attending the MSc in Engineering at the University of Padova. We have been
chosen, after a selection done by a panel of experts at the European Space
Research and Technology Center (ESTEC), to participate to the student program
Rexus/Bexus; this project, coordinated by the European Space Agency, allows
students from European universities to carry out scientific and technological
experiments on research rockets and balloons. Our experiment has been selected
to flight in October 2014 on the Bexus stratospheric balloon! However, before
talking too much, let's start from the beginning.








Since the dawn of space exploration, a thermal control system (TCS) for
spacecraft has been required in order to survive to the extreme conditions of
space. TCSs permit to insulate payloads from this extremely cold conditions,
but anyhow, due to their own heat generation, payloads need to be protected also
by overheating. This task was committed to heat radiators.
Nowadays radiators exist in several different forms, designed for every
space mission depending on the function to perform. For this reason it is
difficult to compare different heat radiators, but anyway it is possible to
underline that most of space/planetary missions use passive radiators, simple bare
metal plates, coupled with devices that allow a sort of active control of the
system. These are mostly: heaters, mechanical actuators or devices that involve
the presence of fluids.The presence of these devices generates several issues, depending on the
type, such as the strong affection of the electric supply budget, containment
measures for fluids or the use of mechanical actuators with gears and
connections.

We designed a new radiator concept which does not involve any of these devices
nor the problems related to them (no typical mechanical actuators with gears ,
no fluids, low power required) nevertheless it allows an active control of the
system varying its equivalent thermal resistance. 

This concept avoids the typical issues of space
radiators.

they are characterized
by a low density (mass reduction, inertia forces reduction), they have a

mechanical energy.

innovative idea to switch the way in which the heat passes through the radiator,
by varying it from conduction to radiation.

condition of the plates, allows to vary the system equivalent thermal
resistance and so to control the heat dissipated to the environment.

adaptability to variable environmental conditions, makes it suitable for a lot

As you can see from the graph, we are able to guarantee the thermal steadiness of the payload (between 7000s and 10000s).

warm the payload in case of need and, after that, how quickly it can 
dissipate heat if required.

European Space Agency



Deutsches Zentrum für Luft- und Raumfahrt



Swedish Space Corporation



Swedish National Space Board







HELP US! SUPPORT US! WE REALLY NEED IT TO ACHIEVE OUR DREAM!



These sponsors will provide us the stratospheric balloon, however we have to build and develop the new technology we want to test.


The CISAS and DII departments of University of Padova will help us for about 30% of  direct costs, the remaining is at our charge.
We

components that have to withstand heavy thermal and structural loads.Any support that you give will enable us to make a major step towards our goal.

story:
Jumping for Freedom

For my birthday this year I wanted to do something significant.  In 2012, I wrote and directed a short film, co-producing with my best friend and business partner of EVE Entertainment.  This film was called COERCED and was influenced by how girls are coerced into prostitution and/or sexually exploited within Canada.  Since creating this film, raising awareness on human trafficking and sexual exploitation has become a passion of mine.  Once you see such incredible injustice, it is impossible to turn your back on it anymore.  In whatever way I can, I want to help the women out there who have been used and abused.  Part of how I do this is through the films that I create and using them to educate others.

Rather than just doing something fun to celebrate a birthday, I wanted to push myself to do something I am afraid of.  I am petrified of heights.

"Only when we are no longer afraid do we begin to live." - Dorothy Thompson

As someone who has experienced fear at the hands of a controlling and abusive person, I want to step into that freedom of living without fear and living for others.  Jumping off a bridge is a great active step signifying that move forward. 

A few of my courageous friends and I, who have all gone through their our own adversity, are all going to Bungee jump with me and raise money for the shelter and program  at "Deborah's Gate."

Deborah's Gate - Salvation Army

100% of funds raised will go directly to Deborah's Gate.

"Deborah’s Gate is a specialized program of care that exists to serve international and domestic women age 18 and up who have been trafficked into situations of sexual and labour exploitation, and are in need of protective and restorative housing and healing."

"The confidential and secure location of Deborah’s Gate grants victims of sexual human trafficking safety and refuge with access to staff support 24 hours a day. Deborah’s Gate currently has capacity to house 10 survivors of sexual exploitation for both short-term and long-term periods. Deborah’s Gate offers a variety of in-house programs that teach basic life and living skills, coping mechanisms and goal development strategies. "

Visit their website for further information: http://www.deborahsgate.ca


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about this campaign to your friends/co-workers/school in your community.
  • Cheer us on...we're all a bit hesitant :)

story:
Daya Yoga

Daya Yoga, filled with love and support from the beautiful community around it, has been in the Ridgewood neighborhood for over three years. Daya not only provides the community with the practice of yoga, but brings people together, a place for neighbors to come and try something new, to discuss, learn, grow together. Ania has run the studio herself for the past three years and recently took Meghan on as a partner. Together, we thrive learn and grow not only from each other but from the students that walk in the door each day. 
The campaign to keep Daya alive is for the community, to keep that home base for many. A new space for Daya not only means a new chapter, but new classes to offer, new workshops, new instructors, a space of our own. Money made by this campaign will help us move into a space and make any necessary renovations to open the doors. Contributions big and small can help us in such an immense way. 
Daya in sanskrit means compassion, and that alone is the driving force behind everything that we do. Everything that Daya does is for the compassion of the community and we would love to have the community be apart of the next chapter, every step of the way!

What is needed?

Any contribution can help. All donations will be put towards moving into our own location , home for Daya, also money will be put towards renovations such as flooring, paint, any necessary walls that need to be put up.
Those who contribute, in exchange will receive free yoga classes. Certain contributors will be offered individual private yoga classes as well! To help show how much we love and appreciate each and every donation.

~The Impact~

Daya needs contributions in order to keep its doors open. If we cannot move into a new space, then Daya unfortunately will be no longer come September. Please help us keep Daya as we have so much more love and passion to bring, so much more to learn and grow together!

Other Ways You Can Help!

We understand that contributing monetarily may not be in the cards for you, but you still would like to contribute and help. But how? We would love it if you could spread the word, tell your friends and family about us! Also, if Daya is able to move into a new space, donating your time for painting, maybe installation of what is needed, furniture, lighting etc is also greatly appreciated and needed!

We love having Daya apart of our lives and hope you do as well. Nothing would make us happier than to see Daya continue and grow.
BE THE CHANGE YOU WISH TO SEE
Love and light,
Daya Yoga
Ania and Meghan

story:
* Update 11/24/2013

The first wave of the CDRC's relief efforts has served more than 10,000 families in 8 provinces including: Leyte (Tanauan, Albuera, Palo, Alang-alang), Samar (Basey), Cebu (Medellin), Capiz (Tapaz), Iloilo (Barotac Viejo, Estancia, Islas de Gigantes), Negros (Cadiz City), Masbate (Ezperanza) and Palawan (Coron).

As Typhoon Haiyan efforts move from relief to recovery, the CDRC is working to provide the affected communities with food, shelter, planting seeds and farm inputs, tools and supplies for the repair of fishing boats, and psychosocial support.

Thank you again for your support. Please keep spreading the word.

* Update 11/13/2013

WE DID IT! Thanks to you, we exceeded our goal of $5,000 in just 72 hours — and with 20 days still left in the campaign.

Please be assured that any donations we raise from this point on will continue to fund CDRC’s emergency relief efforts. 

Also remember that CDRC’s work does not end with providing urgent relief. CDRC invests heavily on rebuilding lives and helping the poorest and most vulnerable communities be better prepared for natural disasters. In a country that typically gets hit by more typhoons than any country in the world—and lies in the Pacific Ring of Fire—this is very important work.

Thank you so much for your support. Maraming salamat po!

---

Donate today to send vital disaster relief support to the Philippines in the aftermath of Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda). Your donation - whether it’s $10 or $100 -  will support the work of the Citizens' Disaster Response Center (CDRC), a locally-led relief organization working on the ground right now in the hardest hit regions of the Philippines.

Typhoon Haiyan's Impact

  • 10,000 Estimated number of people killed
  • 330,000 Estimated number of people displaced
  • 4 million Children affected

How Your Donation Can Help

  • $10 Provides rice to a family of 6 for 3 days. 
  • $25 Provides food and water to a displaced family for 3 days.
  • $50 Provides sleeping mats and blankets to 4 storm survivors.
  • $100 Provides 2 families with sleeping and hygiene kits, and several days of food and water.

story:
Help a thriving dance therapeutic wellness center in Brooklyn grow


I, Renee Manzolillo, am the owner and founder of Breakin Boundaries, a Creative Therapeutic Wellness Center, offering dance/fitness and therapeutic wellness services for both adults and children with and without special needs.  Not only am I a business owner, I am also a mom, a wife, a former junior Olympic gymnast and professional dancer. I am also a Certified Movement Analyst (CMA) from Laban/Bartenieff Institute of Movement Studies, LIMS® and an ABA (Applied Behavior Analyst) therapist.

My goal is to expand Breakin Boundaries' services, products and self-experiences so that, in return, I may help guide, facilitate and teach a way of life for both children and adults based on there individual needs.

Ranging from therapeutic, creative, and wellness services to everyday dance/fitness and confidence booster classes, Breakin Boundaries helps teach the meaning of happiness as a whole to the people within our community. 

I believe in networking and collaborative works with others in our community. Do not be afraid to ask for help, because in order to create successful community programs, we must rely on one another for support.

Breakin Boundaries' success begins with me, but its success is not possible without your help. We need you to help turn our vision into a reality

What We Need & What You Get

Breakin Boundaries is looking to raise $18,000. 

This money will be put towards much needed materials, proper space rental, additional equipment for classes, etc.  Eighteen thousand dollars would cover a majority of the expenses needed to expand our business.  Granted if we do not meet our goal, any money raised will still be accepted and put towards Breakin Boundaries business plan.  We are asking the community to come together and help us in any way possible.  Please help Breakin Boundaries raise enough funds to expand OUR vision for what Breakin Boundaries is intended to be.


By helping us raise monies you will receive your choice of a perk by how you decide you would like to support our expansion.

You can simply refer 5 friends and for those 5 people that make a contribution you will receive a complimantary week of Breakin Boundaries classes or a 1/2 consult with me (Renee) the friends you refer must make mention of your name in there contribution comment box the rest of the perks to choose are listed to the right of the page. 


My story:  I was a former professional dancer and competitive junior Olympic gymnast who suffered a severe lower back injury, which ended my career in all forms of movement in July of 2002 (as I was told by a dozen spinal orthopedics) During this time of depression, and physical and mental trauma, my younger cousin was diagnosed with Autism - something I did not understand. This child, however, would become the light at the end of the tunnel. He helped me regain all of my strength, courage and ambition for the passions I had in life.  As I began my training as an ABA therapist and began to do hands on work with my cousin, I found myself falling in love with the work of helping a child with special needs. During this time, my work with autistic children became a big part of my life,as I took on more cases working independently with autistic children.

 

(Dr Temple Grandin and I) "I had the pleasure of meeting her three times and attending her conferences"

Although content in my ABA work, something was missing; it was my passion, my drive and my vision for movement in dance and fitness.It was during this time that I found IM=X Pilates. It was the right form of rehabilitation I needed to regain some form of normalcy in my body. It helped so much in my physical and mental rehabilitation that I decided to become certified in the discipline. This was not enough for me, so I sought out other options and came across The Laban Institute for movement studies. “Where my life changed”

I regained enough strength to begin moving again, I realized that it had all started with these special children that were meant to cross my path. They helped me regain the courage and strength I needed to get back into movement. The more time I invested in a child with Autism, the more I began to believe in myself. I started to expand my physical capabilities. It was then I found Zumba, this fun exciting dance craze brought me back to my Latin dance roots. It was a great way for me to get back into dancing. I decided to become certified because I thought it was a great way to connect others to dance.

In June of 2011 I decided to go for it all; it was time to pull out everything I had stored in a box (diagrams, business plans, the name ‘Breakin Boundaries’) since I was 14, and make it a reality.  I rented space from a friend in Greenpoint, Brooklyn who owns OTOM GYM.  There I taught IM=X Pilates and ZUMBA in a basement. I began teaching my members about the proper movements and alignments of their bodies, making modifications for their specific needs and their own disabilities. People began to thank me for what I have done for them, and my response in return was always, and still is, “no, thank you!”

(Where it all began and yes I was 5 months pregnant)

I found a beautiful space that I finally took the plunge for and officially opened up Breakin Boundaries. My dream had come true.  I offered various adult and children classes and quickly became successful in doing so.This short-lived dream became a reality, from a financial perspective, when I finally realized my rent was just way too high for me to stay. In June 2013, I stopped all children’s classes and with a second baby boy on the way, I had no choice but to sell my lease. 

   

(Before)                                        (After)

I seamlessly moved my entire adult program to a Greenpoint location in January 2014, with the hopes of lowering my rent. That being said, my members continued to come to every class whether it’s to let loose, feel good, be healthier or to consult with me about a plan to better themselves.

(607 Manhattan Avenue location)

Although the space Breakin Boundaries is currently occupying is beautiful, it is not enough for us to reach our full potential.  Any money donated would be greatly appreciated and put towards our expansion. Your contributions would be a huge help.


                                           Other Ways You Can Help

                               *Share this campaign with friends and family*

         *Spread the word by posting to social media (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram)*



                  


“We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give.” 

- Winston Churchill -

professional dancer and competitive junior Olympic gymnast who suffered a
severe lower back injury, which ended my career in all forms of movement in
July of 2002 (as I was told by a dozen spinal orthopedics) During this time of
depression, and physical and mental trauma, my younger cousin was diagnosed
with Autism - something I did not understand. This child, however, would become
the light at the end of the tunnel. He helped me regain all of my strength,
courage and ambition for the passions I had in life.  As I began my
training as an ABA therapist and began to do hands on work with my cousin, I
found myself falling in love with the work of helping a child with special
needs. During this time, my work with autistic children became a big part
of my life,as I took on more cases working
independently with autistic children. (Dr Temple Grandin and I) "I had the pleasure of meeting her three times and attending her conferences"Although content in my ABA work, something was
missing; it was my passion, my drive and my vision for movement in dance and
fitness.It was during this time that I
found IM=X Pilates. It was the right form of rehabilitation I needed to regain
some form of normalcy in my body. It helped
so much in my physical and mental rehabilitation that I decided to become
certified in the discipline. This was not enough for me, so I sought out other options and came across The Laban
Institute for movement studies. “Where my life changed”

 I regained enough strength to begin moving
again, I realized that it had all started with these special children that were
meant to cross my path. They helped me regain the courage and strength I needed
to get back into movement. The more time I invested in a child with Autism, the
more I began to believe in myself. I started to expand my physical
capabilities. It was then I found Zumba, this fun exciting dance craze brought
me back to my Latin dance roots. It was a great way for me to get back into
dancing. I decided to become certified because I thought it was a great way to
connect others to dance.
In June of 2011 I decided to go for it all; it was
time to pull out everything I had stored in a box (diagrams, business plans,
the name ‘Breakin Boundaries’) since I was 14, and make it a reality.  I
rented space from a friend in Greenpoint, Brooklyn who owns OTOM GYM. 
There I taught IM=X Pilates and ZUMBA in a basement. I began teaching my
members about the proper movements and alignments of their bodies, making
modifications for their specific needs and their own disabilities. People began
to thank me for what I have done for them, and my response in return was
always, and still is, “no, thank you!”(Where it all began and yes I was 5 months pregnant)I found a beautiful space that I finally took the
plunge for and officially opened up Breakin Boundaries.
My dream had come true.  I offered various adult and children
classes and quickly became successful in doing so.This
short-lived dream became a reality, from a
financial perspective, when I finally realized my rent was just way too high
for me to stay. In June 2013, I stopped all children’s classes and with a
second baby boy on the way, I had no choice but to sell my lease.    (Before)                                        (After)
I seamlessly moved my entire adult program to a Greenpoint location in January 2014, with the hopes of lowering my rent. That being said, my members continued to come to every class whether it’s to let loose, feel good, be healthier or to consult with me about a plan to better themselves.(607 Manhattan Avenue location)Although the space Breakin Boundaries is currently occupying
is beautiful, it is not enough for us to reach our full potential.  Any
money donated would be greatly appreciated and put towards our expansion. Your
contributions would be a huge help.                                           Other Ways You Can Help                               *Share this campaign with friends and family*         *Spread the word by posting to social media (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram)*                  
“We make a living by what we get. We
make a life by what we give.” - Winston Churchill -

story:
'Flowers In The Desert', the woven art of Afghanistan.


I am Simon Knight, for over 30 years I have been buying carpets & rugs, my passion is for tribal and village weaving's.

The people of Afghanistan have a society based on the tradition of weaving carpets & rugs; due to the problems that the country has faced in the last 30 years; the traditional export market for family produced village weaving's has disappeared, giving rise to financial hardship and loss of traditional skills.

I have a well established business dealing in old and antique carpets and rugs with a global customer base; I trade from my own retail shop and also online via my website www.knightsantiques.co.uk. I would like to use this network to sell the items that I will acquire from the villages of Northern Afghanistan.

The benefits  for the villages and the weavers are two fold:

- They will receive income from selling their carpets and rugs.

- I will return to the villages a share of the profits from the sales to invest in educational schemes for children.

The more capital I can raise; the more items I can buy to sell and generate profits to be returned to the villages. Every $ will be used to generate further profits and help with financing schools in the villages.


My targets.

I would like to raise a minimum amount of $20,000 to finance the first shipment of carpets & rugs, I already have the items in Afghanistan and will ship them as soon as the funds are raised.

This is an ongoing project that will see profits re-invested in more stock with regular shipments from Afghanistan every few months. 

Every $ raised will be invested into this project.


The Impact

This is an opportunity to really help people in their everyday lives, helping them to re-establish a business that is essential  to their society. The rugs & carpets are objects of beauty; they really are 'Flowers In The Desert'.

Contributions no matter how large or small are welcome, and will really make a difference to someones life.

Please share this campaign with you friends, and feel free to purchase any of the rugs & carpets once they are online. 

I thank you for your time and support. 

Simon Knight.
