story:
Short Summary

My name is Joshua Paul Copeland. I have been in the food and beverage for over fifteen years. I've worked every position in the restaurant and bar business (yes, I've had a lot of jobs over the years) and I am currently a server/bartender. I also earned a culinary degree majoring in Culinary Management.

I've started a campaign for my new startup company called Texas Sangria Company. I have created a unique and amazing fruit blend that turns any wine into an amazing sangria. The mix is made with real ingredients including 100% fruit and fruit juices with no preservatives, additives, gluten or dairy in the mix. The flagship flavor I have created is Wild Berry Jalapeno which offers a wonderful fruit flavor, lasting sweetness and slighly spicy finish.

My goal is to introduce my mix to bars and restaurants in the Houston area. If you are familiar with Houston you know that we love to go out to eat, we love to sit outside and when it gets hot it is HOT. This makes sangria a perfect solution for the upcoming summer months and beyond. This product also benefits bars and restaurants in several ways.

1. No more throwing away wine.
Our blend makes expired wine taste like awesome sangria.

2. Saves time and money.
Traditionally sangria requires a bar to buy fruit, prep sangria, have a place to store and wait at least two days before its able to be served. Our mix cuts all the hustle and bustle of making sangria while giving bars and restaurants an easy way to increase profits.

3. Can be mixed with other spirits.
Our mix is actually a great mixer in general. Wild Berry Jalapeno Margaritas anyone? How about a Wild Berry Jalapeno Martini? The possibilities are endless with this mix.

By contributing to this campaign you will be assisting us in forever changing how people come together to enjoy a drink. You will help us launch into what I believe will be huge as we expand into different flavors and eventually getting our own wine retail license and sell our own pre-made sangria in supermarkets.
Your gift will help fund a dream that will help fund many other dreams as Texas Sangria Company takes the world by storm.

What We Need & What You Get

Permits                                                 $700

First 3 Months Rent                           $3300

Commercial Grade Equipment      $3000

Marketing and Promotion                $3000

Opening Inventory                             $5000

Grand Total                                         $15,000


Your contribution does come with some pretty awesome perks. It includes samples and full bottles of our product and awesome merchandise depending on what perk package you choose. Don't forget to include your shirt size in the Platinum and Diamond packages.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give to this cause then I ask that you would share it with your friends if you like the idea. The more people that see this video the better the chances me and my team have of reaching our goals. Who knows, maybe one of the friends you share this with may be so happy you shared that they give you a sample of our awesome product. So use the indiegogo share tools to spread the word.

Follow Texas Sangria Company on Instagram and Twitter at @TexasSangriaCo and search for our fan page on Facebook.


Perks available in Continental U.S. Only

story:
All donations including non-Indiegogo ones (see website for details)

Human'ESDES is a registered non-profit in Lyon, France. We work with Jokkolabs in Mali, a social-change hub and co-working space on the MALeBOOKS project.

Mali (West Africa) desperately needs books.

That's a fact, and that's a problem. Shipping books is not possible: too heavy, too hard to select, too difficult to distribute and maintain.

What if we could send them eReaders (Kindle-like) instead and fill those with thousands of books ? Would that help ?

→ Help us raise about $5,000 and find out after 6 months!

A Simple Goal

We believe in reading being an extremely useful development factor ; by itself.

  • We don't want to force people to read.
  • We don't want to have them read only educational content.
  • We want them to discover and (really) enjoy reading.
  • We want to them to open their minds themselves and gain have a free-hobby.

We want to provide content-full devices to various groups of people who might benefit from reading and see what happens.

  • Do they use it ?
  • If no, why ? Can the limitation be overcame ?
  • If yes, what are they reading ?
  • What reading materials are the most attracting ?

We only need hardware money. Everything else is covered!

We understand how frustrating it can feel to donate to such a project and see all the money going into misc expenditures.

This is why we already raised €6,000 which will cover all the non-hardware cost: plane tickets, shipping, customs, training, distribution, etc. Indiegogers are only left with the actual hardware, how relieving!

Indiegogo Hardware Budget
Item Unit Cost Qty Total
eReader $110 30 $3,300
32GB microSD card $21 30 $626
Solar Charger (1,200 mAh) $31 30 $917
TOTAL $153 30 4,837

What we're gonna do

  • Get eReaders, solar chargers, microSD cards (that's what you are funding!)
  • Put together a complete digital library :
    1. Public domain books (2,500+)
    2. Amateur-writer texts
    3. Texts from published writers who accept to offer their books to our beneficiaries.
    4. Free texts from the Internet (short stories mostly)
  • Add the complete Wikipedia to the device using Kiwix. this is a first !
  • Work with our field partners on the distribution and M&E strategy.
  • Ship everything to Bamako.
  • In early September:
    • hold a workshop+training in Bamako with field partners to finalize the M&E strategy.
    • Start the distribution mission in Bamako (University Students), Ségou (High School) and Timbuktu (Community).
  • After 6 months, we'll publish a detailed report on how the devices are used, what is being read, what the users think of the devices and the content.

They Support Us

Ladji Doucouré (on Wikipedia), 60m hurdles and 110m hurdles World Champion.

Mohamed Diaby, Boxing World Champion

Philippe Couve, Journalist

Boukary Konaté, Teacher and Blogger (Interviewed by Philippe Couve)


Hafizou Touré, ICT Head, Collectif Cri de Cœur


Let's Talk

This is our first Indiegogo campaign, so please help us gear towards the right direction by dropping us a comment here. We'll do our best to answer quickly.

story:
OUR STORY

Hi folks! My name is Ariel and my partner Jay and I have owned Smalltown Skate Shop (located in Dekalb, IL) for 3.5 years and still going.  When we opened the shop we have always dreamed about having a place to skate all winter long here in the Midwest, and therefore we have constantly been doing research on warehouses and real estate. We found this amazing place in Schaumburg, IL and after doing the demographic research, writing a business plan, and finding an interested investor we signed a three year lease. Well, the worst case scenario happened to us, the investor dropped out last minute, and now we're left with nothing but a dream, a half built skatepark, and determination to still make it happen. 

What we have going for us is a LLC, a building, and a combination of 15 years of experience in the skateboarding industry between the two of us.  All this is already happening, and despite the lack of funds, we have been making progress on the building through donations of materials and time from the skateboard community. At this point it's sink or swim, and even though we got to make it across Lake Michigan we have decided to swim.

WHY YOU SHOULD CARE

Skateboarding is: an art form, ninja skill, socialization, inspiring, patience, invigorating, creative, positive, involved in the youth, fights boredom, and is a great workout. 


We want to be able to share everything skateboarding is with the Chicago land area.  We have visions and goals of making a place that not only brings the skateboarding community together, but we want to also have it be a youth center, an all ages venue for music, and a place for artists to do showings, and artwork. 


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We put a campaign goal of $5,000, and this money will strictly be used for wood and building supplies.  Of course You can't build and entire 18,000 square foot skate park for $5,000, but it is a stepping stone.  We are opening this bare bones style, and hopefully people will see that it will always be a growing project that is ever changing. 


Whatever money you donate can be used as admission money into the park. If you plan on skating there anyways this is a great opportunity to make a difference with your dollars because the park will initially be better in the beginning!


HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP

We are building the entire park by ourselves, and would love any donations of lumber, paint or any other skateable materials.  Also, if anyone wants to help with painting, building, cleaning, really anything we could use the hands! Please spread the word!

story:
What is Play City?

Play City is a socially responsible Indoor Playground concept for kids of all ages. A place where kids can have fun, be active, creative, and social – all in a safe, clean and friendly environment. Play City aims to help the fight against childhood obesity and other pediatric diseases with this unique facility where kids of all ages can find fun activities they will love and want to repeat over and over again.

All profits from this facility will go to pediatric health and wellness charities.

ALL profits??  Yes, ALL profits!

 

The Background

When the current 35-45 year old parents were growing up, computers were barely becoming available (I got my first Atari when I was 16!).  The internet, iPads, iPods,  and even cell phones seemed like a science fiction movie as likely as humans living on Mars. So what were the forms of entertainment for kids back then? It was going outside, playing with friends, playing sports, and being active!

We’re not blaming childhood obesity on the internet and video games alone, but statistics show that the childhood obesity rate in the US has TRIPLED since 1963! Among children today, obesity is causing a broad range of health problems that previously weren’t seen until adulthood. These include high blood pressure, type 2 diabetes and elevated blood cholesterol levels. There are also psychological effects: Obese children are more prone to low self-esteem, negative body image and depression. And excess weight at young ages has been linked to higher and earlier death rates in adulthood.

Physical inactivity is a major risk factor for developing heart disease, stroke, high blood pressure, high cholesterol and diabetes. The American Heart Association recommends that children and adolescents participate in at least 60 minutes of moderate to vigorous physical activity every day.

Another reason why kids stay at home more is that most of us don’t feel safe letting our kids year old kids go out of the house on their own anymore. All you hear about in the news are kidnappings, shootings, sexual predators (check on the internet how many registered sex offenders live within 10 miles of you!), and just overall an unsafe place and time to grow up. For those who live in a “safe” neighborhood, you still don’t let the kids go further than 50 feet away from the house. Admit it – you’re scared something will happen to them!

What will Play City offer?

Play City will offer all types of fun, creative, and thought-provoking activities and games for kids of all ages (even the big kids among us!):

-Feature Attraction – a Laser Maze Course

It’s just like in the movies! Imagine you enter a mysterious room and as you cross the starting point, the Laser Maze pops to life and the room ahead of you is filled with brilliant green lasers radiating from the walls. Music and light effects immerse you into the experience. It’s time to put your game face on. The Laser Maze Challenge is a timed event. The lower the time, the better. The mission is to navigate the Maze without breaking a beam. If you do, that’s OK, you’re simply penalized with time being added to your score. As you expertly navigate through the web of lasers, going over and under lasers as quickly as possible on your way to the end of the Maze, be sure to select the Mission Objectives along the way. When you reach the end and navigate beyond the final laser beam, you select the Mission Complete which finishes your challenge and determines your time/score.

        


-Obstacle Courses


-Giant Slides


-Bouncers and Trampolines


-Climbing Walls


-Interactive Walls and Floors


-Ballistic Cannons

-Toddler Play

-Sports Court



-Arts & Crafts


-Theatre/Drama

-What about the adults?

The adults will have a comfortable lounge to hang out in, and still be able to keep an eye on the kids (that is if they don’t try the Laser Maze Course themselves!) while enjoying healthy drinks and snacks.

The proceeds from the campaign will be used to get this amazing facility off the ground.

Play City wants to do its part in keeping our kids active, creative, and healthy.

Check out our awesome perks and gifts for your generous donation. Thank you for taking the time to read this message and we hope you will join our efforts in making our future generations more active and healthy.

The Play City Team

Play City will offer all types of fun, creative, and thought-provoking activities and games for kids of all ages (even the big kids among us!):-Feature Attraction – a Laser Maze Course

It’s just like in the movies! Imagine you enter a mysterious room and as you cross the starting point, the Laser Maze pops to life and the room ahead of you is filled with brilliant green lasers radiating from the walls. Music and light effects immerse you into the experience. It’s time to put your game face on. The Laser Maze Challenge is a timed event. The lower the time, the better. The mission is to navigate the Maze without breaking a beam. If you do, that’s OK, you’re simply penalized with time being added to your score. As you expertly navigate through the web of lasers, going over and under lasers as quickly as possible on your way to the end of the Maze, be sure to select the Mission Objectives along the way. When you reach the end and navigate beyond the final laser beam, you select the Mission Complete which finishes your challenge and determines your time/score.
        

-Obstacle Courses



-Giant Slides



-Bouncers and Trampolines



-Climbing Walls



-Interactive Walls and Floors



-Ballistic Cannons

-Toddler Play

-Sports Court

-Arts & Crafts



-Theatre/Drama


-What about the adults?
The adults will have a comfortable lounge to hang out in, and still be able to keep an eye on the kids (that is if they don’t try the Laser Maze Course themselves!) while enjoying healthy drinks and snacks.
The proceeds from the campaign will be used to get this amazing facility off the ground.
Play City wants to do its part in keeping our kids active, creative, and healthy.
Check out our awesome perks and gifts for your generous donation. Thank you for taking the time to read this message and we hope you will join our efforts in making our future generations more active and healthy.
The Play City Team

story:
The idea of an indoor ice arena for Williamsport has been sought after for more than 30 years with many starts and stops. The latest project began in December 2010 when the Mayor of Williamsport met with a non-profit organization with more than 30 years of experience in the ice rink business. At that point it was a vague plan, something to build upon.

In the spring of 2012 the idea was presented to the public and set in motion. What was needed: lots of money and the acquisiion of the Picklener Arena that was being used for roller hockey and soccer. The Picklener Arena could be retrofitted with ice and ready for business by October 2012. Neither of the initatives gained enough support by the June 30th deadline.

The idea of putting a refrigerated ice surface at Historic Bowman Field, home to a professional baseball team, came to light and the necessary research and discussion ocurred.  An announcement was made to the public in July 2012 at Bowman Field that an open ice arena would indeed be constructed.

Construction of the rink began in ealry October and was ready for the home opener. The home opener game for the professional hockey team broke all attendance records for the league. Other programs offered included: public skating sessions, skating lessons for children and adults, youth and adult ice hockey and skating lessons for Special Needs Children! Public skating times were very popular with the school students of all ages and surrounding colleges and universities. The youth hockey program attracted fewer participants than hoped for, but the adults hockey program flourished. The skating lessons for children and adults were nicely attended, but the Special Needs program thrived.

Unfortunately, as the temperatures dropped, so did the attendance at the hockey games. Bad weather, including rain and snow closed the rink more than once, resulting in lost revenue. The rink closed one day ahead of schedule because of lost revenue and the hockey team could not play their last home game.

It was a risky experiment, leaving the City of Williamsport with unpaid utility bills by the hockey team and the non-profit organization. It is our goal to raise money to help pay these bills, with the hope that our efforts will heal the wound caused by the outoor rink project.

That is where we come in. A group of people, who did not know each other before this time, have come together to continue the crusade for an indoor ice rink for Williamsport.

story:
The Big Picture

Bust'DD (pronounced busted) is the first reasonable alternative for large-busted women to get supportive, affordable, comfortable, and stylish bras.  Unlike our competitors, we provide an accurate way to determine your bra size without long questionnaires about your breasts, fancy computer algorithms or molded plastic cups.  We’ll be offering size combinations most stores don’t carry along with convenient sales models. 

The founders are Kim Johnson and Laura Johnson.  We are both busty women so we know the issues being faced by busty ladies.  We are both fed up with the intimate apparel industry!!  We want to make bras better, prettier and sell them at a lower price by making and selling them ourselves (we're cutting out the middlemen).

At least 4 out of 5 women are wearing the wrong size bra.  And with all the different ways to measure combined with massive amounts of mis-information, we're not surprised.  There are so many women above a D cup, many of whom don't even know it.  And those who know they are a G, H or I cup are beyond frustrated with selection, availability and price.  We deserve better.  So Bust'DD is here to start the BRAvolution for millions of women.

We’re moving from the startup/prototype phase into the beta phase, so we’re glad you’re here!  Join the BRAvolution and help us bring quality bras to market.  Please donate to our campaign today!  

What We Need & What You Get

Designing, constructing and manufacturing bras is difficult business.  We're up to the challenge, but we need your help!  We are making at least 3-4 styles for our beta run.  Then we're manufacturing about 10 of each style in different sizes.  Finally, we'll field test these bras by giving these to real women and allowing them (and potentially YOU) to provide us feedback to make them the best bras possible.  Upon completion of all these steps, we will make changes as needed and roll out our first line of bras, all thanks to you!

We're asking for $25,000 to get the process started and we'll put every penny received to good use in making the beta version of our bras.  But you can help take us even further!  We've set a stretch goal of $65,000. Take a look at the chart below to see where the money goes at each target level.

Where does the money go?

 

What do you get for contributing?  

We have many awesome perks at the various contribution levels, including:

  • Exclusive first peek of products
  • Bust'DD tape measure
  • Limited edition crowdfunding T-shirt
  • Free bra*
  • Free attendance to our bra party*
  • VIP Treatment during our bra party*
  • Become a beta tester*
  • Help us design a bra*
  • Help us name a bra*

* Restrictions apply (assumes successful full launch, max value VIP treatment = $750, beta testing, designing and naming require NDA, and design/naming requires our approval)

The Impact

If you are a busty woman, we don't need to explain the impact Bust'DD will make.  Bras currently on the market are uncomfortable, expensive and ugly in the larger cup sizes.  Not to mention hard to find and impossible to understand what size you are.  Bust'DD is fixing all of that!

When busty women are forced to buy their ugly, expensive bras online, society has told them they are "odd" or not worth making quality bras for such a small segment of the market.  First, this is not a small segment of the market.  Due to the mis-information around sizing, there are actually millions of women who are DD+, but simply have no idea.  

Don't take it from us, take it from the women affected:

"I wear a size 32DDDD, which is impossible to find in any store"

"I have huge boobs and normal dept stores that have lower prices don't carry my size."

"When I'm lucky enough to find my size, the selection is really, really poor.  I'm lucky to find anything that's not very basic and white."

"Cute bras never come bigger than a C cup."

"It seems that most stores only sell cup sizes up to DD. It would be nice if larger cup sizes were more widely available. Also, I can't seem to find any cute or sexy bras in my size. I understand that bras with bigger cup sizes need to be more supportive, but it doesn't mean that they need to be ugly."

"Please don't assume the women buying a DD-cup bra are over the age of 60. Make the larger sizes in cute styles and colors. It's hard to find bras that fit under my shirts in the summer because the straps are way too wide. And please make some bras in unusual sizes - such as a 34DD - for the women who are just naturally large-chested, but aren't necessarily large all over."

 

Why Bust'DD is Different

We can tell you what size bra you should be wearing without fancy algorithms, long questionnaires about your breasts or plastic cup moldings.  We use a tape measure so there is no guess work.  Visit http://www.bustdd.com/bra-calculator today to learn how to measure and calculate your bra size.  You may be surprised what size you should be!  While you're there, read our story to find out exactly what led us to start Bust'DD (http://www.bustdd.com/our-story).

We will start by offering band sizes 28-38 and cup sizes DD-K (more sizes will be added as sales prove successful, so stay tuned if you don't fit into our market at the moment).

Our bras will be comfortable, affordable, and stylish.  Yes, you can have it all in a bra!

 

We'll design bra lines that will stay with us forever!  The fit and shape won't change, but the fabrics and colors will.  You can get the basics, but you can also stay on top of fashion trends without worrying about us discontinuing your favorite bra.

Yes, we're selling our bras online, but you can try them on.  You can host a bra party (no obligation to buy and we'll never ask you to be a sales person) or you can order a box of bras to try on in the comfort of your own home (at no cost to you).

Our bras are being designed and manufactured right here in the USA.  It's important to us that we have a close watch over our products so that we can get them done right for you.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford to donate right now?  Don't worry, you can still help!!

  •  Spread the word and make some noise about Bust'DD
    • Tell your friends and family
    • If you are not a busty girl, we know there is one in your life - tell her
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools

story:
I AM STILL ACCEPTING DONATIONS!!!!

 

EMAIL ME FOR DONATION AND TAX DEDUCTION FORM :

NAYHUGHES@UCLA.EDU 

 

 

 

Hi, I am Nadine!

It has been my LIFE LONG DREAM to go to South Africa and help with animals and the environment that they and human beings share. I finally have my chance to go through a non profit organization and contribute my part in helping this world.

I have been selected to represent the United States by volunteering in South Africa this summer with International Student Volunteers (ISV), a volunteer and travel organization. I am seeking your sponsorship, so that I can make a difference abroad this summer.

ISV is an internationally recognized and awarded organization that appoints university students from the U.S., Canada, Australia and the U.K. to various countries around the world in an effort to impact entire communities and endangered habitats in need. 

 

South Africa?


I have spent years donating my time in my local community and all over Los Angeles. Whether it be through food pantries or helping at places like "The Gentle Barn" my heart has always been towards helping and lending a hand in any possible way I can. 

Now that I am in college I have this HUGE opportunity to broaden my volunteering efforts in ways that I never thought could be possible.  

While on my environmental conservation project, I’ll receive hands-on, practical experience supporting such issues as endangered species preservation or habitat restoration, which will strengthen my understanding of the world at large and lead me on a path of ecological conservation to impact our world for years to come.

Many species of animals are running out of space and their territories are overlapping with that of people – conflict results; animals are sometimes poisoned, shot or trapped. Wildlife care and rehabilitation centers not only have a role in caring for injured wildlife but also in education programs to help people learn to live with their animal neighbors more harmoniously. During this program I plan on guiding and rehabilitating these helpless animals and educating people on such issues.

During my trip I will have time to connect with children from local orphanges and educate them on certain topics such as AIDs awareness while creating a special bond with them. ISV is working to assist local organizations with their efforts to fill the gaps left by government systems in selected communities to make these children feel like they have a chance to live a fufilling life. 

Every little step can lead towards something so beautiful and powerful to create change for the greater good! And that is what I plan to do while I am volunteering my time in South Africa.

I Leave July 19, 2013 to South Africa!!! 

What I Need & What You Get

  • My Goal is $2,000.
  • This will go towards my plane ticket, Food, water and a hostile to stay in for two weeks.
  • The money aids me in helping rehabilitate animals such as a cheetahs and work on protecting the environment!
  • All the money will go towards my trip so I can have the power to help our ecological system that will impact our world for years to come!  
  • My plane ticket alone is $3,000 and my trip will be $2,000. I am starting my goal at $2,000, but ANY AMOUNT helps.
  •  Your donation is tax deductible!!!!!!!

 

Ways Anyone Can Help

1) Get the word out about my campaign so I can help these animals and keep our eco system alive!

2) Please know that any support you can offer will go a long way toward changing the lives of others, including mine.

3) Get involved by spreading the word and informing people on what is going on.

4) To learn more you can visit www.isvolunteers.org .

THANK YOU SO MUCH! And God Bless :) .

story:
We drive the technology. You drive us. Together we will end homelessness.

Community Technology Alliance (CTA) is a nonprofit organization dedicated to providing critical technology and services to aid in preventing and ending homelessness nationwide – beginning with the world’s hub of technology: Silicon Valley.

CTA provides technology to nonprofits and other organizations to help them collect data about their services and conduct comprehensive research about homeless men and women. With this information, we can make informed decisions about a population of people who are widely misunderstood and also in great need of our assistance. In 2011 alone, over 90,000 individuals in need received lifesaving services from CTA’s partner organizations. 

We know ending homelessness sounds like a crazy goal. Well our answer is simple: We are committed to this goal because people are dying in our streets.

This is a social issue that affects us all. It's a human right to have a warm place to sleep, food to nourish our bodies and to feel cared about. Plus, all of us who are working to accomplish this goal feel terrific knowing we are changing lives dramatically, and giving hope to those who have lost hope.

We drive the technology. You drive us. Together we will end homelessness.

So how will your support help? Much of what drives us is support from our community and donors, like you. Without the support of our community, we make less of an impact and our reach is limited. But with your help, we can provide assistance to more organizations and collect reliable and comprehensive data using the latest technologies and ultimately we get closer to reaching our goal: ending homelessness. We’d like you to be a part of reaching this goal. 

Our technology is changing lives. Be a part of that change.

CTA has created several technologies that are directly helping homeless men and women everyday. Here are a few examples of the technology and research tools CTA provides:

• Community VoiceMail provides a contact number for homeless individuals to receive messages from potential employers, landlords, social workers and family.

• Homeless Management Information System (HMIS): CTA hosts the HMIS system for four Bay Area counties. HMIS is the required data collection tool for organizations receiving federal monies from the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development. It helps keep track of demographics, services and program outcomes.

• CTA proactively links human service programs across five Bay Area counties to leverage data and systems to reduce redundancies and costs.

• A CTA-created web and smartphone application has been used to survey more than 1300 individuals about their level of vulnerability to premature death due to the harsh conditions of life on the street.

• Housing One, a crowd-funding site hosted by CTA, allows individual donors to easily contribute to cover move-in costs for homeless individuals transitioning into their own apartments.

• The Shelter Bed Hotline, a life-saving automated referral service provided by CTA, connected 7200 callers to homeless shelters in 2011.

 

Support us in more than one way

The power of reaching out to our friends, family, coworkers and neighbors can never be overrated. You don’t have to ask them to donate – simply spreading the word about our work does the trick. The more people tweet, like, share, email and chat about us, the more likely we are to reach our goal.

We encourage you to spread the word far and wide about CTA’s work and how we are driving technology to take on mountainous goals like ending homelessness. With your support we will end homelessness, but as with all great accomplishments it’s a team effort.

Please Like and Tweet about our Indiegogo page. Share it on all your social media profiles and pages. Ask your friends, family, coworkers and neighbors to do the same. We’re all in this together because homelessness affects all of us.

Website: www.ctagroup.org

Facebook: www.facebook.com/ctagroup.org

Twitter: https://twitter.com/CTA_Group_

We drive the technology. You drive us. Together we will end homelessness.

The power of reaching out to our friends, family, coworkers and neighbors can never be overrated. You don’t have to ask them to donate – simply spreading the word about our work does the trick. The more people tweet, like, share, email and chat about us, the more likely we are to reach our goal.
We encourage you to spread the word far and wide about CTA’s work and how we are driving technology to take on mountainous goals like ending homelessness. With your support we will end homelessness, but as with all great accomplishments it’s a team effort.
Please Like and Tweet about our Indiegogo page. Share it on all your social media profiles and pages. Ask your friends, family, coworkers and neighbors to do the same. We’re all in this together because homelessness affects all of us.
Website: www.ctagroup.org
Facebook: www.facebook.com/ctagroup.org
Twitter: https://twitter.com/CTA_Group_
We drive the technology. You drive us. Together we will end homelessness.

story:
YCC

     My Name is Ray. I am 7 years old. I love to create. I have been tinkering with things since I was a kid. Two years ago, I started a 'Creator Club" where kids from my school and cub scout pack meet up once a month to brainstorm, share ideas, and build different kits. We also take things apart to learn how they work. Last year, we visited the MakerBot Lab in Brooklyn, and realized we NEEDED to get one for our club! 


    Our most recent project is 'M.E.", a Personal Robot Assistant. He is 5 foot tall, and will use an Arduino for a brain. We currently have the arms and treads built, and have designed his skeleton and head using Sketchup. A 3D printer would bring Mosquito Eater into reality. We would like to use one to create his torso and spine.

     We have other more advanced projects, and having a 3D Printer would bring those to life, too.  We are hoping we can get enough funding for a printer and some spools of plastic for it.  Thank you!

-Ray

What We Need

We are looking for funding for the following items:

  • 3D printer (Makerbot or some other one)
  • A few spools of the plastic material used for printing

 

How we will use the printer

  Two of our dads helped us to put this on the internet, and are watching over us, but we are the ones trying to make this happen. If this is successful, all of the Young Creators will share the printer - we will put our names in a hat,  take out each name and each member will get to have the printer at their house for two weeks. But everyone will be using it to create our robot and our other major projects.

   We are very excited that there are people out there who would help us to buy a 3D printer, thanks you so much!

-Alex

Other Stuff

 

  • Please tell others about our club ( yccny.org) We'd like to help other kids form their own 'Young Creator's Club', and share projects, blueprints, ideas, and creations with kids from all over the planet!
  •   (Note from Ray's dad: The Website will go 'live' In Early february - we are just waiting to get permission from everyone's parents to post their children's photos and projects. )
  •   (Note from Alex's dad: It's AMAZING watching these kids at their meetings, their creative spirit is overflowing inspiring - their brains are like sponges and their creativity is unlimited.  We are very proud at how much initiative they have shown towards this campaign. We are allowing them the freedom to research and experiment with creating a successful campaign without us getting too involved in the process.  They are currently working on additional videos and images, and are trying to make the website work. The end result may be 'rough', but it will be authentic. In the end, we would love it if they were able to reach their goal. If you could help fund their project, we would REALLY appreciate it. If you contribute, they will add your name to their "supporters" page on their website, and those who pledge above $20 will receive a heatfelt  'thank you" in the form of a 3D printed object.  If they don't reach their goal here, we will make up the difference, so that they will have their printer. Thanks for taking the time to read this, and please spread the word about YCC.  THANKS!)

  

YCC's motto - "Power to the Creators!"

story:
Our indiegogo campaign has ended, and the funding we raised will allow us to demonstrate the feasibility of producing Real Vegan Cheese from baker's yeast. But it will be a long road from there to putting Real Vegan Cheese on the shelves. 

Visit our website to support this project


All stretch goals achieved!



Featured in:



We are a team of experienced biohackers from the Bay Area biohacker spaces Counter Culture Labs in Oakland, CA and BioCurious in Sunnyvale, CA. Together, we are engineering regular baker's yeast to produce the world's first real vegan cheese protein and from there, the worlds first Real Vegan Cheese!

What is Real Vegan Cheese?

Real Vegan Cheese is a not a cheese substitute! It all begins with regular old baker's yeast. Through synthetic biology, we engineer our yeast to become milk-protein factories, churning out real milk proteins (known as caseins). These milk proteins are then combined with water, vegan sugar and oil to make a kind of milk which is ultimately converted into Real Vegan Cheese using the age-old cheese-making process.

How can yeast produce milk protein?

To create our proteins, we study animal genomes to find natural milk-protein genetic sequences. We optimize the genes for use in yeast and synthesize the resulting yeast milk protein DNA from scratch. This DNA is then put into yeast cells where the cellular machinery takes over and produces real milk-protein from the DNA blueprint provided by us. No animal products involved. Plus the purified proteins will be identical to those found in regular cheese, and will not contain any GMO!

Want to hear more hard-core science?

Drink straight from the fire hose over at our Wiki! Learn all about casein micelles, the different casein proteins and their genetic variants, why casein kinase is not the kinase that acts on casein, our plans for vegan lactose substitutes, and more. And feel free to ask us questions in the Comments section...

Why Real Vegan Cheese?

  • We believe that using animals as large-scale food production machines is ethically and environmentally irresponsible.

  • We believe that our process is more ethically responsible and environmentally sustainable than the status quo.

  • We believe that all humans, vegans included, should have access to delicious and healthy cheese!

What We Need & What You Get

The work we do can be expensive, but the rewards will be great! If funding for this project is successful, we will be able to create variants of baker's yeast that produce the four milk-proteins needed for cheese, then purify the proteins and make the worlds first Real Vegan Cheese! All of our research will be made available on our wiki as it happens and will be licensed under free and open licenses. All patentable technology will be released into the public domain. The team consists of 100% unpaid volunteers so all of the funding from this campaign will go toward the cost of materials, equipment and physical space.

3D printed Jewelry Perks

Here are some previews of the 3D printed jewelry we are working on. Feedback welcome!

Cheesy Flask Earrings with our cheese-in-a-flask logo, and the original Curd Nerd Jewelry: a 3D printed model of the protein structure of chymosin, the enzyme in rennet that causes milk to coagulate into cheese curds. Both a little over 1" in size (3cm), and available at the $50 level.

We've also tried some 3D prints in solid metal of the chymosin enzyme. We really love the gold plated version on the left, but at the slightly larger size (~3/4 inch) that you see for the nickel plated one on the right. Metal prints are a bit more expensive, so we're offering this one at $70. Looks and feels a bit like a gold nugget.

Finally, if you're a huge fan of wearing your science next to your heart - here's a 3-tier pendant showing (1) the Fam20C kinase that is responsible for phosphorylating ceasein proteins so they form micelles, (2) the chymosin enzyme that cleaves one of the caseisn to coagulate milk, and (3) the Kappa casein that is cleaved by chymosin and is the lynchpin in cheese making. Note that these proteins structures of the human Fam20C and Kappa casein were worked out by our own team!

T-shirt Designs

Here is a preview of our T-shirt designs. Note that we've added a new Exclusive perk for our Narwhal stretch goal! Only available until we hit our $20K goal, so get them while they're hot!

We're looking to add a cool slogan to these T-shirts, and we'd love your input - so post your ideas in the Comments section.

Our Team

The Real Vegan Cheese project is open to collaborators of all skill levels and from all walks of life. In October we will be entering our Real Vegan Cheese project into the International Genetically Engineered Machine (iGEM) synthetic biology competition. We are excited to be part of a larger global community consisting of students and biohackers from over 30 countries!

Impacts

We live in an unsustainable world. The cheese we eat today is produced by commercial dairy cows which, though they produce delicious milk and cheese, have an exceptionally large carbon footprint.  Even the U,N. Food and Agriculture Organization reports that the world's 1.5 billion cows emit dozens of polluting gases, including large amounts of methane. This methane gas is a leading contributor to global warming!

By creating an alternative pathway to cheese, we help the environment, increase access to tasty and healthy food, and support people who have already committed themselves to a smaller personal carbon footprint.

Our team of scientists have an amazing reputation for being passionate contributors to technological and scientific innovation as well as social and environmental justice. We are excited to take this passion into the world and prove that we together through open science can make huge strides in technology while being socially and environmentally responsible. Together we can change the way the world values, creates and consumes cheese.

Health effects

Not only can we make Real Vegan Cheese that is better for the environment, we can also design it to be better for you:

  • For each of the four main proteins found in cheese, there are dozens of known genetic variants found in humans and in different breeds of cows. Some of these versions of the proteins are associated with various health benefits, or increased risks of allergic response. We have the opportunity to pick and choose the most desirable variants of these naturally occurring proteins, increasing health benefits and removing allergens.

  • There are clear health benefits to consuming milk proteins derived from humans versus cow milk proteins. This is made possible by expressing the genes that code for human milk proteins in yeast. Using human genes to make vegan milk may not be appetizing to everyone, so for you folks that love good old-fashioned cow cheeses, we’re also making a vegan cow cheese.

Risks & Challenges

The path to Real Vegan Cheese is not an easy one. The science and cheese-making processes pose certain challenges that must be addressed.

As a health conscious and ecologically responsible collective, we have our own concerns about our process. We do not want to produce food in a way that replicates the shortcomings of some existing Genetic Engineering companies. One of our major challenges will be to evaluate whether the technology we work with is safe. We will need to continually re-evaluate risks and design safe-guards that prevent or limit potential dangers to individuals, humanity or the planet as a whole.

Our Molecular Biology team is focused on creating low-cost solutions to producing cheese protein. Utilizing yeast as protein factories can be challenging. The proteins we want them to produce are complex and designed by nature for animal systems. Yeast have the same internal machinery as cows or goats (or humans) but the cellular machinery is primitive in comparison. To create functional milk-proteins we will have to help yeast perform protein modifications similar to those that occur naturally in animals. In our process we plan to incorporate helpful enzymes that make yeast-derived milk proteins perform like animal milk-proteins. The addition of these animal-inspired enzymes will help our Cheese-Making team produce Real Vegan Cheese!

Stretch Goal #1: Narwhal Cheese at $20K! Achieved!

Ah, Narwal! The horniest of cetaceans. Unicorn of the sea. Carismaticissimo of the charismatic megafauna! Who wouldn't want some narwhal cheese?! If we can make cheese from cow proteins and human proteins - give us a genome sequence and we can make cheese from any mammal. How does narwhal cheese taste? Who knows... But we figured - hey, why not?

Whale milk is actually very interesting - it is extremely high in protein and has an almost toothpaste-like consistency, evolved to be easily passed to the whale calf in an aquatic environment. Studying the narwhal casein genes will also give us a great opportunity to delve into some of the unique properties of whale milk, and the evolutionary adaptations distinguishing land vs marine mammals, and cold-adapted vs warm water whales. The resulting constructs may also be of use for whale research, because they would allow study of in vitro produced whale milk proteins year round.

The narwhal genome has not been sequenced yet, but researchers at the university of California at Santa Cruz are currently out on an expedition to the arctic to study these magnificent marine mammals, and will be working on sequencing the narwhal genome - a key resource for any future conservation efforts of this threatened species. We hope to work with them on the sequencing and analysis of the casein genes.

And if we can do narwhal... can unicorn cheese be far off?

Stretch Goal #2: Large Yeast Bioreactor at $30K - Achieved!

Up until this point, we're essentially doing lab-scale science to figure out how to produce casein proteins from baker's yeast. Think milligram to gram quantities - a couple crumbs of cheese! Scaling up from this proof-of-principle will take a different set of techniques and tools.

A bioreactor is essentially just a temperature controlled vat with a bunch of sensors and other gadgets. Sounds mundane, but it's an essential piece of equipment to grow up big batches of cheesy yeast under carefully controlled conditions. Brand new, large bioreactors can cost tens of thousands of dollars, but we've been keeping an eye out for a decent second-hand model in the 50 liter range that we can refurbish. And as biohackers, we're more than capable to get our hands dirty and build one from scratch too, if needed!


Stretch Goal #3: Professional recording setup - $35K! - Achieved!

We want to document the work we're doing in the lab so everyone can follow along! So far we've been borrowing equipment from our friends when possible, but if we had a high quality cameras and microphones permanently installed in our lab we'd be able to record our experiments and create free and open instructional videos on both lab techniques related to genetic engineering, running bioreactors and cheese science! We also sometimes bring in outside instructors to teach us skills that we're lacking, and this would allow us to share their knowledge with the world. We promise that all of our videos will be released under a free culture Creative Commons license.


Quotes:

"Though it may sound like a cooking project, this vegan product is unlike any cheese that has ever been produced before"

"Modifying standard baker's yeast to express milk protein [...] shouldn't be too tough a task."

"Could cause quite a revolution in cheese for both vegans and regular cheese fans who are concerned about the impact of all those dairy cows on the environment."

Real vegan narwhal cheese? Well, I’m sure synthetic biology can get  weirder — but this is a great start. I’m looking forward to tasting  some."

Frequently Asked Questions

Is it really vegan?

Yes. Our genes are made from scratch to work in yeast, and though they are inspired by mammals, none of the genes, organisms or growth mediums we use have ever been part of an animal. 

Will the cheese contain GMOs?

In short: No. While we genetically modify yeast, the yeast itself is not eaten, and the resulting milk-protein is separated from the GMOs before being turned into cheese. This method has been used for many years to produce safe medicines and foods such as insulin and vanilla flavoring. In fact, the rennet used in most cheese today is produced using this same method. This has meant that the old and ethically questionable method of extracting rennet from the stomachs of calves has fallen out of favor.

Will you be eating this cheese?

Eventually, yes - that is the goal. But it may be a while before we reach that point. We will need to do some more research on exactly how to follow all FDA regulations regarding foods generated using genetically engineered organisms. If we can achieve a sufficiently purified product, show that it does not contain any foreign DNA or living organisms, and produce everything in suitable facilities, then we believe that we will be able to safely and legally produce cheese for consumption. Until we meet all those requirements, all cheese protein we produce will be clearly labeled as “Not for Human Consumption”.

When can we buy your cheese?

Hold your horses! We are still in the Research & Development stage right now - that is what our Indiegogo campaign (and our participation in the iGEM competition) is all about. Once we have proven that we can actually do this, we’ll still need to figure out how to scale up from milligrams to kilograms, and how to produce our cheese in the most food-safe and economical way.

But aren’t you sending out a Real Vegan Cheese as one of your IndieGogo perks?

We hope to brew a big batch of yeast at the end of the project, and have enough cheese protein for one small cheese. Any donor at the “Big Cheese” level will have the option of receiving a cheese made from that batch (likely labeled as “Not for Human Consumption”), assuming we can make enough protein. Or they can choose to receive a cheese-shaped prop made using their own personalized cheese press, and a rain check for our first fully FDA compliant cheese.

What if I'm lactose intolerant, or allergic to milk proteins?

Since we will be producing pure cheese protein, there will be NO lactose in Real Vegan Cheese whatsoever. We will likely be adding some other type of sugar (not lactose), both for flavor, and to feed the bacterial cultures that are used in cheese ripening. Cows milk protein allergy is an entirely different issue from lactose intolerance. Since we have the luxury of engineering everything from scratch, we can choose the least allergenic naturally occurring casein variants from cows or other dairy animals. Even better - we can swap out one or more of the cow proteins for the human version, which should be the least allergenic of all!

Can you mail to my country?

Due to local regulations regarding shipping of DNA, we may not be able to send the Biohacker Special kit to all countries. Please check your local laws!

Is it really vegan?
Yes. Our genes are made from scratch to work in yeast, and though they are inspired by mammals, none of the genes, organisms or growth mediums we use have ever been part of an animal. 
Will the cheese contain GMOs?
In short: No. While we genetically modify yeast, the yeast itself is not eaten, and the resulting milk-protein is separated from the GMOs before being turned into cheese. This method has been used for many years to produce safe medicines and foods such as insulin and vanilla flavoring. In fact, the rennet used in most cheese today is produced using this same method. This has meant that the old and ethically questionable method of extracting rennet from the stomachs of calves has fallen out of favor.
Will you be eating this cheese?
Eventually, yes - that is the goal. But it may be a while before we reach that point. We will need to do some more research on exactly how to follow all FDA regulations regarding foods generated using genetically engineered organisms. If we can achieve a sufficiently purified product, show that it does not contain any foreign DNA or living organisms, and produce everything in suitable facilities, then we believe that we will be able to safely and legally produce cheese for consumption. Until we meet all those requirements, all cheese protein we produce will be clearly labeled as “Not for Human Consumption”.
When can we buy your cheese?
Hold your horses! We are still in the Research & Development stage right now - that is what our Indiegogo campaign (and our participation in the iGEM competition) is all about. Once we have proven that we can actually do this, we’ll still need to figure out how to scale up from milligrams to kilograms, and how to produce our cheese in the most food-safe and economical way. 
But aren’t you sending out a Real Vegan Cheese as one of your IndieGogo perks?
We hope to brew a big batch of yeast at the end of the project, and have enough cheese protein for one small cheese. Any donor at the “Big Cheese” level will have the option of receiving a cheese made from that batch (likely labeled as “Not for Human Consumption”), assuming we can make enough protein. Or they can choose to receive a cheese-shaped prop made using their own personalized cheese press, and a rain check for our first fully FDA compliant cheese.
What if I'm lactose intolerant, or allergic to milk proteins?Since we will be producing pure cheese protein, there will be NO lactose in Real Vegan Cheese whatsoever. We will likely be adding some other type of sugar (not lactose), both for flavor, and to feed the bacterial cultures that are used in cheese ripening. Cows milk protein allergy is an entirely different issue from lactose intolerance. Since we have the luxury of engineering everything from scratch, we can choose the least allergenic naturally occurring casein variants from cows or other dairy animals. Even better - we can swap out one or more of the cow proteins for the human version, which should be the least allergenic of all!
Can you mail to my country?
Due to local regulations regarding shipping of DNA, we may not be able to send the Biohacker Special kit to all countries. Please check your local laws!

story:
Sababa is known to have the best Falafel in Gainesville. Some even say it's like being in Israel. Everything we make, from our Falafels to our Hummus, is prepared daily to ensure that we serve the freshest, tastiest food possible. 

Our restaurant is the result of my mother, Liora's, love for cooking, and her love for people. 

Originally located in a small building on SW 8th St., my mother and I began running the first Sababa in 2008. After closing in 2009, Riley Sullivan and I decided to reopen the restaurant in the Hillel Center in 2012. 

Now, with your help, we're ready to take the next step. 

We want to continue to share my mother's dream and keep our old family recipes alive in the Gainesville community. 

So for those who have savored our delicious Falafel sandwiches at the farmer's market or have come into the Hillel to taste our Shawarma, we decided to take this step for you.


What We Need & What You Get

The new location will be at the Sun Center, 101 SE 2nd Place, next to the Hippodrome Theater. All the money raised will go to renovation costs, kitchen equipment, first month's rent and everything needed to kick-start the new restaurant. All donations will contribute to our goal to create a space with a laid back Mediterranean atmosphere for you to relax and watch the Gator games while enjoying an Israeli beer and a homemade meal. 


For those who help us in our journey to bring Sababa to the heart of downtown Gainesville, we have a couple of perks for you. There will t-shirts, Falafels, parties and full-course meals to claim. Just look to the right and we have it all listed. 
In the long run, everyone and anyone will have the opportunity to enjoy our mouthwatering Mediterranean food. We have a variety of dishes that cater to vegan, vegetarian and gluten-free diets. For those carnivores out there, don't worry, we have chicken schnitzel and Shawarma too. 

The Impact

This town is a special place because the people and local businesses you can find here are all incredible and unique, and we want to be a part of the atmosphere that makes Gainesville so great. 

Riley grew up going to the Hippodrome and the Sun Center, and we're excited to work towards making Sababa a piece of the community and culture that is the heart of Gainesville. 


Risks & Challenges

Of course, opening your own restaurant always has its risks. This is a big investment, and Riley and I believe that we have the chance to create something that can last and thrive in downtown Gainesville. With your help we can take a step towards something we believe in and a step towards our future. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't spare a dollar, that's okay! You can help us simply by spreading the word to friends and family. Talk about us via Facebook, Twitter, blogs and any other social media platform you find yourself on. Making our campaign and restaurant known is a contribution in itself, and it can help us raise the money we need. Every little bit counts!

story:
Attention Rock Hounds, Gem and Mineral Collectors, and anyone who wants a new and unique vacation or activity

We are 0pening our mining claim for Exclusive Blast Tours
We will be providing a gem and mineral collection adventure like no other.
Check out our offers and contribute now to get in on the ground level of our fee mining experience.

If we reach our funding goal, we'll blow up one of the founder’s old car, and those who contribute will get the exclusive link to see the video!

Topaz Mountain Adventures has a mining lease on Topaz Dome at Topaz Mountain in the Thomas Range, Juab County, Utah, USA. Topaz Mountain Adventures is the only entity permitted and licensed to use power equipment and explosives within the Topaz Amphitheatre Public Rock Hounding area. Topaz Dome has historically produced some of the largest, exquisitely colored, museum quality topaz crystals found in the Thomas Range.

We need your help to expand our operation and to have the equipment necessary to provide a safe and exciting experience for tour participants who are collecting fantastic Utah topaz gemstones.

Like us on Facebook and visit our web page. https://www.facebook.com/utahtopaz

www.topazmountainadventures.com

This is a view of the quarry where tour participants will watch a blast and collect topaz.

Check out some of the fantastic gemstones that have been mined from our quarry! You’ll never find gemstones like these on your own unless you blast deep into the rock.

Only Topaz Mountain Adventures is licensed to blast and use power tools in this area.

story:
Help a Gold Star Teen

     My name is Olivia Schretzman and I am a cadet at the United States Military Academy at West Point. I am a Captain on the Women's Basketball team, a member of Team RWB and a Leader Development Science major. I have learned a lot about life from my experiences being an Army Brat. My father is currently an Active Duty Infantry Lieutenant Colonel stationed at West Point. We have moved 12 times and he has deployed 4 times. My family has been very fortunate to see the safe arrival home of my father and uncle from deployments, however, many of my fellow Army, Air Force and Navy brats have not. I have many friends who have lost a parent or had a parent injured in the war. This campaign is for them.

      A Gold Star Kid or Teen is a child who loses a parent in a war. These kids spend most of their early lives without their parent and it can be very difficult. When a soldier dies, his/her family is left without a primary care giver and it can be financially hard for the family. This fundraiser will help these teens have an all expenses paid leadership camp during the summer.

     I will be a mentor this summer for the Outdoor Gold Star Teen Adventure camp. This campaign is important to me because these kids deserve to have an opportunity to challenge themselves with world class leadership.  

 

The camp includes: 

-Survival training with United States Army Special Forces instructors

-Survival camping in the Appalachian Mountains of western North Carolina

-Granite face rock climbing

-White water rafting

-Shelter building

-Reptile and plant identification

-Land Navigation


The camp will also focus on developing leadership skills and opportunities for
personal growth for 15 teens who have lost a parent in the war.

Here is the link to the official website below! Check it out!

http://www.gstadventures.net/adventure-outdoors-2/

Please help...your contribution will help one teen have a chance to meet other Gold Star Teens, have a life long mentor, and learn lessons they might never get to experience any where else...

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $3k dollars to help fund one full camp for one Gold Star Teen.
  • If you donate $20 you will receive a picture collage of the adventure you helped to fund and a signed personal thank you note.
  • If we do not reach the $3k goal, the money will go to the Gold Star Teen Adventures  to help pay for part of the camp.

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help!

Please get the word out and tell your friends about this campaign. 

 

 Thank you so much! These kids really appreciate your help

story:
LIEBE/R VEGANE/R ZITRONENTÖRTCHENLIEBHABER/IN

Bring uns nach Mexiko!

Jetzt mal ehrlich, was ein Kartoffelsalat kann, können echte KaosPiloten erst recht. Kaos was? Wir studieren an einer kreativen internationalen Wirtschaftsschule namens KaosPilot und wollen ganz idealistisch die Welt verbessern. Damit es so weit kommt, brauchen wir Deine finanzielle Unterstützung für unsere Studienfahrt nach Mexico - Flug, Kost & Logie für 20 Leute. 

Um das ganze etwas spaßiger zu gestalten haben Gin und ich gewettet: mit welcher Werbemaßnahme bekommen wir wohl mehr Spenden zusammen, mit Speck oder veganen Zitronentörtchen? Du entscheidest!

Warum Du uns unterstützen solltest

Wir sind ein Haufen junger Kreativlinge, die nicht nur Wirtschaftstheorie pauken, sondern von verschiedensten Quellen lernen, unter anderem altes indianisches Wissen im Rahmen des so genannten Council Guide Trainings. Wir wollen

  • unser Council Guide Training erfolgreich abschließen, um zertifiziert zu werden
  • in Tulum mehr darüber erfahren, wie sich alte Kulturen basisdemokratisch organisiert haben
  • dieses Wissen in den aktuellen Wirtschaftskontext übersetzen und leicht zugänglich machen
Was Du uns gibst & was Du bekommst 

Wir brauchen Geld, um Unterkunft und Flüge nach Mexiko für 20 Leute zu finanzieren. Da wir Schnapszahlen lieben, dachten wir 7777 Euro wäre ein super Anfang, es darf gern mehr zusammen kommen. Je mehr Spenden wir sammeln, desto mehr Studis können mitkommen. Erklärtes Ziel ist natürlich als gesamtes Team mit eurer Hilfe nach Tulum zu bekommen.

Was springt für Dich dabei raus?

  • Du erhältst altes indianisches Wissen am Leben, das an uns und durch uns weitergegeben wird
  • Wir denken uns coole Give-Aways als Dankeschön für Dich aus... bald!
  • Wenn das Funding-Ziel nicht erreicht wird, werden wir so lange weiter Kuchenverkäufe, Flohmärkte, Parties und Kunstauktionen organisieren, bis wir alle zwanzig Leute nach Mexiko bekommen. Bitte erspart uns, dass wir uns die Hände wund backen!!!

Die Folgen

Zwanzig glückliche und braungebrannte zertifizierte Council Guides.

  • Als zertifizierte Council Guides können wir das alte indianische Wissen, das wir in den letzten zwei Jahren erworben haben, in die Welt tragen und unterrichten  wie man die eigenen Stärken fördert und lebt, den Schwächen den Nährboden entzieht und in Gruppen basisdemokratische Entscheidungen fällt, mit denen jede/r Einzelne zufrieden ist.
  • Damit leisten wir indirekt einen Beitrag zum Weltfrieden.
  • Wir haben als KaosPiloten erfolgreich Projekte auf der ganzen Welt unterstützt, geleitet und zum Erfolg gebracht - sowohl auf inhaltlicher wie finanzieller Ebene. Jetzt brauchen unsere eigenen Träume Wind unter den Flügeln, bitte unterstütze uns und puste kräftig via IndieGogo ;)

WIR SIND GESPANNT FÜR WEN IHR SPENDET... SPECK ODER ZITRONENTÖRTCHEN?

VIELEN DANK!

story:
How it started

As with so many charitable causes and nonprofit endeavors, there is a spark that ignites a bigger flame. This story starts with an experience so moving to me, so utterly life altering, that it caused a profound shift in the way I will forever move about in this world. This story's beginnings are all about the experience of one incredibly amazing woman, my wife Denice.

It started only a few years back, with what was supposed to be a simple checkup to determine why her energy levels had slipped and how she had acquired some annoying and excessive bruising. Blood tests would reveal very poor counts and many questions without answers. From steroids to chemo blends, nothing seemed to stop the landslide and her counts continued to fall, deep and fast.

As you might imagine, concern, anger and bewilderment took hold of us and with it, fear. It was at this point, we moved the current medical treatment fiasco aside and sought out the very best there was in the world. Fortunately, the best are at SCCA (Seattle Cancer Care Alliance) in downtown Seattle.

That meeting ended with my Denice being sent home on what can only be described as house arrest – job, family, friends, even going outside, on hold. You see her blood counts had dropped so low and her immune system was so non-existent, that even a simple fall or cold could have life threatening consequences. No longer a mystery or a misdiagnosis, we discovered she had Aplastic Anemia - a rare but nasty blood disease. The first sentence of its medical explanation includes the words, ‘usually fatal’. 

Life went from color to black and white in an instant. Two treatments – ATG therapy or, a complete bone marrow transplant (without a perfect sibling match, likely fatal results at her age). Treatment would require weeks in the hospital, massive chemo and literally, a rebirth of sorts. Fear returned, deep and painfully omnipresent no matter where we turned for relief. To witness her life trying to steal away, presented a level of pain and fear so unimaginable and unbearable, that part of it will remain within me forever. My wife is more than just the love of my life, she is the very air that I breathe.

And then some crazy good news finally swung our way! Against ridiculous odds, her sister was a ‘perfect’ donor match! Off to the UW Medical Center’s Transplant unit Denice went and after a month in the hospital, complete with the loss of her hair from the massive chemo and the discomfort from all he drugs, her recovery was going, perfect – best they could have ever hoped for! The nursing staff called her their “Transplant Rock Star”! She had beaten all the odds. This was her journey, I was the spectator, and able to offer little else than holding her in my arms and loving her with everything I had. That was a couple years ago on January 18th, 2012, her new birthday, and where that shift I mentioned early happened.  

After it was confirmed that Denice was out of the woods and safely into her recovery, I returned to work, different. I looked at the professional and personal sphere I had in my world and saw an opportunity to do more by bringing those worlds together with a commonality of purpose for something bigger than ourselves.

Yep, I made promises in the darkest of hours - she stays and I do a better job of helping celebrate the gift of her life. So became a sense of urgency to ensure that a footprint of having done something good, something important for others, was behind each step we take. I honor my wife and my word by keeping that promise through this event. 

There is something different about participating in an experience like this. Perhaps it's a sense of solidarity, of belonging or of community. Or perhaps it's simply feeling a greater sense of confidence, that together, we could actually make a difference. Whatever it is to you, I hope you let it carry you towards action.

Thank you for your interest to read this far and for considering any measure of support for our efforts. Helping others just might be the best ride you ever take. Ride safe and ride free!

Cheers! 

PT

 you for your interest to read this far and for considering any measure 
of support for our efforts. Helping others just might be the best 
ride you ever take. Ride safe and ride free!
Cheers! 
PT

story:
Meet us at the Monk!

The Monkey’s Uncle is a locally owned, family-friendly restaurant in the planning stages in Griffin, GA.  At the Monkey’s Uncle we will offer delicious and carefully prepared American fare, remarkable customer service, a large variety of bottled and draught beer, and a welcoming atmosphere to create a dining experience worth raving about.  Guests will design sandwiches, tacos, and burgers, choosing from our unique and sometimes surprising list of accoutrements.  The possibilities are endless! 

We're committed to providing a comfortable and friendly dining room for families with children.  We will strategically create space within the dining area that provides while-you-wait entertainment for kids of all ages beyond the expected coloring page menu. In addition to kid-sized portions of many of our regular menu offerings, our kids menu will include healthy, real food options instead of the ‘prepackaged mac’n’cheese, frozen chicken fingers, and corn dogs’ menus offered in other places. Our kids menu will offer families of young children the kind of food they might prepare and serve at home.


Who's Lee?

Since my teens I've read Tolkien’s The Lord of the Rings and imagined the hometown scene in The Prancing Pony of Bree, where the friendly innkeeper and restaurateur welcomes all into his house for room and board, waits on them hand and foot, and enjoys their company day in and day out. That book became a dear friend to me, and the common room of the Prancing Pony became a permanent, detailed, and lively scene in my mind.  I've long known I’d make a good master of the house and dreamt of welcoming that company into my place each day, serving wonderful food and encouraging a good time with friends and family.

Since then I've learned much about restaurants in the fast food and fast casual segments, spending a little time with McDonald’s and a long time with Chick-fil-A, including in the original and flagship location in Hapeville, GA.  I've learned that timing is everything, hospitality means the world, and that special things happen around a comfortable table.


Location, Location, Location! Local community involvement!

I've also learned that a local business doesn't last without the support of its community, and that giving back to that community shouldn't just be an option—it’s a responsibility.  The Monkey’s Uncle’s will be known for community involvement. We will work with local teams and clubs, support the arts in Griffin, and give time and resources to local non-profits like the Hope Health Clinic, Spalding Samaritans, and Five Loaves and Two Fish Food Pantry. Service that extends from the restaurant beyond its doors is a real passion for us.

We also intend to develop relationships with local farmers and vendors and incorporate as much Georgia-grown food in our kitchen as possible. We are currently researching grass-fed beef options as well as Georgia produce options. If you have a resource you believe we should investigate, please get in touch with us. We want to find the best balance in profitability while offering Griffin a restaurant you can be proud to support.

The tough part of the story: getting started is expensive!  Restaurant loans are not for just "seeing how it goes.”  We've been working on raising funds and have gotten very close to our goals, but we need you to help us take it over the top!  Every single dollar given is a dollar we’ll be forever grateful for.  Your gifts validate our dreams and empower us to be great!


Funds you contribute through our start-up campaign will be used toward the following goals:

·  Buy shiny equipment for our kitchen, including a refrigerated food prep table for all our fresh sandwich and salad ingredients, and a high capacity commercial smoker for all that smoky meaty goodness we’ll be serving.

·  Install a modern point of sale system, which will help us be profitable and enable us to take advantage of gift cards and digital coupons.

·  Add a little charm and comfort to our dining room—including some family-friendly space and a display area for locally created art.

·  Complete some kitchen and dining area renovations, which will help us serve you more efficiently and improve acoustics in the restaurant space.

·  Install AV equipment and prepare the place to better accommodate live musicians.

·  Outfit our porch with tables and chairs to give you the best outdoor dining in Griffin.

·  Install and update equipment behind the bar, which will allow us to boast Griffin’s greatest beer selection.

The bottom line about funding is that a new business always needs more!  If you run into this page and see we've reached our goal or that we're close, please don't hesitate to give anyway.  Reducing or eliminating our debt would be a dream come true. Placing all the equipment we need would be amazing! Our costs are lofty and will probably outpace what this fundraising campaign will bring, but every penny gets us a step closer to a profitable and successful business—and a business we can be proud to claim as our own.

It’s my dream to provide a comfortable place for you to enjoy an affordable meal with your friends and family.  I know that our fresh ingredients, customized meals, and comfy dining room are going to feel Right for you—but our service to you and our attention to your wants and needs will make you want to come back again and again.  At The Monkey’s Uncle, we’re all about fun with friends and family—and we want our friends and family to include YOU.

The perks listed to the right are our way of thanking you for your gifts.  They are designed to be enjoyed by you and your family, and there is some fine print about how gift cards and discount cards can be used.  If you have questions, please contact us via email (owner at monkeysunclegrill.com) or our Facebook page, and we'll be glad to let you know the specifics.

We've activated the Paypal option for donations so that no one is left out, but it costs us more to use this method.  If it makes no difference to you, please use a credit/debit card and send more of your donation to the Monkey's Uncle.

story:
Top 10 Reasons you should help Reunite the Saffolds!

10. Why wouldn't you want to reunite a good father with his wife & daughters

9. You're helping the economy

8. You're making dreams come true... living in San Diego, creating jobs, and raising great children!

7. Stop this grown man from crying on YouTube!  Geez!

6. See more videos of these hillarious kids

5. Help some girls see the ocean for the first time ever.

4. Because it's good karma

3. Because we've been paying it forward for a long, long time

2. So we can do day care for you if you live in San Diego and need nights or weekends.

1. Come'on man!  Do you really need more reasons?  A family should be together!

Short Summary

My husband's name is Jason Saffold. He's been in Staffing for 10 years working in the corporate world. What made him successful is how much he cared for his employees... treating every person who walked through the door with respect and support.  How is that different?  Because he started as 'just a temp' himself and knew first hand how poorly some people treat 'temps'.  He vowed to be different, to help everyone even if he couldn't give them a job, he tried to help in some small way.  That attitude has paid off to the point that he... we as a family are now able to start our own staffing company and know we never need to treat our employees as just a dollar sign or a temp or anything but human beings.  We vow to take care of all of our employees!

I am Sue Ann and I run the best day care in Mason City Iowa... don't take my word for it, but ask all of my families who are so sad to see me go to San Diego.  But, I grew up there, my family is there, my happiness in the world is there.  My husband is now there running this business... but I am stuck in Iowa and desperately want to reunite with him.  My four daughters and I cry every night because he is such a great father, such an incredible person and is out there doing this all by himself trying to build a business, put people to work, put the money away to afford to move us there.  I plan on providing second and third shift and weekend day care in San Diego too... something so few provide.  As a daycare provider I can not really contribute much to our move, but at least I am keeping a roof over our heads.  My husband keeps telling me I must have an "S" tattooed on my chest for caring for our four daughters and up to 12 more children in my day care.  Yes, 16 kids a day is insanity!

By contributing to our campaign, you will reunite our family, our four daughters 3, 4, 9 and 10 with their dad, my husband Jason.  You will help us keep this business growing and creating job opportunities for people who often don't get a chance... a hand in the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $7,500

$2,000 first month's rent on a house in San Diego where I can run day care

$2,000 for deposit on the house

$2,400 for renting a U-Haul truck to move from Mason City Iowa to San Diego

$600 in gas to drive the truck across country

$500 plane ticket to fly Jason back to Iowa to move us to San Diego

$1000 for hotels and food cross country

In return for your contribution we will provide you with Jason's resume or interview consultation.  His consultation has resulted in thousands of people getting hired... so this is a very good value!

If we don't get the money in time... we are going to keep trying, so the money will still be used toward the move... it's just that the school year starts September 5 in San Diego and we want to move the family before then... and before it snows in Iowa in October!  Please help us reunite sooner than later!

If you're in San Diego, we can also offer to wave your application fee if you want to join my day care.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

This project is valuable to you and to the world because we will provide you the best resume or interview coaching you've ever received, we are creating jobs opportunities for people in San Diego and all over the US, and we will be providing one of the best home day cares in San Diego.

With ten years of staffing success, thousands given job opportunities, and dozens of happy children and their families... it's so special that you help us be together as a family, reunited, building a strong family, building a strong business, making an impact on the world!  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute $, it doesn't mean you can't help!  Get the word out using the Indiegogo tools to spread the word.
