story:
The P.E.I. Dodgeball Club needs your help!

Being from Prince Edward Island, Canada, It's a bit uncommon that many of us enjoy dodgeball. People would often associate our "gentle island" with sports like curling, golf and hockey. Though dodgeball is thriving in our little province. 

The P.E.I. Dodgeball Club has been active for the last 7 years and has helped keep dodgeball available to Islanders.

To those of us who play Dodgeball every Sunday, we are very passionate about the sport. We're always looking for new players and generally anyone who will come out to play. Being from a small province and playing a, obscure sport, it is often hard to get people to come out and play though we've managed.


The club is now seeking help in our endeavors in Dodgeball Nation's (www.dodgeballnation.ca) international tournament on July 7th 2012 in Toronto, Canada.

 

Follow the money..

We're looking for $1500 in funds that will be split up into these areas

  • Travel Costs to Toronto. 
  • Registration Costs
  • P.E.I. Dodgeball Club Uniforms 
All donations received after those costs are covered will be put towards the club's management and organization.
 

Why you should donate

The members of the P.E.I. Dodgeball club are extremely passionate about dodgeball and feel they should have an opportunity to prove the skills on a international scale. With many of us being students, it is very difficult to pool together funds for a trip to Toronto and back. 

We hope you'll consider donating and helping the club get to Toronto.

story:
Regulus Coffee House Company is a locally owned and operated business. We are located in the Portage Park neighborhood on the northwest side of Chicago.  Our neighbors welcomed us with open arms which thrilled us to no end. They have continued to show support and as we are nearing our one-year anniversary, we would like to show our thanks by fulfilling some dreams and suggestions made by them.

There are many reasons why we wanted to open, amongst them being our passion for coffee and coffeehouses themselves. We look at them as being the original social network. We wanted to help our local economy by bringing a diverse clientele to the area, while adding what we thought was missing: a local coffee shop!  We believe there is a natural allure to the neighborhood coffeehouse and what it can do: educate, entertain, and even add positivity to the quality of life.

We jumped through the hoops required of opening a small business, using all the capital we had and then some. With the banks and business credits not being start-up friendly, we did what we could with what we had. We put countless hours, sleepless nights, and our hearts into what we call Regulus Coffee House Company. We did it! We opened, and it was awesome. The neighborhood was more ecstatic about the opening than we were, we think. That was the positive reinforcement we needed to hear/feel to confirm we made the best choices along the way. We are doing our best and growing in popularity but still lack what  is truly needed to make this work.

It was our goal to create a space where people could run in for a quick fix before work, students could study, neighbors could meet and become friends, and community groups to conspire change. We wanted to give people an alternative to the big guys that run rampant in our city, trying our hardest to keep our quality high and our prices low. Our homey vibe urges people to hang out, get cozy, and read or surf the web while sipping from our one-of-a-kind, handmade (by a local artist!) mugs. We love to use local vendors when we can. When we cant we try and keep it within neighbor states. Our bakers are a neighborhood start-up with a great product. Our independent roaster, with over twenty years experience, has already established himself locally, and we can't get enough of his organic, fair trade selections. We have banded with neighboring businesses to create the Irving Austin Business District, who's goal it is to revitalize and beautify our neighborhood.

Our next step will be to expand our business to better service the needs of the community. This expansion includes both the physical footprint of Regulus and our in-house offerings. We have already opened our doors to local artists and performers so they can get themselves out there. What we have seen has been a talent in the area that had no neighborhood outlet, community groups with the need to mix the meeting venues up, and other local entrepreneurs that would like to hold workshops here. We would like a larger space for those groups to gather for workshops, fundraisers, art shows, etc. Regulus regulars have expressed an interest in a larger menu that would include lunch items. We aim to please and have been talking to vendors for said items, but as of right now, we are short on space to accommodate very much extra in that area.

We come to you and the idea behind crowd-sourcing, realizing this is one of the best ways to solve a problem... with a group. This problem is a welcomed one, though. We need to expand so the community groups can do what they need to in the coffeehouse setting. We'd like to start the motion of adding something else that is missing, and if successful be able to hire a few folks in the area, which will add positivity to the quality of life in our community and pass it forward. However, we lack the capital we need to really get the ball moving to expand, upgrade, and keep up with what is being requested from us.

The campaign, if successful, will help us launch our upgrade process. It will allow us to expand our space and purchase new equipment and seating. We have secured said second space to grow into, however, the spot will need revamping to accommodate our future plans of bringing in our own roaster and an in-house baker. We know this won't happen overnight, but it will allow us the ability to make plans, acquire the proper permits, start renovations, and really build what we've been dreaming about to add to our community. Assuming this all works out as planned, we will be able to open up jobs to our neighbors. Many have inquired, but as of right now, we have only been able to maintain a small staff, earning a minimal salary. Albeit we are getting closer to adding one or two other people, we have not minded scrimping and saving in the name of our dream, but the time has quickly come to begin sharing the experience of a fun, friendly place to work. And with your help we can.

Our goal is to raise $25,000 to be spread out over a number of necessary items and fees and get the process going. We need to purchase code-approved workstations and sanitation stations, an oven, ventilation hood, and various kitchen wares. We would like to upgrade our espresso machine to a more efficient one, if possible. We also will have many permits and other fees to pay for on top of the basic renovation costs and rent. We want to make the second space a reflection of the original space, which we are very proud of. We will grow the space as fast as we can to reach that final goal and don't mind a work in progress. We see this as an investment in our neighborhood and fellow area business owners. We want to help make Portage Park that destination, where people can come to shop, catch a show, grab a bite to eat, and enjoy a cup of coffee. This fundraiser is a stepping stone to a brighter future for us, a greater stepping stone for community groups, and a possible launching pad for another underdog – Regulus' Gallery awaits!

We come to you and the idea behind crowd-sourcing, realizing this is one of the best ways to solve a problem... with a group. This problem is a welcomed one, though. We need to expand so the community groups can do what they need to in the coffeehouse setting. We'd like to start the motion of adding something else that is missing, and if successful be able to hire a few folks in the area, which will add positivity to the quality of life in our community and pass it forward. However, we lack the capital we need to really get the ball moving to expand, upgrade, and keep up with what is being requested from us.
The campaign, if successful, will help us launch our upgrade process. It will allow us to expand our space and purchase new equipment and seating. We have secured said second space to grow into, however, the spot will need revamping to accommodate our future plans of bringing in our own roaster and an in-house baker. We know this won't happen overnight, but it will allow us the ability to make plans, acquire the proper permits, start renovations, and really build what we've been dreaming about to add to our community. Assuming this all works out as planned, we will be able to open up jobs to our neighbors. Many have inquired, but as of right now, we have only been able to maintain a small staff, earning a minimal salary. Albeit we are getting closer to adding one or two other people, we have not minded scrimping and saving in the name of our dream, but the time has quickly come to begin sharing the experience of a fun, friendly place to work. And with your help we can.
Our goal is to raise $25,000 to be spread out over a number of necessary items and fees and get the process going. We need to purchase code-approved workstations and sanitation stations, an oven, ventilation hood, and various kitchen wares. We would like to upgrade our espresso machine to a more efficient one, if possible. We also will have many permits and other fees to pay for on top of the basic renovation costs and rent. We want to make the second space a reflection of the original space, which we are very proud of. We will grow the space as fast as we can to reach that final goal and don't mind a work in progress. We see this as an investment in our neighborhood and fellow area business owners. We want to help make Portage Park that destination, where people can come to shop, catch a show, grab a bite to eat, and enjoy a cup of coffee. This fundraiser is a stepping stone to a brighter future for us, a greater stepping stone for community groups, and a possible launching pad for another underdog – Regulus' Gallery awaits!

story:
Our Story

 

 

Kate’s Joint, vegetarian restaurant and bar, has been a staple in New York City’s East Village since 1996. Solely owned and operated by neighborhood native Kate Halpern, who dreamt to create an affordable restaurant to serve the community she grew up in. Kate’s Joint has grown to become much more than just a business, it is a home for locals and travelers a like, a place to bring family and friends, and to meet new ones.


Unfortunately, with the changing neighborhood and economic recession Kate’s Joint has seen a fall in business and rise in costs. Kate is currently in arrears with the landlord. Eviction notices have been sent, court appearances have been made, and if a substantial amount of money is not raised by April 11th, the next court date, the doors will shut permanently at Kate’s Joint. The East Village will lose another neighborhood landmark.


Anyone who has ever met Kate knows how hard she has worked over the past 15 years, and how dedicated she is to this business. She has many plans to increase business, including transforming a section of the restaurant in to a bakery featuring vegan and gluten free baked goods, reaching a new market of morning commuters who would be able to grab a cup of coffee and a vegan muffin on their way to work. That being said, first thing is first, fighting off this eviction!


Please help save Kate’s Joint, a little bit of the East Village preserved on the corner of 4th Street and Avenue B.

 

 

 

The Impact

 

 

This is not just about saving Kate’s Joint; it is about preserving the East Village. It is about preserving small, female owned businesses. Don’t let Avenue B turn in to a row of Starbucks and banks; help keep small businesses alive!

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $30,000 to go to back rent. While we are hopping to raise the majority of this through donations and fundraisers, we realize that may not be possible. We are also in talks with other funding sources, including loans and investors.


Through donating today not only do you get to see Kate’s Joint enter their 16th year of business, you also get to choose from some amazing perks including a four course meal cooked by Kate herself, or a cooking class led by Kate! Any donation can also be redeemed for a gift certificate worth 50% of the donation (e.g. $300 donation= $150 gift certificate). Perks of lower value can also be claimed with any donation of higher value (e.g. donation of $1000 can= party for 10, or a cooking class, or a t-shirt).


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about this campaign! Tell your friends, family, and neighbors. Post on your Facebook, Twitter, etc. Thank you!!!

www.indiegogo.com/savekatesjoint

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone!

My name is Michael Hung and I am a current Marriage and Family Therapy student in the Houston Texas area.

This Holiday season, I am determined to help spread the gift of charity to my community and have decided to help raise funds for the Children's Assessment Center (Harris County). Now I am not OFFICIALLY AFFILIATED WITH THE CAC, but just wants to help as an individual citizen.

I have had the pleasure of interning with this organization and know first hand the great work that these men and women do. The CAC helps victims and families of Child Sexual Abuse. These kids and families deserve healing and happiness. 

This is an important cause to me because I have worked with many of the children/ families and have seen the detrimental effects of the trauma and abuse. On the other side of that, I have also witnessed the CHANGE and HOPE that occurs when these families receive the help they need! 

Your contribution, no matter how small, can literally help change the lives for these kids and families. I've seen the kiddos light up at the sight of wrapped gifts given to them during holiday times. I've seen the sighs of relief from concerned parents once they enter the building knowing that there is a safe place for their families to get help. I've seen the energy and passion from the staff members and their huge hearts. So please! This holiday season, consider giving back! 


What We Need & What You Get

I am currently shooting for a hefty goal of $5000 to donate to the Children Assessment Center for the holiday season. I am confident that we can even surpass this goal. 

As a special token of my appreciation, I am willing to use my talent of natural shamelessness to film myself doing something super EMBARASSING for your VIEWING PLEASURE. I will be accepting suggestions (please nothing illegal or harmful to anyone or myself) so lets brainstorm together. WHAT DO YOU WANT TO SEE ME DO THAT WILL GET YOU TO DONATE?!

If we receive the funds in time, the money can help buy holiday gifts for the children. The money can also be utilized to help client services and the Therapy& Psychological Department. I can contact CAC to ask them where they feel the money would be best used to service the clients and I will update this page. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, Please help spread the word!!!! Share this with everyone you possibly can!

Lets combat Child Sexual Abuse and promote HEALING this holiday season....as well as for the rest of our lives!


-Michael

story:
Short Summary

Rising Abilities is a traveling camp that provides a safe, educational and fun environment for campers with special needs utilizing the resources at the Bennett Spring State Park.

The Rising Abilities camp will offer much needed social interaction. Campers will be offered the opportunity to fish for trout, swim in the Park pool, and enjoy nature walks and the spring that feeds the river.

We want to help our campers build memories, dreams, and goals. Our Summer Camp provides the ability to have adventures that will never be forgotten.

 Our camp is adapted using special education techniques. We offer weekly retreats, day camps, and a monthly parent support group called Puzzle Parents.

Volunteers can complete their internships or just come to help out. See what we have to offer to our community on youtube.com on the Rising Abilities channel. Like us on Facebook and see all the great things that are going on at Rising Abilities Association.

What We Need & What You Get

For your Organization’s consideration here are the details:


Donors will receive:

$25 personally recognized at auction.

$50 recognized, added to bronze sponsors on our website with link to your website.

$100 recognized, with logo on campers shirts, and silver sponsors on our website with link to your website.

$600 FULL CAMPER SCHOLARSHIP! Recognized, with logo on shirts, and gold sponsors on our website with link to your website. Plus a tote bag with the Rising Abilities logo with a certificate of appreciation.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us get the word out. We are on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and our website http://risingabilities.org.

story:
Sharing, teaching, and being of service.

Cindy Orsillo is my mother in law. That is not why I share her story here and why I chose to help her raise funds. Cindy is an amazing woman with a rich story of love and service.

Cindy has been a teacher in North Carolina for near three decades. Firm, effective, and loving in her classroom. I have met adults that had Mrs. Orsillo as their teacher when they were children and they remember her most fondly. A very active member of her fellowship's youth program, a go to woman for education and church responsibilities. When Cindy is not filling in where she is needed, she is also a GED instructor for adults and Bible studies teacher for children. To be frank, I will just say her kids (awesome kids, btw) do not live in a gated community. Cindy is a teacher, completely and wholly. Besides, of course being simply wonderful her.

I don't need community members to tell me that my husband's mom is great, but they do, time and time again.

For the last few years, Cindy has traveled and returned to Africa to continue what she loves with people (seemingly to me) she was destined to connect with. Her stays in Africa are more than casual voluntourism. Cindy has formed working and lasting relationships with the people, children, and co-creators of the projects that arise out of need in South Africa. Needs like digging and helping install a clean water well / system for an elementary school. She comes to Africa with her teaching experience, but gives more than that where she is called.

Cindy raises the funding and asks loved ones to contribute what and where they are able. Most of her fund raising has been traditional; letters, asking family, and putting together car washes. Her church also contributes towards expenses for the children in Africa. Cindy's expense comes down to plane ticket and lodging. I know that any money beyond that would be spent on providing goods or contributing to the community that hosts her. I know because that is the way my mother in law rolls.

Children in Africa and the U.S. LOVE Mrs. Orsillo (even if they don't always like her ;) Every trip that she makes to South Africa not only directly makes a difference in people's lives there, but inspires many people here to BE more. Cindy encourages love, dedication, and growth through her actions. Her reputation precedes her and inspires others to do what they love and fulfill their destiny.

If you are like her or want to be more like Cindy, in solidarity...contribute, share this, talk about he,r and inspire other kindreds. We all make a difference, sometimes directly and at times vicariously (for now, until we do it too!)

What We Need & Perks

What is needed?

Plane ticket fare  $2600

Lodging expense $150

All monies will go towards fare and lodging. If Cindy's campaign is overabundant I have every confidence that all extra monies would be used with great care and conscience.

Perks!

I will be adding perks as I find them or as supporters donate perks. If you have something to give in this way, please message me. So, keep up with our updates. I do have some ideas that are for local friends and friends abroad.

Lives really are touched by You.

Cindy will mulch a path, tutor a child, hold a baby, dig a well, build a house...with little or no request made at all. It was not Africa, it was in Missouri in a community that was growing, where I lived that I firs experienced Cindy's drive to be or service. In my community (I lived off grid in a growing village), whenever Cindy saw work to be done or children to be celebrated or soothed, SHE was there. I was bed ridden and would watch through my window, my guest work and serve and commune with kind hearted strangers to her. My heart was so full and grateful that I was apart of her family. I mean, I was already sold by her amazing son, but I knew where he came from after watching his mom about the village.

Her kindness hasn't ceased one bit over the years. I've kept up with her posts and stories of Africa. She is meant to be there as much as possible. I think if she wasn't so family oriented, Africa may have won her permanently years ago. I've seen her provide water to children where that made life changing differences for them. Yes, she had the joy of giving shoes, and food, and school supplies, and lessons too. All given joyfully. She shops frugally, period....but where I'm going with this is that she brings to Africa with her gifts as she is able to. The idea behind the gifts are not that of materialism or pure function, but the joy of receiving a present. It only takes remembering your own childhood to remember how awesome that feeling is.

So, helping Cindy is touching so very many lives and in many ways. She will return, her story will continue and generations of men and women will want to give to the world, near and far, as Cindy Orsillo gives of herself.

More than one way to help? Of course!

At times we just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Talk about this campaign about Cindy about what it is to be effective in your dreams
  • Share you ideas with me to help this campaign be most abundant
  • Really:Post, share, use the tools to tweet or whatever the little buttons do.

And finally, thank you.

Aloha,

Nani

story:
Short Summary

We are a small but powerful robotics team from Northern Michigan! 

The robotics program is an extracurricular that is very unique to our school district. 

It teaches important skills that are very useful in the workplace and is a great avenue for students looking for a career in engineering. 

We are made up of fifteen students and five mentors. 

Students learn the importance of communication, science, cooperation, and respect. 

This year, we qualified for the State Championship in Ypsilanti, but have insufficient funds to do so.

 By contributing, you are shaping the future of these student's lives and possibly even careers. 

What We Need & What You Get

What do we need to make it happen?

We are looking for funds to go towards lodging and meals from April 9th through the 12th. 

If you donate over $100, we will send you a t-shirt and a signed photograph of the team!

We will use whatever funds we get toward the trip, regardless of whether or not we make the goal. Any extra funds will go towards the team for the future years.

The Impact

Robotics is the future.

By having our students invest in STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) we are preparing them for the world ahead.

FIRST offers many scholarships for students to be able to go to college and encourages many students to pursue careers in the STEM field. 

Robotics is also a great place for kids who like to think and use logic, as the logo is "the hardest fun you'll ever have."

So far, we have qualified for the state competition 3 out of the 4 years we have been around. The program is continually growing every year. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, there are still many ways in which you can help!

By sharing our campaign, you can make a huge difference!

We need as much support as we can get.

story:
The Story

(Hebrew follows the English text)

For those of you who don't know me, I'm Adam, I've been an active member of CrossFit Tel Aviv since moving to Israel two years ago.

Just last month, my closest friend back in Scotland, Gordon, came out to Tel Aviv to visit for the second time since my Aliyah.

It was supposed to be like just any other vacation, and the opportunity to introduce a group of friends to the country. That was until just a week before, when Gordon was diagnosed with Motor Neurone Disease (or ALS) a rare, progressive and debilitating disease, that attacks the brain and spinal cord. 

Gordon is dying. And fast.



In short, he is quite simply the definition of strength and proactivity. When he was younger he was a member of the Scottish gymnastics team, and more recently he was a member of CrossFit Edinburgh.

He doesn't have long left, but he doesn't plan to wallow in self-pity, he has dedicated the time he has to raise as much money and awareness as he can to fund a cure for this devastating illness. 


Israel is a country of innovators. IsrALS, the charity which funds and conducts the vast majority of research into ALS treatment here in Israel has made strides in treatment of the disease but there is a long road ahead, and IsrALS relies entirely on private donation in order to keep pushing for a cure. 

Every shekel counts.

If there is any community which can be pulled together at times like this, it is ours.



I want to help Gordon help the next generation of ALS sufferers.

And I'd appreciate it a lot if you would help too.

Please give us 7 minutes of your time and a small donation.

To read more about Gordon and ALS, please see his article in The Scotsman:

http://www.scotsman.com/lifestyle/motor-neurone-disease-is-a-death-sentence-1-3444439

The WOD

7 minute AMRAP of:

7 Pull Ups

5 Hand Stand Push Ups

3 Overhead Squats (30kg/40kg)

The WOD will completed on Saturday, 12/7/14 at CrossFit Tel Aviv. Reebok has generously offered to provide a pair of Reebok Nano's to the best RX'ed Male score, the best RX'ed Female score and an additional pair to be raffled off during the event.


We ask that all athletes that plan on attending the event at CrossFit Tel Aviv to register in advance AND consider making a donation to IsrALS by choosing one of the perks listed in this campaign.

For those that can not come and compete on 12/7/14 we appreciate your support and hope that you will consider to complete the WOD on your own, with friends, or even get your local CrossFit box involved! 

Additionally we would encourage you to make a donation to a local ALS research association in honor of this event. However, if you select the t-shirt as a perk from us we will send you the t-shirt and ensure your donation gets to IsrALS!


הסיפור

רק לפני חודש, הגיע חברי הקרוב ביותר מסקוטלנד, גורדון, לביקור שני בתל אביב מאז שעליתי לישראל. זו הייתה אמורה להיות חופשה רגילה לחלוטין, והזדמנות נוספת להכיר את הארץ לקבוצת חברים משותפת שלא ראיתי מזמן. אבל, שבוע קודם לכן, גורדון אובחן כסובל מ-ALS, המכונה גם מחלת לו גריג. זו מחלה נדירה ומנוונת שתוקפת את המוח ואת מערכת העצבים בחוט השדרה. גורדון גוסס, ובמהירות. אם הייתי צריך לתאר את גורדון במשפט הייתי אומר שהוא התגלמות החוסן והיוזמה. כשהוא היה צעיר, הוא היה חבר בנבחרת ההתעלמות הסקוטית, ולאחרונה חבר פעיל בקרוספיט אדינבורו. לא נשאר לו זמן רב, אבל הוא לא מתכנן לשקוע ברחמים עצמיים. הוא החליט להקדיש את זמנו להגברת המודעות ולאיסוף כספים כדי לממן תרופה למחלה הנוראית הזו. בישראל, פועלת חברת IsrALS בחזית החדשנות הרפואית המחקרית של הטיפול במחלה, אולם יש עוד דרך ארוכה לפניה. IsrALS נשענת לחלוטין על מימון פרטי בניסיון למצוא תרופה למחלה, וכל שקל מסייע לה לקחת צעד נוסף. אם יש קהילה שיכולה להירתם למאבק בזמנים כאלה, זו הקהילה שלנו. אני רוצה לעזור לגורדון לעזור לדור הבא של החולים ב-ALS, ואני אודה לכם אם גם אתם תוכלו לסייע בכך. כל מה שצריך זה 7 דקות מזמנים ותרומה קטנה. אתם מוזמנים לקרוא עוד על גורדון ועל המחלה במאמר הבא שנכתב עליו ב-Scotsman

http://www.scotsman.com/lifestyle/motor-neurone-disease-is-a-death-sentence-1-3444439
story_txt:
The Story(Hebrew follows the English text)For those of you who don't know me, I'm Adam, I've been an active member of CrossFit Tel Aviv since moving to Israel two years ago.Just last month, my closest friend back in Scotland, Gordon, came out to Tel Aviv to visit for the second time since my Aliyah.It was supposed to be like just any other vacation, and the opportunity to introduce a group of friends to the country. That was until just a week before, when Gordon was diagnosed with Motor Neurone Disease (or ALS) a rare, progressive and debilitating disease, that attacks the brain and spinal cord. Gordon is dying. And fast.In short, he is quite simply the definition of strength and proactivity. When he was younger he was a member of the Scottish gymnastics team, and more recently he was a member of CrossFit Edinburgh.He doesn't have long left, but he doesn't plan to wallow in self-pity, he has dedicated the time he has to raise as much money and awareness as he can to fund a cure for this devastating illness. Israel is a country of innovators. IsrALS, the charity which funds and conducts the vast majority of research into ALS treatment here in Israel has made strides in treatment of the disease but there is a long road ahead, and IsrALS relies entirely on private donation in order to keep pushing for a cure. Every shekel counts.If there is any community which can be pulled together at times like this, it is ours.I want to help Gordon help the next generation of ALS sufferers.And I'd appreciate it a lot if you would help too.Please give us 7 minutes of your time and a small donation.To read more about Gordon and ALS, please see his article in The Scotsman:http://www.scotsman.com/lifestyle/motor-neurone-disease-is-a-death-sentence-1-3444439The WOD7 minute AMRAP of:7 Pull Ups5 Hand Stand Push Ups3 Overhead Squats (30kg/40kg)The WOD will completed on Saturday, 12/7/14 at CrossFit Tel Aviv. Reebok has generously offered to provide a pair of Reebok Nano's to the best RX'ed Male score, the best RX'ed Female score and an additional pair to be raffled off during the event.We ask that all athletes that plan on attending the event at CrossFit Tel Aviv to register in advance AND consider making a donation to IsrALS by choosing one of the perks listed in this campaign.For those that can not come and compete on 12/7/14 we appreciate your support and hope that you will consider to complete the WOD on your own, with friends, or even get your local CrossFit box involved! Additionally we would encourage you to make a donation to a local ALS research association in honor of this event. However, if you select the t-shirt as a perk from us we will send you the t-shirt and ensure your donation gets to IsrALS!הסיפוררק לפני חודש, הגיע חברי הקרוב ביותר מסקוטלנד, גורדון, לביקור שני בתל אביב מאז שעליתי לישראל.

story:
What is Shoplost?

  • We are a group of young students with passion and great ideas.
  • This app is going to change the way you are going to shop by saving time and money at the same time.  We will save time by showing you where are the stores you are interested in depending in what products you like.  And we will make you spend less by posting special offers based on your interests.
  • Please help us create our first prototype.  With this we are going to help you and many others to stop wasting time and money on shopping


Help us to help you

  • To develop the beta version of the app we need a total of US$3,000.
  • In which US$2,000 is for a programmer.
  • US$1,000 to buy a good computer for data saving.
  • US$100 for app store anual membership
  • And US$400 for unforeseen expenses

How it works

The app consist in when you arrive to the mall, after connecting to the mall's hotspot, a map will come up; showing your actual location in the building. At the search bar you would be able look for a shop department and also look for a specific store. The app will automatically give you a route to the shop you are looking for. As you walk through the mall, special offers from your most visited stores will pop out showing your personal and exclusive deal.  In the friends section you would be able to sinc the app with your Facebook or twitter friends, making you able to see if they are nearby in the map. 

The malls and/or stores will have a monthly membership, to have access to the data saved by the app. Data about general traffic in the building, and average staying of costumers. With this data stores and malls can reorganize to optimize sales and attract more customers.   





Our Team

    From left to right: Jose Alejandro Valdeavellano, Andrés Salguero, Silvana Rodríguez

story:
Hi, Folks!

I am honored and excited to announce that I have been chosen as one of just 240 US delegates to attend Slow Food’s 2014 Terra Madre & Salone del Gusto global food conference from October 23-27 in Turin, Italy.

Delegates from over 130 countries are selected for their ability to represent their country, and their food traditions.  While in Italy, we will be given many opportunities for cross-cultural learning, to share food movement success stories and lessons learned, and to build relationships and bring new ideas back to the challenges still to be met at home. 

As a beginning cheese-maker and a selected delegate to the conference, I’m hoping for support to cover travel costs, and possibly even make some additional visits to creameries after the conference to maximize this learning experience. I want to learn as much as I can to deepen my education about artisan style cheese making and to share this knowledge with my community when I return.

A little about me...

For the past 10 years I have been working as a musician, seafood wholesaler and, more recently, pursuing a passion as a beginning cheese maker.

As a seafood wholesaler on the historic Union Wharf in Portland, Maine, I’ve been working to help our company shift direction from a retail seafood shipping company to a more localized seafood wholesale company, buying direct from the fishermen and lobstermen and shortening the distance to the customer. We now directly supply some of Southern Maine’s best chefs, caterers and seafood markets with fresh, locally caught seafood.

More recently, I’ve become a cheese maker in training! I began learning the basics of cheese making at home and through master cheese maker Jim Wallace at the New England Cheese Making Supply Company, and since then have become passionate about artisan cheese making and aspire to become a professional cheese maker. To further my learning, I'm interning with Winterhill Farm in Freeport, Maine, making cheese with milk from very rare Randall cows and Jersey cows. At Winter Hill, where they also make yogurt and bottle their own milk, I am studying under owner and cheese maker Sarah Wiederkehr, creating blues, feta, tommes and camembert style cheeses.

One day soon, I hope to start producing my own line of cheeses using the organic milk produced at my wife’s family's dairy farm, Rocky Ridge Organic Farm, which was started by her father 40 years ago in Litchfield, Maine.

While in Italy, I am very excited at the idea of scheduling stops along the way to meet and/or work with artisan cheese makers. There is nothing quite like seeing traditional cheese making first hand from the masters.


What Your Contribution Will Help with...

As a delegate, Slow Food will cover the cost of my conference admissions and meals while in Turin for Terra Madre and Salone del Gusto.  Money raised here will help to pay for my airfare, as well as ground transportation and lodging for the duration of my travels, including visiting regional creameries for a first-hand experience with traditional cheese making.

Perks

With the help of some friends and family, I have come up with some fun "perks" to show my great appreciation for any and all contributions. Some of these were donated from the businesses I work for. They range from Maine lobsters, cheese making classes, music from my past life as a rock star, a creamery tour & tasting, a lobster boat ride-a-long, and more!

I would like to thank Maine Lobster Direct, Winter Hill Farm, Shannon Moon Photography and Captain Dickie for their time and donations.

The Impact

I feel the opportunity to take part in this year’s conference, while also sharing my story, will expand my horizons and of those delegates who also attend. I also look forward to bringing what I learn back and sharing with my community, as I continue my learning journey and follow my passion to become a cheese maker.

Slow Food USA letter of support

May 15, 2014

Dear Friend,

Every two years, Slow Food and communities come together for Terra Madre & Salone del Gusto to display the extraordinary diversity of food from around the world and unite small-scale farmers and artisans who follow the principles of good, clean and fair.

Delegates from over 130 countries are chosen for their ability to represent the breadth of the country’s food traditions and movement success stories as well as their capacity to take the new lessons, ideas and relationships back to the challenges still to be met at home.

This year, Slow Food USA has invited Shawn Saindon to be a U.S. delegate for this landmark food and farming conference, running October 23-27 in Turin, Italy.

Being selected for this historic event is a special honor.

Shawn is one of 240 to be selected as a delegate out of 500 applications. Not only does this mean that Slow Food leaders admire the incredible work that Shawn is doing, it also means that we believe Shawn is an important voice in representing the diverse U.S. food movement to the international community.

The benefits of being a delegate include free admission, housing, food, and ground transportation during the event, as well as an opportunity to showcase their work at Slow Food USA-sponsored booths and events.

We ask that delegates assume the responsibility for their own flight tickets and other incidentals. Many delegates require financial support to attend.

We invite you to join us in supporting Shawn with a donation today.

Terra Madre and Salone del Gusto is a powerful and transformative experience. Delegates leave inspired to change the food system through a global consciousness and deeper respect for the diverse, international food movement.

This year, the theme of Terra Madre and Salone del Gusto is food diversity as an alternative to industrial agriculture, especially as expressed through Slow Food’s Ark of Taste and Presidia projects. The events also will closely coordinate with the International Year of the Family Farmer.

The Slow Food USA delegation will also celebrate the immense human and cultural diversity present in the US. Please support Shawn in joining the most diverse U.S. delegation yet to attend Terra Madre and Salone del Gusto.

Thank you,

Jovan Sage

Director, Network Engagement

Slow Food USA

Other Ways to Help

I know that some of you want to help but cannot do so at this time, and I appreciate that! One of the most powerful tools we have to help each other out these days is social media. Please feel free to share my campaign through Facebook, Twitter or email.

Thank you for taking the time to read this! I appreciate any and all of your support.

Shawn Saindon

story:
Our campaign is off to a good start thanks to your support!

Stylish Sleeve that prevents tangled cords for good!
Untangle your life... With NEET!

"I had the experience of fighting with my mobile device wires and cords.  I was so mad and frustrated because my cords kept tangling.  Worst of all, there is not a good product to resolve this solution.  I’m sure many of you share my frustrating experience.  Thanks to the inspiration that my wife and a jewelry clerk gave me and an epiphany during the middle of the night ... the NEET Sleeve was born! Now you can easily and quickly organize your cords and no more tangles.  No more tangles around your workspace while connecting to your cell phone, mobile device, ear buds and earphones. No more tangles during your travel.  No more tangles during workouts with long cords that gets in the way.  Now you can adjust your cords length, protect and use it with your imagination.  Such as wear it around your wrist and even use it as a cell phone stand".  - Peter Chin, Inventor

There was just no functional solution for our problems. We have all bought the little straps, tubes, slotted cards, etc. that were supposed to solve our cable management problems. No solution was satisfying.



We created the NEET Sleeve. The NEET Sleeve slips easily over wires and cords and prevents tangling. It's adjustable, giving you freedom and control and organizing the mess with one NEET sleeve for wire management.

The NEET Sleeve gives you the structure that want and the flexibility that you need.

The NEET Sleeve allows you to wear your cables fashionably while you do your everyday things. You can effortlessly carry your mobile device charger with you anywhere.

No more annoying cables getting in the way during your physical activities. With the NEET Sleeve, you can adjust the length of your cables. The NEET Sleeve also provides structure to the cable to hold its position.



The NEET Sleeve currently comes in 8 color varieties to match the users personality and mood: Pink, Green, Blue, Yellow, Bronze, Silver, White and Black. The NEET Universal is available in red and navy blue also.
Worldwide Patent Pending

The Perks for helping us

  • You get to be a trendsetter. You get the cable management solution you have been looking for. You will be one of the first people to own a NEET Sleeve. You get to buy the NEET Sleeve at below retail prices.
  • NEET Sleeve for Apple iPhone 5 Lightning Cable will ship out mid-April. Universal NEET Sleeve will begin shipping in June.
  • Get one for yourself and your significant other. Now you can identify your own cord so you don't get blamed when they lose theirs.


The Staff

  Peter Chin, Inventor
Peter has over twenty years experience working in the product manufacturing industry. The majority of his career has been focused on product development and packaging design. He has been a product designer for Blizzard Entertainment/Activision, creating top selling merchandise for the top online games. Along with product design, Peter has created innovative packaging for some of the largest distilleries in the nation. His designs have garnered numerous international awards and recognition. Designing products for national clients requires frequent travel. As the reliance on traveling with technology grew, Peter's frustration with the tangled, knotted mess in his travel bag grew. He turned that frustration into  a passion, the NEET sleeve.

Bert Ibarra, Creative Director
Bert brings eight years of graphic design and creative marketing from being the marketing lead at the successful promotional firm, Beyond Manufacturing. He has boosted the visibility of Beyond by challenging the industry protocol for marketing and thinking outside of the box. In addition, Bert has helped design the newest line of apparel for the Combat Sports brand, taking his love for Boxing and MMA to an artistic level. Bert loves to challenge himself and test his ability to adapt to different markets.
 

 Louis Dai, Project Coordinator
Louis is in charge of getting things to where they need to be and making sure the quality is top notch. From shipments of products coming in or going out, checking inventory and making sure that everyone has the right supply, Louis is right there to make sure it happens. Nothing is possible without the right person making sure all the right pieces are in place.
  Dottie Bessette, Brand Specialist
Dottie is the brand specialist, with over twenty years of delivering successful branding solutions to technology firms like Verdasys. She knows what gets people excited about a product. Dottie uses her product knowledge to create the necessary buzz for a product to be visible.
 

 Oscar Lopez, Creative Assistant
Oscar Lopez has been creating graphics for six years at Beyond Manufacturing alongside Bert. Oscar is a true workhorse with the ability to turn visions and ideas into reality. When someone has an idea and needs it to be visualized, they know Oscar is the go-to man.
 

 Billy Beltran, Operations Manager
 Billy has over 15 years of running operations for Roxy and Quicksilver brands of apparel. Quality is second to none for Billy and he has proven that with the Roxy and Quicksilver brands growing in popularity and reputation during his tenure. He brings that same level of integrity and desire to the NEET Products brand.
 

 Wan Wan Hsu, The Wife
The Boss of all Bosses. She was part of the inspiration and development.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to contribute, maybe you know someone that can. Share our products using the share tools. We will love you forever if you do.

Thank you so much for your support.
story_txt:
Our campaign is off to a good start thanks to your support!

Stylish Sleeve that prevents tangled cords for good!Untangle your life... With NEET!"I had the experience of fighting with my mobile device wires and cords.  I was so mad and frustrated because my cords kept tangling.  Worst of all, there is not a good product to resolve this solution.  I’m sure many of you share my frustrating experience.  Thanks to the inspiration that my wife and a jewelry clerk gave me and an epiphany during the middle of the night ... the NEET Sleeve was born! Now you can easily and quickly organize your cords and no more tangles.  No more tangles around your workspace while connecting to your cell phone, mobile device, ear buds and earphones. No more tangles during your travel.  No more tangles during workouts with long cords that gets in the way.  Now you can adjust your cords length, protect and use it with your imagination.  Such as wear it around your wrist and even use it as a cell phone stand".  - Peter Chin, Inventor
There was just no functional solution for our problems. We have all bought the little straps, tubes, slotted cards, etc. that were supposed to solve our cable management problems. No solution was satisfying.We created the NEET Sleeve. The NEET Sleeve slips easily over wires and cords and prevents tangling. It's adjustable, giving you freedom and control and organizing the mess with one NEET sleeve for wire management.The NEET Sleeve gives you the structure that want and the flexibility that you need.The NEET Sleeve allows you to wear your cables fashionably while you do your everyday things. You can effortlessly carry your mobile device charger with you anywhere.No more annoying cables getting in the way during your physical activities. With the NEET Sleeve, you can adjust the length of your cables. The NEET Sleeve also provides structure to the cable to hold its position.The NEET Sleeve currently comes in 8 color varieties to match the users personality and mood: Pink, Green, Blue, Yellow, Bronze, Silver, White and Black. The NEET Universal is available in red and navy blue also.Worldwide Patent PendingThe Perks for helping us

You get to be a trendsetter. You get the cable management solution you have been looking for. You will be one of the first people to own a NEET Sleeve. You get to buy the NEET Sleeve at below retail prices.


NEET Sleeve for Apple iPhone 5 Lightning Cable will ship out mid-April. Universal NEET Sleeve will begin shipping in June.

Get one for yourself and your significant other. Now you can identify your own cord so you don't get blamed when they lose theirs.
The Staff

 



		Peter Chin, Inventor
		Peter has over twenty years experience working in the product 
		manufacturing industry. The majority of his career has been focused on 
		product development and packaging design. He has been a product designer 
		for Blizzard Entertainment/Activision, creating top selling merchandise 
		for the top online games. Along with product design, Peter has created 
		innovative packaging for some of the largest distilleries in the nation. 
		His designs have garnered numerous international awards and recognition. 
		Designing products for national clients requires frequent travel. As the 
		reliance on traveling with technology grew, Peter's frustration with the 
		tangled, knotted mess in his travel bag grew. He turned that frustration 
		into  a passion, the NEET sleeve.








		Bert Ibarra, Creative Director
		Bert brings eight years of graphic design and creative marketing from 
		being the marketing lead at the successful promotional firm, Beyond 
		Manufacturing. He has boosted the visibility of Beyond by challenging 
		the industry protocol for marketing and thinking outside of the box. In 
		addition, Bert has helped design the newest line of apparel for the 
		Combat Sports brand, taking his love for Boxing and MMA to an artistic 
		level. Bert loves to challenge himself and test his ability to adapt to 
		different markets.



 




		Louis Dai, Project Coordinator
		Louis is in charge of getting things to where they need to be and making 
		sure the quality is top notch. From shipments of products coming in or 
		going out, checking inventory and making sure that everyone has the right 
		supply, Louis is right there to make sure it happens. Nothing is 
		possible without the right person making sure all the right pieces are 
		in place.



 



		Dottie Bessette, Brand Specialist
		Dottie is the brand specialist, with over twenty years of delivering 
		successful branding solutions to technology firms like Verdasys. She 
		knows what gets people excited about a product. Dottie uses her product 
		knowledge to create the necessary buzz for a product to be visible.



 


Oscar Lopez, Creative AssistantOscar Lopez has been creating graphics for six
years at Beyond Manufacturing alongside Bert. Oscar is a true workhorse with
the ability to turn visions and ideas into reality. When someone has an idea
and needs it to be visualized, they know Oscar is the go-to man.



 



		Billy Beltran, Operations Manager

		Billy has over 15 years of running operations for Roxy and Quicksilver 
		brands of apparel. Quality is second to none for Billy and he has proven 
		that with the Roxy and Quicksilver brands growing in popularity and 
		reputation during his tenure. He brings that same level of integrity and 
		desire to the NEET Products brand.



 




Wan Wan Hsu, The WifeThe Boss of all Bosses. She was part of the inspiration and development.



Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute, maybe you know someone that can. Share our products using the share tools. We will love you forever if you do.Thank you so much for your support.

story:
Contributions to this campaign will go directly to farming families in Kentucky who will receive the resources needed to grow, harvest and process the seed plant bio cooking oil, feed stock and bio fuel. This will make them profitable and self sustaining.

Kentucky’s Governor Steve Beshear was quoted recently saying “A $5.4 billion industry, agriculture is vital to Kentucky’s economy. The state’s 77,000 farms cover nearly 13 million acres.”

Our Kentucky program is providing start up resources for local farmers to become self sustaining. We provide the farmers with seeds, fertilizer, agricultural consultants, equipment, and on going support. The seed plants we use in our program allow our farmers to harvest a crop which can be used to make cooking oil, high grade natural feed stock, bio fuel, and a variety of healthy products! Click here to see a list of hundreds of healthy products made from this crop

 Our goal first and foremost is to build awareness around crops which allow farmers anywhere to become self sustaining. To that end we created an  IPHONE 6 referral contest to make it fun to share and help build awareness. See contest details at the bottom of this page .

The seed oil our farmers will be producing is a proven and working technology.
It will be used to make cooking oil, high grade natural feed stock (for animals) , bio fuel, and a variety of healthy products!
There's been over over 8 years of studies completed by The University of Colorado, The University of Florida, and The USAF among others to support this statement.

Click here for studies


We utilize only natural NON GMO Plants like Sunflower, NON GMO Camellia and camerata (all part of the mustard seed group). None of these compete with food crops. All our farmers use them as cover crops, Winter crops, and double drops along with their food crops! They all add to the farmers profitability.


We are all about helping REAL PEOPLE!!! REAL FAMILIES!!!


If you are concerned about the proof of our concept, please check out the studies published by The University of Colorado, The University of Florida, and the USAF. You can click this link to see our FAQ page. Each study is over 100 pages, but you can download them on this page:

Bio Revolution FAQ

We are using the most advanced cold oil extracting technology ever available. American tested and proven since 2006! Why are we doing this? Because it needs to be done! American working farmers need the support and our world needs to have these bio friendly products!

Click here to learn more about out our bio fuel

If you just cannot donate, that's OK. There is still a lot you can do! Get the word out to all your friends and family. Use your social media, post our YouTube videos, and re tweet us too! #IamTheRevolution

"Join the revolution" music video by Jes Lauren with Gregg Sgarlata


What the press is saying about us:

Feed The Grid.com Renewable Energy News

Bio Domestic Fuel.com

KWQC-TV 6

WBOY-TV12

WMBB.com

Advancced Bio Fuels USA.info

PR News web

We're ALL IN THIS TOGETHER, AND YOU ARE A PART OF THE REVOLUTION!

Perk Pictures

Personalized Bio oil

Our Bumper Stickers

Bio Revolution America cap


Bio Revolution America Coffee Cup


You'll receive our Bio Revolution America Combo Pack: Organic T-shirt, large coffee mug, and our re usable ECO FRIENDLY tote bag.

Sample of a Personalized Product which can be a memorial, family or organization, and which will be made from our farmers oils and marketed globally on our website!

*Our fantastic IPHONE 6 Referral Contest!!!!!!!!

Starting today, anyone who uses the share buttons above on this campaign page to help us get the word out about the Bio Revolution will be tracked. The most visits, and/or donations from your referrals (Above 100 to qualify) will win a brand new IPHONE 6 as soon as it's released and as soon as our campaign is complete. So use the share buttons above with all your social media and tell EVERYONE Help farming families, help the environment and get your new IPHONE 6!!!

You do NOT need to buy anything or donate to win. You only need to have an Indiegogo account for your referrals to be tracked.(Contest is void where prohibited by law). The most amazing phone ever made can be yours!! If you have any questions leave a comment and we'll get right back to you. Let's do this guys!!!!

story:
A little something about NicTictips.

www.nictipcollections.com

These are an original idea and are being pattoned.

My name is Nick Downs, I am the creator of the NicTip Collections. I am a photographer and founder of Paranormal L.I.G.H.T.S. (Lincoln Investigations of Ghost Hauntings and The Supernatural) in Lincoln Nebraska.

I modify toys for the use of electronic cigarets to fit onto vaporizer atomizers with other materials for people to vape from many different types of personal MODs and E-cigs. I started my series of Godzilla character MOD tips. It boomed after adding a new series of characters each week. Many people know of the old-school generations, like Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Transformers, Care Bears to today's modern toons such as Pokemon, anime and so forth.

This is very important to me because every time I see a really cool NEW mod released, I always picture something could be added with a little spunk or attitude. My son stopped playing with one of his toys, so I thought... Hmmm... This would be cool if... then it hit me. I modified it and placed it onto one of my vaporizer MODs. I used it for a few days and I received a LOT of positive feedback. People I came across asked me where I bought it and that they want one. A few people even offered to buy it from me at a reasonable price. And so I sold it to her and I turned around and went home and made 3 more. Sure enough, all of them got sold. Then another, and another. Once I came up with the TMNT, they all sold out as well.

Vapor venders, shop owners have asked if I would sell my tips in their shops. I would LOVE to make this happen without slowing productivity even slower. Now I am in the hunt for some equipment and material to make more, more and even more MOD tips for customers at a reasonable price. With it, I can then make possible custom tips with sleep air flow and pull. More cloud productions and a healthy way to help people to stop smoking and live better. WITH STYLE.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding I need to get the production rolling is $6,000 for the equipment to make plastic toy tips. Each one has a unique look, feel and style. I like to believe that no two tips are alike. I want them to feel like they are a one of a kind. I am in search for someone to help for custom paintings for the tips which will also cost me to get started for the labor of the creations, paint, material, plastic and artist. Each MOD tip usually sell between $45-$65 a head. But I am hoping to get what I need made to lower the cost to customers and be able to sell to vape shop owners to display in their stores by whole sale.

If I don't make the goal, the fund will still be put to good use for productivity and I still plan to continue this work. My goal is to make these awesome tip creations and allow others to see my idea out in the word to show their pride in vaping.

The Impact

Show your vaping in pride. Show your additude. Show the world who you are, what you like. Don't let negative media change who you are or what you do. Vaping is the way of better living. You did not start vaping to be cool. You didn't start vaping to fit in. You did it to breath. No matter what the media says, your MOD tip will tell them "Hey... I am who I am and I will keep calm and VAPE ON!"

You are welcome to join in the vaping community. If you are not familiar with vaping, no worries. You are always welcome to join in my vaping community at www.facebook.com/groups/heartlandvapephenomenon

You can learn a lot of the heath benefits and lives that will be saved.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

PLEASE share this to everyone you know. If not, that's okay. I trust in the cool work I put into these tips. People like them, want them, and so I make them.
  • I'm new to Indiegogo, please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you very much for reading.

Nick Downs

story:
My Name is Josh and I started riding motorcycles about 4 years ago. My first bike was a 1980 Honda XL250 which I owned for 3 years. My friend introduced me to dirt riding and soon after I upgraded my bike to a KLR in 2013. Since then I've done a few moto-camping trips, some over weekends and another over 10 days. It's an addiction thats taken over my life and if you've ever ridden a motorcycle you understand the itch to just hit the road and go.

I'm planning to leave my job in late June or early July to head to a KLR Rally in Colorado. I'm leaving a few weeks early in order to explore the west coast and enjoy life on the road, camping off the bike and living as minimally as possible. This trip is a big life changer for me because I've never traveled outside of my home state on my bike, nor have I ever committed to such an adventure. I don't plan on returning home immediately after the rally and I would like to eventually continue on into Mexico and Central America afterwards. This campaign would be helpful in many ways, assuring I'll have money for emergencies, supplies and repairs for the bike. I'd be grateful for any help if you decided to do so and may even send you something in return as a thank you.

story:
Hi! We're Kevin & Brooke Maschmeier. Thank you for checking out our Indiegogo campaign today!

Kevin is a barista by day/singer-songwriter by night, and Brooke works for a non-profit organization. They live in Nashville, Tennessee with two pups named Koola & Khloe.

We always dreamed of becoming parents one day. After receiving the diagnosis that we would not be able to have children on our own, the dream didn’t go away. We don’t consider it so much as choosing to adopt, but that this is what was meant for us our entire lives.

We are currently on the waiting list and at any moment (!!!) a birth mom could see our profile and pick us to raise her child. To be trusted enough to raise someone else's child is such an enormous responsibility and something we don't take lightly. We are completely humbled to be given this opportunity to be parents.

What We Need & What You Get

Our domestic infant adoption will cost roughly $20,000 once all is said and done. We've already paid for some administrative costs, such as the home study and the birth mother fee. The placement fee is due after a child is placed in our home, and then we will have to cover additional legal fees, which can vary drastically in cost.

  • Administrative fees = $1,500
  • Home study fee = $2,000
  • Birth mother fee = $3,000
  • Placement fee = $9,800
  • Legal fees after placement = unknown

The purpose of this campaign is to help with the cost of the placement fee only. Our goal is to raise $5,000, about half of the final fee to adopt a child. Any money that we raise above and beyond $5,000 will be applied to the legal fees.

Every donation made will qualify you to receive a perk. The perks vary by dollar amount and the more you are able to give, the more you will get in return.

  • $1 - Our heartfelt thanks (an email from Kevin & Brooke)
  • $5 - Digital download of 'Love Found Us,' an exclusive song written/recorded by Kevin + our heartfelt thanks (Click here to listen to the song!) (Song will be in .m4a format)
  • $10 - 4x6" family photo + Song (family photo will be delivered after we bring our baby home!)
  • $20 - Adoption quilt square + Family photo + Song (Brooke’s mom is making a quilt for Baby Masch! This perk will "buy" a quilt square that will be added to the baby's quilt.)
  • $25 - Feeling generous? Give here!
  • $30 - 'Mama Bird' Necklaces. Brooke has made 4 pendants available on a first come, first served basis. Choose either a round or square 2 inch pendant (18 inch chain included). Since this is a limited perk, it will not be included with the higher perk levels but you will get a family photo & Kevin's song! 
  • $50 - Exclusive adoption campaign T-shirt (choose from heather red or dark heather gray) + Adoption quilt square + Family photo + Song
  • $75 - 4x4" limited edition canvas art print by the talented Lauren Rives + T-shirt + Adoption quilt square + Family photo + Song (Click here to see more of Lauren's work)
  • $100 - Feeling generous? Give here!
  • $100 - Custom-designed Christmas cards by artist/illustrator/cartoonist Joseph Hollon. Choose either an e-card or 25 printed cards + T-shirt + Quilt square + Family photo + Song (Only 3 available - click here to see more of Joseph's work)
  • $175 - Exclusive dinner with Kevin & Brooke! We will take you and one guest out to dinner to one of our favorite Nashville restaurants so we can hang out and get to know you! Plus you get TWO campaign T-shirts and the song! (Only 2 available - LOCAL NASHVILLE RESTAURANT ONLY. Does NOT include transportation to/from Nashville. Must be in Nashville on a pre-arranged date. Date flexibility is a must; cannot guarantee specific dates. We are flexible and can pick a restaurant that fits your dietary restrictions.)
  • $250 - A box of our favorite Nashville things! This perk includes treats from our favorite eateries, a set of postcards from Hatch Show Print and more! You'll also get the 4x4" canvas print, campaign T-shirt, quilt square, family photo, and song! (Only 5 available - see photo below!)
  • $1,000 - Long Lost Uncle. You're the rich uncle we didn't know we had! You get all the perks listed above, plus a VERY SPECIAL mystery gift! SOLD!!!!
  • $1,000 - Long Lost Aunt. You're the rich aunt we didn't know we had! You get all the perks listed above, plus a VERY SPECIAL mystery gift! ;-)

Similar to what the finished quilt for Baby Masch will look like! ($20 donation level 'buys' one square to be added to the quilt)

'Mama Bird' Pendants - Only 4 available on a first come, first served basis. ($30 donation level)


T-shirts: Choose from two colors (the red runs slightly smaller). Unisex sizes XS - XXXL ($50 donation level)

Limited edition 4x4" hand painted canvas ($75 donation level)

Examples from artist Joseph Hollon - get a custom designed Christmas card or e-card! ($100 donation level - only 3 available!)

"Nashville things" perk ($250 donation level - so many goodies!!! Only 5 available!)

Every single contribution brings us one step closer to becoming parents and helps give a child a good home. Words cannot adequately express how important this Indiegogo campaign is to our family. If you are unable to give financially, you can still help! We'd love it if you could share our campaign on social media or email the link to your friends.

We are so grateful to you for taking the time to support our adoption!

Lots of Love - Kevin & Brooke

Since this is a limited perk, it will not be included with the higher perk levels but you will get a family photo & Kevin's song! 


$50 - Exclusive adoption campaign T-shirt (choose from heather red or dark heather gray) + Adoption quilt square + Family photo + Song


$75 - 4x4" limited edition canvas art print by the talented Lauren Rives + T-shirt + Adoption quilt square + Family photo + Song (Click here to see more of Lauren's work)


$100 - Feeling generous? Give here!

$100 - Custom-designed Christmas cards by artist/illustrator/cartoonist Joseph Hollon. Choose either an e-card or 25 printed cards + T-shirt + Quilt square + Family photo + Song (Only 3 available - click here to see more of Joseph's work)


$175 - Exclusive dinner with Kevin & Brooke! We will take you and one guest out to dinner to one of our favorite Nashville restaurants so we can hang out and get to know you! Plus you get TWO campaign T-shirts and the song! (Only 2 available - LOCAL NASHVILLE RESTAURANT ONLY. Does NOT include transportation to/from Nashville. Must be in Nashville on a pre-arranged date. Date flexibility is a must; cannot guarantee specific dates. We are flexible and can pick a restaurant that fits your dietary restrictions.)


$250 - A box of our favorite Nashville things! This perk includes treats from our favorite eateries, a set of postcards from Hatch Show Print and more! You'll also get the 4x4" canvas print, campaign T-shirt, quilt square, family photo, and song! (Only 5 available - see photo below!)


$1,000 - Long Lost Uncle. You're the rich uncle we didn't know we had! You get all the perks listed above, plus a VERY SPECIAL mystery gift! SOLD!!!!


$1,000 - Long Lost Aunt. You're the rich aunt we didn't know we had! You get all the perks listed above, plus a VERY SPECIAL mystery gift! ;-)




Similar to what the finished quilt for Baby Masch will look like! ($20 donation level 'buys' one square to be added to the quilt)






'Mama Bird' Pendants - Only 4 available on a first come, first served basis. ($30 donation level)


T-shirts: Choose from two colors (the red runs slightly smaller). Unisex sizes XS - XXXL ($50 donation level)





Limited edition 4x4" hand painted canvas ($75 donation level)





Examples from artist Joseph Hollon - get a custom designed Christmas card or e-card! ($100 donation level - only 3 available!)








"Nashville things" perk ($250 donation level - so many goodies!!! Only 5 available!)




Every single contribution brings us one step closer to becoming parents and helps give a child a good home. Words cannot adequately express how important this Indiegogo campaign is to our family. If you are unable to give financially, you can still help! We'd love it if you could share our campaign on social media or email the link to your friends. We are so grateful to you for taking the time to support our adoption!Lots of Love - Kevin & Brooke

story:
Short Summary

On Wednesday, June 12, 2013, Mark passed away unexpectedly leaving behind his loving wife Stacey and two beautiful children, Joshua (8) and Emily (4).  There are a lot of words one could use to describe Mark...Loyal, devoted, hardworking, trustworthy, just to name a few.  Above all, he was a family man, putting his wife and kids ahead of everything else.  His absence will be greatly felt, but his memories will live on forever in all that had the pleasure of knowing him.  We are hoping to raise at least $2500 to help Stacey and the children through the trying times that are still to come...bills to be paid, daycare expenses, and so many other unexpected expenses along the way.  No gift is too small...all funds will go directly to Stacey to help ease the worry she may have for providing for her family.

story:
About this Campaign Effort:

This is about helping a poet in need. This is about a father of three being evicted. This is about poetry as his only viable source for living. This is about not being able to cover gas, tolls, childcare and in order to get to his gigs. This is about the community helping a man that uses his poetry to change his surroundings.

What We Need

We need monies to help secure a deposit for new living quarters for a family of 5.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate money, donate a feature slot. Hire this poet, this writer, this performer to change the lives of your audience. He is an amazing performer. He is currently the Nuyorican Grand Slam Champ and had to rescind his offer as a team member due to his uncertainty about his future home and for the safety of his beautiful children.

story:
The MU Crane Memorial Statue

UPDATE - GOAL REACHED!!!

Now Introducing:

Stretch Goals!


If each person who Liked The MU Crane page donated just over $1...

Be a part of OSU history and leave your mark on campus.

  • The Crane has given us so much. Now it is time to remember the crane and immortalize it on our campus. By helping us reach this goal, you can leave your own mark on campus that signifies your time here and all that you have accomplished.
  • Funds raised will be used to commission an artist to realize the memorial, and to construct a statue to the crane and the community that surrounds it.
  • The Oregon State community is passionate, forward-thinking and incredibly creative. The Crane embodies these traits and symbolizes the students who know and love it.


What We Need & What You Get

Perks and benefits

  • The amount of money we raise will determine the quality of materials used in the construction of the memorial. The base number will be adequate materials such as stone and wood. Imagine if we raised enough to immortalize the crane in bronze!
  • For each level of donation, contributors will receive different perks such as T-Shirts, buttons, posters and more!
  • If the fundraising does not reach at least $2500, then the money will be returned to contributors as per the standard Indiegogo fundraising system.

The Impact

Imagine saying that you were a part of OSU history...

  • Know that you will leave a permanent mark on this campus and helped bring a community together in the light of positivity and looking towards a bright future.
  • Other students will see these efforts and join in the excitement of following this grand adventure.
  • Help us build a monument to the crane and all it stands for.

FAQ

Q: Is this for real?
A: Yes. We could not be more serious about making this memorial an actual and lasting expression of the Crane's values, but we need your help to make it happen.

Q: Where will the memorial be located? 
A: Ideally, we would like the memorial to be located in or around the upcoming Student 
Experience Center (on which the Crane has been so tirelessly working). As of now, the location is still being determined.

Q: Is shipping included on pledge levels that include physical items?
A: No. In order to keep costs as low as possible and ensure that we can produce the highest quality materials possible, we have decided not to include shipping on reward items. They will instead be available for pickup on the Oregon State University campus in Corvallis, OR. If you would like to arrange for your own shipping to somewhere other than OSU, that can be arranged through email after the campaign has ended.

Q: How can I get involved?
A: There is a lot you can do! Besides donating, you can follow the crane on https://
www.facebook.com/themucrane and https://twitter.com/TheMuCrane and tell your friends to do the same. Show your support by making the Crane’s logo your Facebook Profile picture. If you have specific ideas about other ways to spread the word, or if you just want to help more, message us at TheMuCrane@gmail.com

Q: How often should I doubt the Crane?
A: Never ever.


NEVER DOUBT THE CRANE.
