story:
What is Rosewood Community Market?

The mission of Rosewood Community Market is simple.

We want to bring fresh and local food to the areas of Austin that need it most. We want that food to be approachable, accessible and affordable. We want to support as many local producers as possible, to serve our neighborhood and surrounding areas as best we can and give back to our community as much as we can.

With your help, Rosewood Community Market will:

  • be East Austin's first cooperative grocery store
  • be fully financially sustainable and economically viable
  • provide our community with consistent access to healthy and nutritious food

Rosewood Community Market is a fresh food grocery store and pilot project founded with a small grant via the City of Austin from money distributed through the Affordable Care Act. We took this tiny sum along with our own money to qualify for a start-up loan through local microlender PeopleFund, and rebuilt 1819 Rosewood to set up a daily access point for farm-fresh as well as conventional produce and healthy snacks.

As we have grown, we have been able to accept SNAP benefits and diversify the products on our shelves. In response to community input, we recently added a Daily Menu, which includes healthy sandwiches, salads, fresh juice and smoothies—all at affordable prices and made from the products we carry in the store. The store is designed around sustainability and minimal waste, with all food waste going into the neighborhood compost cycle via the East Side Compost Pedallers.

We at Rosewood believe that if communities have regular and affordable access to healthy food options grown and produced close to home, have a say in what their neighborhood stores carry and have a stake in seeing those options become a reality, all demographics of that community will benefit. We also believe that if this model can work at Rosewood, it can be a template for other neighborhoods and communities across the United States to help address their own food access and security issues.

Why is Rosewood becoming a co-op?

Rosewood Community Market is transitioning into a food co-op because the cooperative model is built around the ideals of sustainability, affordability and involvement. This is especially important for this market, which resides in the heart of one of Austin's most economically, demographically and ethnically diverse neighborhoods. A cooperative gives the market a chance to engage all members of the community and allows neighbors the opportunity to support one another on a daily basis.

Rosewood Community Market will be East Austin's first cooperative grocery store. The corner of Rosewood and Chicon and the surrounding area was considered a USDA food desert prior to the opening of Rosewood Community Market. In previous generations, the neighborhood had a number of food and grocery options, however over the last several decades, the neighborhood has lost its connection to the experience of having fresh food accessible and available. The cooperative is an effort to re-establish the community's connection to its historical foodways and allow for a voice from all members of the neighborhood about what they want to see from their food providers.

What will my donation to Rosewood go to support?

The key to the entire concept behind this market hinges on access. Every dollar donated to this campaign will help Rosewood improve neighborhood access and increase its capacity for operations and community outreach.

Increase product availability and consistency

Rosewood has established many strong relationships with local growers, producers and distributors. With your help, we can maximize these relationships to meet our customers' requests for products. We see Rosewood as the one-stop shop for anyone looking to make a meal or stock their kitchen with fresh food products. Increased consistency will ultimately drive up patronage and co-op membership, allowing the cooperative better wholesale buying power and lower prices for high quality products at a convenient neighborhood level.

Create viable employment opportunities

Rosewood has had the good fortune of having many dedicated part-time employees and volunteers contribute to its success through the first 11 months of operation. However, it has always been the goal of Rosewood to create sustainable, living-wage employment opportunities for hard-working individuals who want to learn and grow with our organization. Funds from this campaign will be earmarked to hire Rosewood's first full-time general manager, who will build upon the operational strategy for the store front and its subsidiary activities.

Engage the community

The money raised will help Rosewood be at the forefront of an on-the-ground campaign to increase fresh food access in our neighborhood and beyond. We are a small organization, but believe we can be a model for giving our food system and our consuming habits a nudge in the right direction. For example, the new cooperative will be a catalyst in the creation of a Healthy Corner Store Program in the City of Austin. Additional priorities include the support and development of community gardens, urban gardening education and cooking literacy.


What are the perks for supporting Rosewood?

Aside from being part of what we believe to be a very special project and an opportunity to make a real difference in our economic and food systems in a small yet high-impact way, we have tried to put together some one-of-a-kind incentives as a sign of appreciation for your support. Check back regularly throughout the campaign for new limited-edition rewards!

If you choose to support us at a membership level, you will become a founding member of the cooperative or have the ability to sponsor a membership for another member of our community. A lifetime membership to the Rosewood Community Market guarantees access to members-only specials as well as the opportunity to shape the future of the market. The Rosewood Community Market is currently under the guidance of a steering committee that will establish the cooperative, write its charter by-laws, and set the date for the first member meeting. Once the founding members elect Rosewood's first board, it is up to us as a community to direct the future operations of the store.


What challenges does Rosewood face?

Rosewood Community Market has dealt with many of the typical issues a new, small business encounters in its first year. But beyond the daily grind and slim margins of a neighborhood grocery, Rosewood faces several challenges unique to its location, model and mission.

Product Availability

A top priority of the co-op is to make Rosewood a viable, one-stop shop for its members and patrons. But we are limited on space, parking and visibility due to our location in the neighborhood, so it can make getting new patrons in the door a challenge. When they do come in, they can sometimes be confronted with a fluctuating inventory and may find the store does not meet their expectations. The cooperative hopes to address this challenge by increasing its customer baseline and establishing a standard for product purchases through more predictable sales expectations. As we move forward, Rosewood has a great advantage in this regard because we have the first year of operations in the books so it is possible to gauge for the coming seasons.

Affordability

How do you keep fresh and local food affordable? It's one of the toughest questions we have to address. It's also one of the most important to try and figure out. Some of it is finding creative ways to source our products, some is limiting non-food costs and overhead, and some is engaging consumers in the conversation about what good food is actually worth. What is it worth to us to eat fresh, quality food grown close to home and consume products made and distributed locally? There are still more questions than answers in this realm, but it is part of why Rosewood exists.

Servicing a Diverse Community

Rosewood Community Market is uniquely positioned to service a diverse mix of potential patrons. But with that comes the challenge of satisfying the needs of many different groups--culturally, geographically and economically. The corner of Rosewood and Chicon resides in one of Austin's historically African American neighborhoods. The surrounding east side is also home to many Hispanic and Latino households, many of whom have lived in the area for multiple generations. In recent years, parts of the area have been in transition, with many young professionals, students and artists moving in and out of the neighborhood. The market is positioned between several subsidized and affordable housing apartment complexes, near a couple of schools and just off the beaten path from a more intensely developed commercial district near Highway 35. With so many different audiences within a one-mile radius, it will take ongoing work to determine what will best serve the needs of the entire community. Yet we know that everyone should have access to fresh local food, and we believe that this foundation has incredible power to bring people together, no matter their backgrounds.

Reestablishing Neighborhood Food Culture

As previously mentioned, the area where the market is located was once plentiful with neighborhood grocery options. But generations have passed since that was an actuality for the area and with that void of presence has come an expectation, or lack thereof. It will take time to establish the market and have people in the neighborhood understand what it is about, why it is there and trust that it will stick around.

Creating a Community Value of Local Food

Tying into the idea of affordability is also the challenge of creating a value of local food. Many people may find it hard to understand why local food is important or relevant. Some may find it difficult to justify spending more on a bunch of local carrots at the neighborhood cooperative than they would for a similar sized bunch at the chain grocery a few miles away. That speaks to the larger conversation in which we are trying to participate. What is the actual value of food, particularly local food? Why is it worth it? Why should we consider where and how many of our dollars are spent on what? These are not easy questions to answer, but Rosewood is willing to be a place where anyone can feel comfortable engaging in the conversation. 


What are non-financial ways I can support Rosewood?

Word-of-mouth advocacy is Rosewood's most valuable and effective tool in its quest to become a cooperative that can make an outsize impact in Austin and across the country.

Tell someone you know about Rosewood. Tell them about this small store with big goals. Tell your friends to tell their friends. And encourage them to support us in the ways that make the most sense for them.

Help us share our story online! Link to this campaign or a few of the neat pieces that have been published or reported about us, linked below:

Edible Austin Magazine
Austin KVUE News
Johnson's Backyard Garden Organic - Blog
Austinist Magazine
Austin Woman Magazine

Most of all, if you have the time and capacity, come by and visit our store. Talk to our staff, see and feel the space and learn more about what Rosewood is and perhaps more importantly, why. We are confident as soon as you walk through the door, like so many before you, you will understand.

story:
Ok, this is a bit of an inside campaign. Last year, the party boat was fun, and we were able to prepay with a funding campaign, which was awesome. There are only 45 seats available on the boat, so claim while claiming is good. 

Right now the estimated date for the boat trip is June 8th. This is pending finalizing the reservation with the Just for Fun folks. 

If you don't know us, and didn't get here by the facebook page, I'd ask that you don't claim the boat trip as part of the perk. If you just want to throw money our way, that's cool, but this is best between friends. 

Goals

$600 - We get to rent a boat 

$950 - We get to rent a bus 

$1350 - We could probably get a bartender 

?? - Any other ideas?

$50,000 - We won't ever get over funded this much. If we do, I'll go vegitarian for a year.
story_txt: Ok, this is a bit of an inside campaign. Last year, the party boat was fun, and we were able to prepay with a funding campaign, which was awesome. There are only 45 seats available on the boat, so claim while claiming is good. Right now the estimated date for the boat trip is June 8th. This is pending finalizing the reservation with the Just for Fun folks. If you don't know us, and didn't get here by the facebook page, I'd ask that you don't claim the boat trip as part of the perk. If you just want to throw money our way, that's cool, but this is best between friends. Goals$600 - We get to rent a boat $950 - We get to rent a bus $1350 - We could probably get a bartender ?? - Any other ideas?$50,000 - We won't ever get over funded this much. If we do, I'll go vegitarian for a year.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Andy Evans and my background is in Investment Banking. I am launching the Snowball Effect because I am passionate about the idea that changing the world for the better can be achieved on a huge scale if we break it down into small steps.

The Snowball Effect will enable people to take their own ideas and turn them into reality by freeing them up from the barriers that prevent them, such as worries over paying the bills. We aim to pay participants their normal salary (within reason!) to take a year out to launch their projects.

Projects will be wide-ranging in nature, scale and location. They could be centred on an individual's local area or on another country. They could impact a number of different causes, the common theme being that when the idea becomes reality the world will become a better place. This in turn will inspire others to take action and build momentum, hence the Snowball Effect name.

In order to be chosen, participants will need to convince a panel that they have what it takes to make their project successful, the key requisite being passion for their idea. This is a very exciting opportunity for participants to develop their skills in a number of areas while making a real difference in the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise £100,000 to fund phase 1 of the project. A pilot will be run in Milton Keynes, UK and will be targeted at parents who are planning to return to work soon. The aim is to sponsor 5 people initially. All funds raised here are expected to be channelled directly into participants' salary payments. Other costs will be covered through corporate sponsorship.

If we fail to raise the full £100,000 then we will break it down into increments with one person being sponsored per £20,000 raised. Any excess will be held over to the next funding round.

There are ambitious plans for a book to be written following the progress of the project. Early ideas for a television show are also being brainstormed. Please see the 'perks' section at the top-right for additional benefits available to all contributors!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Other contributions in the form of spreading the word would be most appreciated. Please like and share our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/snowball.effect.projects
  • If you would like to volunteer to help on the project we are looking for assistance in several areas especially in the run up to our launch event on January 31st, 2014. Please contact me directly if you would like to get involved.
  • And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools too!

story:
We want to raise funds for returning heroes who need medical care and basic needs such as food, hot water, paid bills etc. Because Veterans of Foreign Wars and We Care are non-profit organizations (both exclusively affiliated with the state of Georgia), we will accept any funds that we can to help our soldiers in need.

We do not only aid soldiers, though. Widows and their children need support as well, and we happily help them as we would with any wounded soldier. When you donate to We Care and Veterans of Foreign Wars, you are helping more than soldiers: You are helping their families.

story:
CAMBRIAN BLUE CLAY

«Cambrian Blue Clay» - is one of the best kept beauty and medical Secrets of the modern world…


CAMBRIAN PERIOD

The Cambrian (/ˈkæmbriən/) is the first geological period of the Paleozoic Era, lasting from 541.0 ± 1.0 to 485.4 ± 1.9 million years ago (mya) and is succeeded by the Ordovician. The period was established by Adam Sedgwick, who named it after Cambria, the Latin name for Wales, where Britain's Cambrian rocks are best exposed.

The Cambrian Period marked a profound change in life on Earth; prior to the Cambrian, living organisms on the whole were small, unicellular and simple. Complex, “multicellular” organisms gradually became more common in the millions of years immediately preceding the Cambrian, but it was not until this period that mineralized – hence readily fossilized – organisms became common. The rapid diversification of life forms in the Cambrian, known as the Cambrian explosion, produced the first representatives of all modern animal phyla.(wikipedia.org)

NORTH-WEST REGION OF RUSSIA

( LENINGRAD REGION )

During the Cambrian period, the continents and seas differed from present day configurations. Four major continents, Gondwanaland, Angara, and the two sections of Euramerica, were inundated with a rising sea level; accumulating thick sedimentary deposits.

At that time, the Russian Lower Cambrian subdivision - Siberia separated from the supercontinent to form an isolated land mass. 
Over the 600 million years Siberia shifted, morphed, and eventually became land -  locked in the Eurasian continent (*During the Pleistocene epoch, great continental ice sheets scoured and depressed the shield's surface - and the ancient rocks have yielded a rich variety of minerals…).
In Russia, the Cambrian beds are remarkable in that they comprise mostly undisturbed and unconsolidated sand and clay despite their great age.
*During this period early sediment began to form of what is now known as the Cambrian blue clay.

 

"Leningrad region" - an ecological pearl of the North-West Russia, and has an absolutely unique structure of the subsoil.
There is no any other place on the plains of Russia where you can find such a complete set of outputs of ancient rocks - ranging in age from Archaean to the Late Paleozoic. 
In the basis of the Paleozoic sediments - are sandstone and Cambrian blue clay, the age of which is about 600 million years.

This is due to the fact, that the Leningrad region lies at the junction of two major structures of the earth’s crust - on the southern edge of the Baltic Shield’s crystalline bedrock and Eastern European Platform. Together they form the East European (Russian) platform - where its Pre-Cambrian folded basement emerges on the surface.


CAMBRIAN BLUE CLAY
FROM  LENINGRAD  REGION 

*According to researches made by Russian scientists, Cambrian blue clay from Leningrad region - is considered to be the oldest blue clay on the Planet! 

This clay has a Rich & Unique mineral composition, and possesses VERY POWERFUL "MEDICAL AND SKINCARE PROPERTIES".
It has also been widely used in "Folk Medicine": to cure eczema, psoriasis, chronic rheumatism, osteoarthritis, arthritis, diabetes, inflammation of the liver, varicose veins etc.

*The unique composition, and age of the Cambrian Blue clay makes it very rare and highly valuable clay among all "cosmetic clays". 

*Russian scientists suggest that Cambrian Blue Clay has *Up to 5 times higher mineral content than the Dead Sea Mud*.

Absolutely everyone can be treated by the Cambrian blue clay independently on the diagnosis - as it is a natural high-performance curative measure that brings the metabolic processes to normal, and boosts other treatments effects (...herbal therapy, homeopathy, surgical therapies etc.).

*The natural healing properties of Cambrian blue clay help nourish the skin, reducing blemishes, acne and even reducing eczema. It is natural anti-inflammatory and helps to renovate the elasticity of the skin.
*Cambrian blue clay contains beneficial minerals - kaolin, calcium, phosphate, iron, magnesium and zinc which help to regenerate the skin, maintain its youth and elasticity. 

*Cambrian blue clay is deal for: ...baths, variety of facial masks, creams, body wraps, soft peels and scrubs, soap making, healing compresses, poultises ...e.t.c. 

*As a beauty treatment, Cambrian blue clay: ...has persistent pull-up properties; cleans, restores and renews the epidermis; refreshes the skin - making it smooth and supple; minimizing the appearance of wrinkles; stimulates blood circulation and enhances the metabolism of the skin cells.

*In the "COSMETICS INDUSTRY" Cambrian blue clay is used in: 
...Soaps; Toothpastes; Face / Body packs (…and other clay-based products which are slowly, but surly beginning to win the consumer over).

*Cambrian blue clay can also be used as an ingredient for other cosmetic products: ...in spas, resorts, naturopathy clinics and at home. 

*Cambrian blue clay also has an effective relief from:
...eczema, psoriasis, dermatitis, acne, chronic rheumatism, neuralgia, osteoarthritis, muscle/joint aches and pains, artritis...

*The curative spectrum of Cambrian blue clay is much wider in folk medicine: ...cancer, leukemia, adenoids, polyps, goiter, lymph nodes inflammation, anemia, headache, atherosclerosis, paralyses, nerve disorders, epilepsy, brain disturbances, eye inflammations, women’s diseases (mastitis, mastopathy, prolapsus of the uterus, fibromyoma, cysts, irregular periods, virginities, different discharges), men’s impotence and testicles indurations, diabetes, digestion disorders (gastritis, constipation, intestinal colic, piles), inflammation of the liver, jaundice, nephritis, urinary bladder diseases, heart disorders, bronchitis, pneumonia, pleurisy, T.B., cough, blood spitting, rhinitis, sore throat, skin diseases (eczema, psoriasis, erysipelas, warts), alopecia, arthritis, rheumatics, spurs, injuries, varicose veins, bones and joints diseases, ulcers and so on. 

*OUR CAMBRIAN BLUE CLAY:

                   

...contains all essential mineral salts, micro-elements, and macro-elements our body needs for health: silica, iron, potassium, phosphates, calcium, magnesium, nitrogen (Si, Al, K, Fe3+, Fe2+, Mg, Na, Ti, Ca, S, C, etc.) - in a form that our body can absorb easily. 

·  ​​100% natural, high quality product (...with no additives, preservatives, colorants or organic substances); 

·  Has been extracted from depths of more than 80 meters; 

·  After grinding and cleaning from of possible impurities, our clay has been cleaned, specially treated, and processed to Fine Powder; 

·  No animal testing;

·  Expiration date: 60 months from production date;

·  Contraindications: hypersensitivity or idiosyncrasy to the clay;

·  Not for internal use (...***but, we intend to apply for certificate lately);


HEALTH & BEAUTY BENEFITS

OF CAMBRIAN BLUE CLAY

Cambrian blue clay - is suitable for all skin types, body and hair, and can be safely used both by professionals (...in spas, resorts, naturopathy clinics), and at home: …for baths, facial masks, body wraps, compresses, poultices, body , ...and as an ingredient for "more complicated" cosmetic products.

Cambrian blue clay:

·  Increases blood circulation and lymph drainage. 

·  Provides supply of essential minerals, vitamins, organic acids and anti-oxidants through the skin due to its well-known ability to absorb substances.

·  Anti-inflammatory and anti-bacterial properties improve skin conditions like psoriasis, eczema and dermatitis.

·  Improves the skin appearance and texture, smooth out wrinkles, treats acne and pimples, removes freckles.

·  Eliminates the dead cells of the outer skin layer, and reduce the appearance of blood vessels.

·  Stimulates the growth of skin cells and collagen.

·  Stops gums bleeding (when a paste of clay and water is rubbed into them (You can also whiten teeth with the same mixture).

·  Promotes removal of oils and impurities from the skin, clearing out pores.

·  Draws impurities out of the body (detoxifying effect).

·  Boosts the immune system. Speeds up body metabolism.

·  Boosts hair growth (if hair is rinsed with clay water).

·  Increases removal of toxic waste and reduction in the cellulite appearance.

·  Removes excessive water from the body reducing puffiness.

·  Increases energy.

·  Reduces fatigue.

·  Promotes weight loss due to the effects listed above.

·  Relaxes the body and mind and increase the sense of well-being.

·  Acts as a powerful antiseptic and antibiotic, balances the human bio-field, is safe to use for everybody, and does not cause allergic reactions.

·  Used in a general bath or a foot bath, Cambrian blue clay acts as a very effective detoxifying remedy.

·  Ulcers and infected wounds benefit most from cambrian blue clay applications. 

·  Used in an enema/colonic irrigation procedures, it is simply the best colon cleanser available to us.

·  Used as a vaginal douche, it can help with many problems including candida and minor infections.

·  Used over hemorrhoids, clay helps heal them quickly.

·  Clay compresses are a First Aid remedy against bruises, sprains, strains (cold clay compresses will relieve the pain and internal bleeding and facilitate healing).

·  Used over burns /sunburn, cold clay compresses are the fastest healing and pain relieving remedy which helps regeneration of tissue and prevents formation of scars.

·  Carrot, beet, summer radish and potato don’t rot during winter, if they are placed into a jar with blue clay for a few minutes.


MAIN  COSMETIC  RECIPIES

WITH CAMBRIAN BLUE CLAY


Most of skincare products, which have been made with the use of Cambrian blue clay (...or other type of clay) - contain just small amount of it.
But, if you just spend some time, take the pure Cambrian blue clay powder, and simply mix it to a paste with spring water (...or, add seaweeds, herbal powders, herbs extracts, natural oils) – you will get 100% natural, and highly effective cosmetic, and healing product *MADE BY YOURSELF*.
The benefits of making your own cosmetics will be immediately evident: your new products will smell and feel good, and so will your skin and body.

Universal & Powerful Facial Mask: 

Cambrian blue clay + Laminaria powder +  Bladder wrack powder

Laminaria and bladder wrack-  are powerful ingredients as they draws an extraordinary wealth of mineral elements from the sea that can account for up to 36% of they dry mass. These include sodium, calcium, magnesium, potassium, chlorine, sulfur and phosphorus; the micronutrients include iodine, iron, zinc, copper, selenium, molybdenum, fluoride, manganese, boron, nickel and cobalt.
This *natural mix* is suppose to be massaged into the skin, resulting in skin stimulation and detoxification
(*Massage - allowing nutrients and anti-oxidants to be absorbed into the skin – detoxifying, hydrating, and healing as it dries). 
Recipe:
*Cambrian blue clay (50%)  + laminaria (25%) + bladder wrack (25%) – is a 100% vegan, 100% natural and powerful mask for all skin types…
Take: 3 – 4 tsp. of Cambrian blue clay powder, ½ tsp. of laminaria powder, and ½ tsp. of bladder wrack powder.
Mix all these dry ingredients together in a glass, or plastic bowl.
*Do not use any metal staff.
*Use a glass or plastic bowl, and glass, plastic or wood spoon / stick.
Pour clean water over this *mixture* (using approximately 40% - 50% water).
Stir the *mixture* with a plastic, glass or wooden spoon / stick - until they are thoroughly blended (...you should get a smooth, spreadable paste – …like a good sour crème).
But, the consistency of the paste is up to you (…you can experiment, and make the mask thicker, or thinner).
Gently massage this mask into your skin for several minutes.
Then, spread evenly over the face and leave to dry (for 15-20 minutes).
Remove / wash off with warm water.
If you want, you can use your favorite moisturizer to nourish the skin afterwards.

*PLEASE NOTE: 

You may want to avoid laminaria, and bladder wrack - if you have an iodine allergy or sensitivity. 

***Facial masks with Cambrian blue clay are extremely beneficial for your skin - ...masks help to draw impurities from the skin, leaving it radiant, free from dirt, and healthy-looking.
***With Regular uses - lifts your skin, makes it elastic and evens out skin tone.

*BE READY:

*You will fill the "pulsating sensation", because, Cambrian blue clay - is doing some kind of "limpho derange" for your skin, and stimulate the blood circulation.

*After any kind of procedure (...facial mask, body wrap) your face, or body will be red (or redish) for a while - because of the reasons mentioned above.


*For more Information, and Recipes  please visit our website: www.CambrianBlueClay.com


PROJECT DEVELOPMENT

Our Objectives:

  • To bring to North America - the unique, 100% natural Cambrian Blue Clay:
    - unmatched in quality,
    - rich in mineral composition,
    - and, The Most Active as a Cosmetic Treatment.

  • To launch new line of high quality, natural cosmetic products based on our Cambrian blue clay:
     - Facial masks for different types of skin;
    - Facial and body scrubs;
    - Shampoos; 
    - Body wraps for Spas;
    - ...and, some very cool “stuff” for pets.

Our Keys to Success:

· Our company will bring to North America - the unique, 100% natural cosmetic product unmatched in quality, rich in mineral composition, and THE MOST ACTIVE AS A COSMETIC TREATMENT.

· Our Cambrian blue clay has been mined (extracted) at a depth of ~ 80 – 100 meters. And, this is THE OLDEST DEPOSIT of Cambrian blue clay IN THE WORLD!

· We will be the only big supplier of this Cambrian blue clay to North America customers, and businesses.

· OUR PRICES – will be out of competition.

*We plan to sell our products:

- In bulk (...for cosmetic businesses, soap makers, small businesses…); 
- In buckets (...for Spa salons etc.). 

*We also intend (...in the nearest future):

-  To provide “private label packaging” of our products - for small, medium and large businesses.

-  To launch diversified line of natural cosmetic products based on our Cambrian blue clay...


DESCRIPTION OF “PERKS”

FOR OUR SUPPORTERS:

Our Cambrian blue clay, as well as "Kelp powder", and "Bladder wrack powder" - will be packed in high quality plastic, or kraft paper bags with zipper lock.  


PERK №1 - (...and our Main Product): 

    

 

*Cambrian blue clay (fine powder) 
- 100% natural, high quality product(...with no additives, preservatives, colorants or organic substances);
*Package weight: 1 lb.


PERK №2:    

   
 

ORGANIC  LAMINARIA / KELP  POWDER

Latin Name:  Ascophyllum nodosum
Origin:  Canada
Production:  Wildcrafted
Ingredients: 100% Laminaria Powder

Package weight: 1 lb.

Organic kelp powder is a leading source of naturally occurring iodine.
Kelp powder contains over 70 naturally occurring vitamins, minerals and trace minerals.
It is also rich in marine minerals like potassium, magnesium, calcium, and iron.
Kelp (seaweed) acts as *beauty grains* to promote exfoliation, helps to open clogged pores and removes toxins from your skin.
When applied to the skin, seaweed treatments act as a powerful detoxifier that draws out toxins and impurities while adding beneficial nutrients.It helps to stimulate the body's metabolism and circulation which gives skin a healthy, revitalize and glowing appearance.  
It is said to have antioxidant properties that help to reduce the appearance of wrinkles, and it can be used to stimulate the body's circulation which helps to minimize cellulite while infusing the skin with moisture for a healthy glowing skin. 

PERK №3:   

 

ORGANIC FUCUS / BLADDER WRACK POWDER
Latin Name: Fucus vesiculosu
Origin: Canada
Production: Wildcrafted
Ingredients: 100% Fucuc / Bladder wrack Powder

Package weight: 1 lb.

Bladderwrack grows along coastlines around the world.
Bladderwrack Powder is known to contain many vitamins, chelated minerals, and essential amino acids. Known topical uses for this herb include its use as a compress, as a bath herb to help cellulite, and in a poultice.
It can also be added to lotions for its skin softening qualities and to scrubs, body wraps, masks, and muds. 1 lb.

Purpose: Known topical uses for this herb include its use: as a compress, as a bath herb to help cellulite, and in a poultice. It can also be added to lotions for its skin softening qualities and to scrubs, body wraps, masks, and muds.

Benefits: Bladderwrack Powder is known to contain many vitamins, chelated minerals, and essential amino acids.

Applications: 
Organic Laminaria, and  Fucus Powders - can be used in face masks, detoxifying body wraps, soap making, body scrubs and bath powders.
Caution: 
Persons with an allergy to iodine should avoid using this product. This powder has a strong pungent odor that some may find offensive, so test product before using.


PERK №4:   

*Cambrian Blue Clay Spa & Factory DISCOUT CARD*
*With this *discount card*, you will be able to buy our Cambrian blue clay
- for 5$ per 1 lb. for two years, from the date of our official opening. 
*Some restrictions apply: No more than 20 lb. per month.
*Plus, you will get 15% discount on all of our other products.  
*After 2 years – with this card, you will still have 15% discount on all our products.


100% SHIPPING TO CANADA and USA ONLY !!!

*There may still be some places – where we can't ship. 
*If we run into problems - we'll try to contact you to make alternate arrangements.
*And of course, we can't be liable if there are customs fees or taxes you need to pay for importing our rewards into your country.
*So you'll want to check into that before signing up.


*To Your Attention:

*We Do Not Have a PayPal Account.

*If you decide to Help us – Please Use Your CREDIT CARD, or Bank Transfer.

*All Perks - will be sent in ~ 3 months after the end of our campaign.
Because, shipment from Russia with all custom procedures - takes around 2 months.
*We apologize for the inconvenience.


RISKS & CHALLENGES

*From our side – “Everything is ready to go”.
*We can produce  from 8 to 12 tons of Cambrian blue clay per month (for  now); And, we can easily scaled-up the production level.  
*We are ready to launch diversified line of natural cosmetic products based on our Cambrian blue clay (facial masks for different types of skin; facial and body scrubs; shampoos ; body wraps for Spas…and some very cool “stuff” for pets);  

*Shipping and Packaging time - is our only concern right now.
*It may take a bit longer for us to handle orders of your rewards, but all our supporters are guaranteed to receive their rewards *In Full* (on a first come, first serve basis).

Other Ways to Support Us

Visit our website:

www.CambrianBlueClay.com 

We are open for mutually beneficial cooperation with: 
Natural cosmetic manufacturers; Spas & Beauty salons; 
Health stores; Cosmetic stores; Soap makers etc.
Please "Contact us" on:
www.CambrianBlueClay.com

diseases, heart disorders, bronchitis, pneumonia, pleurisy, T.B., cough, blood
spitting, rhinitis, sore throat, skin diseases (eczema, psoriasis, erysipelas,
warts), alopecia, arthritis, rheumatics, spurs, injuries, varicose veins, bones
and joints diseases, ulcers and so on. 
*OUR CAMBRIAN BLUE CLAY:                   ...contains all essential mineral salts,
micro-elements, and macro-elements our body needs for health: silica, iron,
potassium, phosphates, calcium, magnesium, nitrogen (Si, Al, K, Fe3+, Fe2+, Mg,
Na, Ti, Ca, S, C, etc.) - in a form that our body can absorb easily. · 
​​100% natural, high quality product (...with no additives, preservatives, colorants or organic substances); 
· 
Has been extracted from depths of more than
80 meters; 
· 
After grinding and cleaning from of possible
impurities, our clay has been cleaned, specially treated, and processed to Fine
Powder; 
· 
No
animal testing;
· 
Expiration date: 60 months from production date;
· 
Contraindications: hypersensitivity or idiosyncrasy to
the clay;

Not for internal use (...***but, we intend to apply for certificate lately);
HEALTH & BEAUTY
BENEFITS
OF CAMBRIAN BLUE CLAY

Cambrian blue clay - is
suitable for all skin types, body and hair, and can be safely used both by
professionals (...in spas, resorts, naturopathy clinics), and at home: …for baths, facial masks, body wraps, compresses, poultices, body
, ...and as an ingredient for "more complicated" cosmetic products.

Cambrian
blue clay:

blood circulation and lymph drainage.

supply of essential minerals, vitamins, organic acids and anti-oxidants through

the skin appearance and texture, smooth out wrinkles, treats acne and pimples,

the dead cells of the outer skin layer, and reduce the appearance of blood
vessels.

the growth of skin cells and collagen.

gums bleeding (when a paste of clay and water is rubbed into them (You can also

over hemorrhoids, clay helps heal them quickly.

compresses are a First Aid remedy against bruises, sprains, strains (cold

over burns /sunburn, cold clay compresses are the fastest healing and

of scars.

beet, summer radish and potato don’t rot during winter, if they are placed into

MAIN  COSMETIC  RECIPIESWITH CAMBRIAN BLUE CLAY
Most of skincare products, which have been made with the use of Cambrian
blue clay (...or other type of clay) - contain just small amount of it. But, if
you just spend some time, take the pure Cambrian blue clay powder, and simply
mix it to a paste with spring water (...or, add seaweeds, herbal powders, herbs
extracts, natural oils) – you will get 100% natural, and highly effective
cosmetic, and healing product *MADE BY YOURSELF*.The benefits of making your own cosmetics will be immediately evident: your new
products will smell and feel good, and so will your skin and body.

Universal & Powerful Facial Mask: 

Cambrian blue clay + Laminaria powder +  Bladder wrack powder
Laminaria and bladder wrack-  are powerful ingredients as they draws an
extraordinary wealth of mineral elements from the sea that can account for up
to 36% of they dry mass. These include sodium, calcium, magnesium, potassium,
chlorine, sulfur and phosphorus; the micronutrients include iodine, iron, zinc,
copper, selenium, molybdenum, fluoride, manganese, boron, nickel and cobalt.This *natural mix* is suppose to be massaged into the skin, resulting in
skin stimulation and detoxification

detoxifying, hydrating, and healing as it dries). Recipe:

powder, ½ tsp. of laminaria powder, and ½ tsp. of bladder wrack powder.
Mix all these dry ingredients together in a glass, or plastic bowl.*Do not use any metal staff. *Use a glass or plastic bowl, and glass,
plastic or wood spoon / stick.
Pour clean water over this *mixture* (using approximately 40% - 50% water).
Stir the *mixture* with a plastic, glass or wooden spoon / stick - until they
are thoroughly blended (...you should get a smooth, spreadable paste – …like a
good sour crème).
But, the consistency of the paste is up to you (…you can experiment, and make
the mask thicker, or thinner).
Gently massage this mask into your skin for several minutes.
Then, spread evenly over the face and leave to dry (for 15-20 minutes).
Remove / wash off with warm water.
If you want, you can use your favorite moisturizer to nourish the skin
afterwards.*PLEASE
NOTE: You may want to avoid laminaria, and bladder wrack -
if you have an iodine allergy or sensitivity. ***Facial
masks with Cambrian blue clay are extremely beneficial for your skin - ...masks help to draw impurities from the skin, leaving it
radiant, free from dirt, and healthy-looking. ***With Regular uses - lifts your
skin, makes it elastic and evens out skin tone.
*BE READY:*You will fill the
"pulsating sensation", because, Cambrian blue clay - is doing some
kind of "limpho derange" for your skin, and stimulate the blood
circulation.

*After any kind of
procedure (...facial mask, body wrap) your face, or body will be red (or
redish) for a while - because of the reasons mentioned above.

website: www.CambrianBlueClay.com

diversified line of natural cosmetic products based on our Cambrian blue clay...DESCRIPTION OF “PERKS”FOR OUR SUPPORTERS:Our Cambrian blue clay, as well as "Kelp powder", and "Bladder wrack powder" - will be packed in high quality plastic, or kraft paper bags with zipper lock.

iron.

draws out toxins and impurities while adding beneficial nutrients.It helps to stimulate the body's metabolism and

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Katie Iles and I am the cofounder and COO of Nine Lines. One of our team members, Monica, was getting married next month at ReBar and just found out she needs to plan and pay for a new wedding - along with 100s of other couples.  I got married in Brooklyn two years ago and can't imagine the position these couples and their guests are in. There were even two weddings planned for this weekend! Gothamist updates (http://gothamist.com/2014/05/09/dumbo_rebar_closed.php) seem to suggest it's going to be VERY difficult for these couples to get their money back. ReBar made many pay in full upfront. Your wedding is such a beautiful, wonderful day - let's help these couples afford something new!

The Details

  • I'm asking for $90,000 because if there were two weddings/weekend for the rest of the summer, that's approx 18 couples in the most dire need to make and afford plans quickly. At that amount, each would get $5,000, hopefully enough to make a dent.
  • Once we have the funds, I'll manage equally splitting them amongst the couples with weddings through the end of August. I obviously won't take any money myself.

Were you a ReBar Couple?

  • Please fill out this Google survey with your contact info and we'll  be in touch to verify you were a ReBar couple: 

    https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1kdAzyMkfl6RQJBSsJqGiInAf6Nv8n_ZlNCmL_YXDy2k/viewform?usp=send_form

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Do you know a ReBar couple? Share the link to the Google survey with them!
  • If 9,000 people donate $10, we’ll be able to help these happy couples on their big day. This is New York City! Let’s pull together and make this happen. But we need your help to spread the word!!! Please let your friends, family and colleagues know about this cause!

story:
Short Summary

Well...most of you know the long and short of it; starting a company can be very difficult, stressful and challenging. Creating business plans, demographic studies, planning, budgeting and staying up working late, late into the night. Then the hard part starts...getting the money to actually start your company. 

My Name is Scott Schranz, and along with my Father (Ron) and Brother (Kirk) we are working hard to bring a bowling & entertainment center to our home town of Hamburg, NY.

No our idea will not save the world, cure diseases or revolutionize technology, but its something that is very important to our family and we know will be a fun, exciting and successful venture for us and our community.

Along with my Father & Brother our company will be run along with two experts in their respective fields. With over 20 years of experience Chef Chris Cihak will oversee our restaurant "The Back Alley Bar & Grill" and all catering.  Peter Cambio is our local pro bowler with over 30 years of experience managing bowling alleys, leagues and pro shops.

Our facility will have the most state of the art bowling equipment from Murrey Bowling (http://www.murreybowling.com) complete with 20 lanes, automatic scoring systems, large screen TV's, large screen projectors above each lane and Murrey's "Rock & Wow" light & music system for special events.

We will also offer a first for this area; a private 2 lanes bowling suite for parties, corporate events, or to entertain that important client. Our suite packages include a full catering experience from our restaurant & bar. This full service suite also includes couches and chairs for relaxing, a pool table, dart boards and a private bathroom.


Our full service restaurant called "The Back Alley Bar & Grill" will not be just serving French Fries & Nachos. Chef Cihak will have a menu prepared with the best food items Buffalo has to offer, along with daily specials.  Folks will stop in just for the Food...and then....might just stay to bowl a few!

We will also host two Video Golf Simulators, a billiards room with darts & pool tables, a stage for live music & kareoke, outdoor patio with horseshoe pits & bocce ball courts.

We want to be the premier hang out destination in the Hamburg area. The place where people go to get away from the long Western NY winters. We will host tournaments, birthday parties, special events like a Halloween costume party or 70's night, bowling leagues, billiards & dart leagues and much more.


What We Need & What You Get

We need your HELP to make this dream a reality. Every dollar earned from this campaign will be used towards our startup & operational costs and the down payment we need to qualify for an SBA loan.

If you donate, in addition to getting our eternal gratitude you will also receive gift cards for free food, drinks and bowling at GLB&E as well Great Lakes Bowling & Entertainment apparel.

You will also be enshrined on our "High Rollers" sponsors wall located at the entrance of our facility. Every patron that crosses our threshold will see your name and know that you helped make this place happen.

If your from the Buffalo area you will also receive a great place to socialize, eat, play and watch our Bills & Sabres with friends and your community.


The Impact

The template for this section states that I should explain why this project is valuable to contributors and to the world.  As I stated previously I don't think I can honestly sit here and tell you that a bowling alley is going to change the world, or how important it is.

What I can tell you is why it would be valuable to me, my family and our community.

First off this is a new career for me. Ive always wanted to own a business, be the person in charge. I find it both challenging and exciting to spearhead a project; yes there is pressure, yes there is failure, but when you achieve the desired outcome...wow what a feeling!

The Bowling and Entertainment Center is the next step in my life. A new challenge that I hope will be rewarding on both a personal & professional level. Its so important for me to take care of my family and help out in my community, give them everything I can, and that is why this center is valuable to me.

I also believe this center can have a valuable impact on our home town of Hamburg and the surrounding suburbs of Buffalo, NY.  And yes, this is the same Buffalo known for chicken wings, blizzards, 2 Stanley Cup loses and 4 straight Superbowl loses. But what people don't know unless they visit here is how amazing this area and community are.  Friendly and inviting people always willing to help out a neighbor, and support a good cause. Thats why living here is great. We get to enjoy all 4 season, we love our community, we love our Bills, our Sabres and we love to bowl!!


Great Lakes Bowling will support our community in anyway we can. Whether by hosting charitable events & fundraisers, tournaments or being the "home Field" for local high school and college bowling teams. We will support the community, that supports us!!  We will not be a quiet partner, and will give back as much as we can.


Risks & Challenges

The process of trying to start our own business has been a pretty unique one. Its been filled with many challenges and obstacles that I have never faced before in my professional career. But it has also been a very exciting one, and I hope a very worth while one. 

Unlike working for someone else, where your efforts and passions may not always be noticed or rewarded; doing it for yourself, your family, your community makes every little victory and accomplishment all the more rewarding.

Don't get me wrong, I still stress about every little detail & decision that comes along with doing this, but I gave up my career to pursue it and I won't let myself down or anyone else involved with the project.

The importance of this ways very heavy on me, but as the old cliché from Teddy Roosevelt says: "Nothing in the world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty".

At an early age my Father taught me the importance of hard work and persistence. Not just by the things he said, but by his actions. Most of my life I watched him work 2-to-3 jobs to keep us going. I watched him work late into the night in his home office without a complaint or a peep as to how tired he was. To this day he still says "you just do what has to be done".

That quote...for me...defines what makes a great work ethic. You just keep pushing forward until you accomplish your goal...you just do what has to be done!

And that will be our philosophy as a company. It will be the prevailing quality that will allow us to overcome any hurdles that may come our way. 

The risk for us is high. We are risking our homes, retirements, and futures. We can't afford to fail, so if you donate and help us out we will not let your money go to waste. We will work as hard as we can to make this venture as successful as possible. And we will never forget your contribution; once were open stop in and ask for us, we would love to meet you and give you our personal thanks.



    Other Ways You Can Help

    I would like to take this opportunity to thank everybody out there in the indiegogo community for visiting our campaign page, reading our plan and considering donating to our project.

    We know that not everyone who "stops by" can contribute, and thats ok, but you can still help us out by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign, especially if your from the Buffalo area. 

    Use those Indiegogo share tools, and help drum up support for us.

The risk for us is high. We are risking our homes, retirements, and futures. We can't afford to fail, so if you donate and help us out we will not let your money go to waste. We will work as hard as we can to make this venture as successful as possible. And we will never forget your contribution; once were open stop in and ask for us, we would love to meet you and give you our personal thanks.





  Other Ways You Can Help I would like to take this opportunity to thank everybody out there in the indiegogo community for visiting our campaign page, reading our plan and considering donating to our project.
We know that not everyone who "stops by" can contribute, and thats ok, but you can still help us out by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign, especially if your from the Buffalo area. 
Use those Indiegogo share tools, and help drum up support for us.

story:
Everyone in Scotland is aware of the referendum on the 18th of September . So much for free speech and democracy  basically if you don't agree with SNP and their campaign you are a traitor and your property deserves to be vandalised.


So can we help a 72 year old pensioner who put a NO Thanks  sticker on his car which next day happens to get keyed in the Lidl car park.

story:
Epigaze Audio: Who We Are

Hello Everybody! For those of you who do not know me, my name is Josh Alley, I run and operate Epigaze Audio. For the past year I have taken the dream of Epigaze Audio from a side project to a full-scale business. Epigaze Audio is committed to offering the best pedals available at reasonable prices for the modern day guitarist. In any business there are growing pains and I feel I have done a great job so far with keeping up with demand and all of the interest in my products. I have great plans for the future of Epigaze Audio and this where your help is greatly appreciated!

The sole purpose of this campaign is to help Epigaze Audio maximize it’s potential growth and better service all of it’s customers and dealers.

How Your Contributions Will Help

Below I have explained the key points that your contributions will help come to live.

  • Legal Administration / Aid: One of the biggest hurdles for growth is acquiring the appropriate funding. Your contribution will help curve the cost that will be needed to gain the acceptance of investors in Epigaze Audio.
  • Tools & Equipment: To keep up with the ever increasing demand in Epigaze Audio products, new tools and equipment are required to streamline the production while still keeping true to our hand-build tradition.
  • Workspace & Storage: With additional production, more space is needed to provide an adequate working environment and proper storage for equipment, materials, pedals in production, packaging, and shipping.
  • Inventory: One of the most important points I want to accomplish is to constantly have an inventory of finished products available at all times to abolish and/or drastically reduce turnaround times. To date all of my customers have been great with the current 2-3 week turnaround time, but I want to offer my customers a higher level of service.

The Impact

Epigaze Audio is more than just a guitar pedal company. I have had the privilege of gaining some great friends and a thriving community of musicians, builders, merchants, and artists. Everything I do with Epigaze Audio I do with a mindset of 110%. Everyone deserves a great product, with stunning graphics, attention to detail and quality components, and outstanding build quality and durability. I stand by every single product 100%, and I am looking forward to expanding on an already excellent business model with all of you at my side. Thank you to all of my frends, family, and customers who have taken me this far already. Now is the time that I ask you to help carry Epigaze Audio one-step further. Cheers!

The Perks

All of the perks offered in this campaign are LIMITED EDITION items and some have some great sentimental value. Take a look! Not interested in a perk?, No problem, please free to contribute any amount you would like.

Limited Edition Guitar Picks

These guitar picks are only being produced specifically for the campaign. The picks feature a custom geometric design using our Epigaze Logo with the words “EPIGAZE AUDIO SUPPORTER” underneath. The picks are also glow in the dark.

Limited Edition Neutrino Print

Professionally printed on Kodak Professional Metallic paper. This print is only offered through this campaign and will be hand numbered and signed. Print size is 8”x10”.

Limited Edition Earthrise Print

Professionally printed on Kodak Professional Metallic paper. This print is only offered through this campaign and will be hand numbered and signed. Print size is 8”x10”.

Limited Edition Singularity Print

Professionally printed on Kodak Professional Metallic paper. This print is only offered through this campaign and will be hand numbered and signed. Print size is 8”x10”.

Limited Edition Neutrino Tee

Show your love for the Neutrino with this limited edition t-shirt. This design will only be offered through this campaign and will be printed on 100% ringspun cotton fitted shirts. Available in sizes Small – 2X.

Limited Edition Machines Tee

Show your love for Epigaze Audio with this limited edition t-shirt. This design will only be offered through this campaign and will be printed on 100% ringspun cotton fitted shirts. Available in sizes Small – 2X.

Limited Edition T-Shirt Set

Take advantage of this perk and receive both limited edition T-shirts. These designs will only be offered through this campaign and will be printed on 100% ringspun cotton fitted shirts. Available in sizes Small – 2X.

Limited Edition Set of Three Prints

With this perk you will receive all three limited edition prints. Professionally printed on Kodak Professional Metallic paper. These prints will only offered through this campaign and will be hand numbered and signed. Print size is 8”x10”.

Custom Neutrino

Custom built Neutrino buffer. Choose what type of graphic and/or paint as well as LED color. Landscape Painting is available as well.

Limited Edition Epigaze Audio Guitar Strap

Wear your support on the stage with a Epigaze Audio guitar strap with our slogan “Rock N’FN” Roll Machines”.

Original Aluminum Printing Screens

These are the original screenprinting screens that were used on all Epigaze Audio products and prototypes up until this point. Own a piece of Epigaze Audio history that wasthe start of it all. Artwork featured between the three screens include: Earthrise VIII, Neutrino, Cosmodrome, Hallow Oak, Eclipse, Reality Master, Hallow Oak Dwarf, Enceladus, Earthrise IX, Earthrise XI, Singularity and Earthrise XVII.

Neutrino – Serial #001

This is my personal Neutrino buffer, #001. This was the Prototype model. I am very attached to this pedal, but I am willing to part with it for the greater good! Own a piece of Epigaze Audio History.

Custom Earthrise VIII

Custom built Earthrise VIII. Choose what type of graphic and/or paint as well as LED color, and Knob color. Landscape Painting is available as well.

Custom Earthrise XI

Custom built Earthrise XI. Choose what type of graphic and/or paint as well as LED color, and Knob color. Landscape Painting is available as well.

Custom Singularity

Custom built Singularity. Choose what type of graphic and/or paint as well as LED color, and Knob color. Landscape Painting is available as well.

Original Hand-drawn Monoceros 838 Echo Artwork

Own the original artwork for the upcoming Monoceros 838 Echo. Artist, Rachael Mayo, is drawing the artwork this month. Additional photos will be made available soon!

Earthrise VIII – Serial #001

This is my personal Earthrise VIII, #001. This was the Prototype model. I am very attached to this pedal, but I am willing to part with it for the greater good! Own a piece of Epigaze Audio History.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute financially please share my campaign with all of your friends and family to help get the word out. This is one of the best ways to help this campaign succeed. Post links on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc. Everything counts!

Thanks for taking the time to check out this campaign. I truly appreciate all of the love and support from all of my customers, family, and friends. You are all special to me, and are all Rock N’FN’ Roll Machines in my heart. Cheers!

story:
Hi! My name is Brenna Coupland

I'm a Canadian bicycle mechanic and founder of the Fisantekraal Bike Club! In partnership with the NGO Peace and Love International and Beeyond a Bike, I facilitate an educational bike program at Fisantekraal High School. Everyday I am discovering a deeper connection with South Africa and finding a greater sense of purpose in teaching Fisantekraal youth about bikes. The youth in this community face huge disadvantages and difficulties.  I know the bike club is making a real difference and is much loved by all members. I'm running this campaign to raise funds to purchase more used bikes and parts, as well as run events to keep the bike club going! 

Where is Fisantekraal Bike Club?

Our bike club runs out of a shipping container at the back of Fisantekraal High School.  Fisantekraal is a rural township near Cape Town in South Africa formed at the end of apartheid by rural workers forced to move off landholders' farms. Only one in five adults in the township have completed high school and the youth lack educated role models. The community petitioned for a school of their own for many years and finally Fisantekraal High School was built; the school roll is now around 900 and the first learners will matriculate this year.  This school is a proud heart of the community.

Why a bike club?

The township is isolated and ownership of a bicycle, and the skills to maintain it, significantly improves the lives of our young bike mechanics.  The self confidence that comes from knowing you have built your bike yourself stands our club members in good stead.  The ability to travel, with the closest town 10km away, is hugely valued by our teenagers.  For the members who are matriculating, their bicycle will provide them transport to job interviews and further training. The healthy community atmosphere created in bike shop fosters friendships across different ages. It is heart warming to see the older, more experienced members helping the younger children. 

The bike club is appreciated by the parents of our members as well as the youth, with adults sometimes stopping by to pump tires and to see what their kids are raving about.

Who we are: Peace and Love International and Beyond a Bike

Peace and Love International (PLI) is a Canadian NGO that has been running various programs at Fisantekraal High School since the school's inauguration in 2012. Current programs include tutoring, scholarship assistance and our bustling bike club! 

Beeyond a Bike (BaB) is a grass-roots initiative of a Canadian bicycle mechanic and traveling cyclist named Brenna Coupland whose mission is to empower communities through bicycle accessibility and mechanical education.

In 2011, a Claremont Rotary member donated the 6x3 m shipping container which now houses our bike club.  Claremont Rotary also helped with the transport of 14 used bicycles donated by Canadian Rotary branches to Peace and Love International. THANK YOU ROTARY! From the bike and shipping container donations a vision for a bike program at Fisantekraal High School was born! Conversations between BaB and PLI began and the two collaborated to develop a pedal-powered program to launch at the high school in 2014!


The Bike Club Programme

Over a course of 6-8 weeks, students attend regular workshop classes with a trained and enthusiastic instructor (read: bike geek) and fix a used bicycle. As they progress, the students develop a thorough understanding of basic mechanics, riding and safety skills and have the opportunity to participate in group rides and events. 

 

Once students have completed the programme, they graduate and become the proud owners of the bicycle they fixed themselves, a helmet, a lock and an invitation to continue participating in bike club as volunteer mechanics and teachers to their peer students. 


We've come a long way, but are passionately pedaling ahead!  

By the end of September, Bike Club will have graduated 10 students with bicycles from the programme and assisted 4 others in turning their pile of parts into something that moves them! We are rapidly evolving into a vibrant, diverse bicycle community and have students knocking on our door everyday, keen to get involved.  We want to take our bike club to the next level, expand and build our capacity to take on more students. We need more bikes, more parts, more gear and more of YOUR SUPPORT to make that happen! 


Open Shop - coming soon, with your help! 

Every week, the workshop is open to any student of Fisantekraal High School who wishes to repair their own bicycle or get involved in the space. Graduates of the program volunteer as mechanics and continue to be involved in bike club's group outings and Fisantekraal Bike Team events. 

 

We require that users of the workshop respect the shop space and contribute by way of assisting others, helping around the workshop or creating art or cool bicycle diagrams. Your donation can ensure we always have spare cables, tubes, brake pads and healthy snacks on site for our wrenching youth!


Fisantekraal Bike Team - coming soon, with your help!


Our latest dream is a team! We now have ten cycling enthusiasts with working bicycles and we are growing 'wheely' fast. We are ready to get involved in races and events and want to make it happen as a team. To do so, we need cycling jerseys and shorts for all team members as well as entrance fees and general participation costs (transportation, food accommodation) per event. To participate in mountain bike events, we will need approximately 12 mountain bikes for the team members to share. 


Bike Shop Budget estimates for 2014 - 2015

South African Rand Canadian Dollars
24 helmets 3600 ZAR $360.00
24 locks 2400 ZAR $240.00
24 used bicycles 12 000 ZAR $1200.00
Various bicycle tools (dishing tool, truing stand, etc) 5000 ZAR $500.00
Stock of tubes, cables and brake pads 5000 ZAR $500.00
Snacks for classes and open shop 2000 ZAR $200.00
Hardware stock (bolts, nuts etc) 2000 ZAR $200.00
3 repair stands 3000 ZAR $300.00
12 mountain bicycles 6000 ZAR $600
20 Fisantekraal Bike Team jerseys 9000 ZAR $900
Events 20000 ZAR $2000
Further formal mechanic training with BEN South Africa 25000 ZAR $2500
Total 95 000 ZAR $9 500

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have any spare cash but want to help? You could...

  • Organise a fundraiser in your town!
  • Share the campaign! Talk to friends about the Fisantekraal Bike Club - try get us in the paper!
  • In Cape Town? Come out to Fisantekraal with me and check it out! I'm super keen for new volunteers to get involved
  • Donate your used bicycle, parts, tools, bike clothing or old fabric for rags!
  • Get your bike business involved - set up a donation tin or if you live locally donate your old repair stands, parts or tools! 

THANK YOU so much for your support.

story:
Short Summary

What We Need & What You Get

I need initial investment funding of $75,000 to start buying some mobile home parks that offer owner financing. I have raised close to $50,000 myself already but need more to use for down payments for the several parks. The parks I'm looking into are smaller, in rural communities, and have some homes to rehab. The housing demand in these areas is pretty high due to limited supply. All funds will go towards rehabbing homes and down payments for the parks. Your funding will be a great help for these families, retirees, and low income individuals have a nice home to call home. Eventually, my goal is to have several parks and use some of the earnings to start a "Tiny Home" community. 

The Impact

Over 20 million American's live in Mobile Homes. Baby boomers with little savings, single parents struggling, low income families, and individuals trying to save for a site built home, all call mobile homes home. The problem is that this type of affordable housing is short on supply and high on demand. 

    Risks & Challenges

    My biggest challenge is liquid capital to start investing. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

      • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
      • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Greetings Indiegogo'ers,
My name is Benjamen Simon and I am the VERY proud son of Martha Tancil (Bonney).  In February of 2006, my two sisters (Elizabeth and Rebecca) and I lost our dear mother when she was just a pup of 60 years to colorectal cancer.  This was after being a 10 year survivor of breast cancer.  She was diagnosed just a short year (and change) prior with no real warning signs to speak of.
There are so many wonderful charities in the world, specifically for cancers, but colorectal cancer isn't as pretty as the majority of them.  In fact, it's mostly shitty . . . literally and figuratively.  Even just recently (2010) getting a small portion of the governmental funding for cancer research.  Since my mother's passing in 2006, I have desired to build a non-profit so that we can help to bring more research  and awareness to this horrible disease that is always at the back end of the lines.  The trouble is that getting people to donate to a non-profit start up is a catch-22.  Most people want the tax benefit of their donation, but they are technically not allowed to until the MBCC is truly established as a 501c.
The MBCC will be different . . . many non-profits gather funding and let you know the different research that the donations help.  Whereas the MBCC will allow the person giving the donation to choose where their funding goes, whether to a specific research study or to a larger charity such as Fight CRC or even the Susan G Komen foundation.
 

Where Will Your Money Go?

 - It will cost roughly $3000 to have the Martha Bonney Cancer Coalition properly set up as a 501c organization.

- It will cost roughly $6000 to purchase a domain and have a web design firm create an interactive website that will allow users not only to donate to the MBCC, but to learn about different aspect of colorectal cancer from causes to implications of being diagnosed with the disease.  It is the ultimate goal for the folks who donate through the website to be able to choose specific projects or research that their monies will go to. 

- Any remaining funds will be put into future research as well as paying fees associated with this web service.

- Any funds collected above and beyond the $10,000 goal will be tracked and you will be able to choose where these funds go (or make suggestions) once the website is up and running.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's okay, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please be sure to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!


Your funding means the world to me and my sisters.  We each have children that  never got to meet their Nanny (grandmother) because of the aggressive stage of colorectal cancer which she was inflicted.   We never want anyone to have to suffer this same type of loss for their families and are dedicated to helping the world make a difference for all that this cancer has impacted.


In Loving Kindness,

Benjamen Simon

story:
Short Summary

The Naryn City Orphanage opened in 1964 as a place for children to be cared for during the school year. It currently is a home to 105 students from around the oblast (state). 15 kids come from Naryn City and the other 90 kids are from the surrounding villages and small cities in the oblast (state). The orphanage provides the students with a home to live in and with the help of Mercy Corps three meals a day. Throughout the school year 8 caretakers stay with the students in the orphanage.


Currently the orphanage houses a hospital room staffed with one doctor and two nurses. However, the infirmary room that they have is in complete disrepair; the toilet, sink and beds are all broken. This means no running water and no nearby toilet. As one of the most prominent sicknesses is diarrhea, this can cause a real problem trying to go outside and walk 400m to the squat toilet. The orphanage reached out to the Naryn Oblast Health Promotion Unit (HPU) to help find funding to repair their infirmary. The Naryn Oblast HPU is responsible for educating people about preventing the spread of communicable diseases and reducing the prevalence on noncommunicable diseases.

Fatima Eje, who has worked for the Naryn Oblast HPU for the past 10 years, along with volunteer, Liz Ludwig, came together to respond to the needs of the local orphanage by starting this campaign. Thus far, employees at the Orphanage, local hospital, and some friends around town have offered to donate their time to fix up the old Infirmary. This means that all the orphanage needs are the materials to repair the Infirmary. This is where your generous donations come into play.  

What We Need & What You Get

    • What we need: 8 beds, 8 mattresses, 1 toilet, 2 sinks, 7 doors, flooring, paint, tile/grout for the bathroom, panels for the ceiling, lights / electricity.
    • What will you get in return for donating to our Orphanage: depending on the size of your donation you could receive a Kalpak (traditional hat worn my men),  
      hand made slippers,
      or a Kyrgyz scarf.
    • If we do not reach our goal of $5,750 then we will first buy the beds, mattresses, toilet, sinks, and doors. 

The Impact

Just last April 15 of the orphans fell ill with measles and all crammed into the broken down infirmary without a toilet, sink or working beds to sleep in. Your contributions will help to create a safe place for ill orphans to heal and prevent the spread of disease among other students. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the news: Share this campaign with your friends, family, coworkers and anyone else.
  • You can easily use the Indiegogo share tools at the top left of this page to share this campaign on your facebook, twitter, or other social media!

story:
FLASH PROMOTION FOR LOS ANGELES RESIDENTS!

All donations of $25 received in the next 24 hours will be rewarded with a voucher for our 2014 Savage Sauvignon Blanc! Your voucher will be sent electronically AND you can cash it in for a free delivery the VERY NEXT DAY! Not bad, right? One of those handsomely-shoed men up there will deliver it personally! Plus we tell jokes! 
Help us out today! #LetsMakeWine


UPDATE!

We're headed into our second week of crowd funding and we're 13% of the way there! Not bad! Many thanks to everyone involved! And for the rest of you... Don't you like wine?!? And shenanigans?! We got both here!

What Are You Guys Doing? 

We're making wine! And people are buying it! Last year, we made 140 cases of Single-Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc, and managed to place it in restaurants and specialty shops all over California and New Mexico.

Really?

Yep! We did it the old-fashioned way, and drove all over the place, begging people to try our juice. It's kind of like touring in a rock band; you get to hang out in a van, see new places and meet people. It's really fun.


So Why Are You Doing This?

Because we like to drink wine and travel and meet people and find out about stuff! The three of us have spent our lives working in restaurants, and when we met and discovered we all wanted to make wine, we pooled our resources and made it happen! 

Just What Have You Gotten Yourselves Into?

It's like this: Last time around, we emptied our bank accounts, called in some favors, and generally scraped together enough money to buy two tons of grapes, 4 steel barrels, and some bottles, caps and labels. We made Sauvignon Blanc and sold all of it, and used the money we made to buy four times as many grapes this year. Now that our wine has nearly finished working its magic inside the barrels, we need capital for the bottles, caps, labels, and to cover the fee at the facility where we're storing our wine. We're about 15 grand short, and our hair is turning gray AT THIS VERY MOMENT. 

#SaveTheJuice


Ok, What is the Goal Here? And Why "Savage"?

Our goal with Savage Wines is to produce minimally manipulated wines from all over California that serve as a snapshot of that particular time and place. We use organically cultivated fruit from a single vineyard, picked when we think the grapes are just right, crushed, fermented and bottled and delivered to your face. That's it. 

We're shooting for an approachable, honest portrayal of climate and terroir. We started with the TTT vineyard Sauvignon Blanc from Happy Canyon in the east end of Santa Barbara's Santa Ynez Valley. This year, we're adding ANOTHER Sauvignon Blanc from the Jack Mcginley vineyard. No blending, no oak, no additives. Just the juice and a fun story.

We settled on the name "Savage" for a couple of reasons. The wild nature of the Sauvignon Blanc grape which, when left unchecked, grows and grows uncontrollably. It's a real show-off. We like that kind of enthusiasm. 

We also took inspiration from history and Genghis Khan's nomadic Mongol Empire, who in the course of their admittedly brutal campaigns across the globe, would adopt and improve on the technological and agricultural innovations of the people who came under their rule. Using the best California has to offer, we hope to showcase wines from all over the state! (Without the, y'know, brutal violence)


Why Sauvignon Blanc?

We chose Sauvignon Blanc for several reasons. The first, and perhaps the most important, is that it’s what we most often drink personally. Second, just two hours from our office is a growing region (Santa Ynez Valley) whose Sauvignon Blanc has a reputation for producing premium wines. Third, making wine from this varietal is relatively simple; the grapes are crushed, barreled, and left to ferment. This wine will be ready for market just 7-8 months after harvest (Red wines, certainly the one’s we are interested in, will take more time). Finally, our first target market is Southern California, where it is always sunny and warm - a great environment for white wine sales.


So Where Can I Get Some?

Savage Wines is proud to offer our initial bottling at such fine establishments as:
Rich Table, San Francisco
Blush!, San Francisco
Tar & Roses, Santa Monica
Local Kitchen and Wine Bar, Santa Monica
Market Provisions, Los Angeles
South End, Venice
Bacchus, Manhattan Beach
Sama Sama Kitchen, Santa Barbara
Chalk Board, Healdsburg
Willmore, Long Beach
Cornell Winery/The Old Place, Malibu
Herringbone, La Jolla
Coyote Cafe, Santa Fe
Geronimo, Santa Fe
Radish & Rye, Santa Fe
and more! We're excited to be featured in many of our favorite restaurants already!
Or you can go to savagewinesla.com 


Yeah, But Who ARE you?
We are Abraham, Eric and Joseph, three restaurant lifers who've spent our careers in the kitchen, the dining room, and behind the bar. For us, food and wine are central to a happy lifestyle. 
In our other job, we host monthly dinner parties for 20 guests at a time, designing multi-course, rustic meals with wine pairings and shenanigans in general. 
It's a gas!


What We Need and How Your Contribution Helps!

We're launching this campaign in the hopes that our community will join us in delivering two unique wines representing what the Happy Canyon AVA has to offer. 

With your support, we're aiming to raise $15,000.  We've personally invested our own savings, as have many of our family members. Savage is a bootstrap endeavor, in every sense. This campaign will help us launch our second vintage by securing the purchase of bottles, caps and labels and paying for the bottling of our wine (not to mention the renewal of state and federal licenses, which ain't cheap). Then, we can deliver it to more restaurants and retailers across the United States! Wouldn't that be neat?! 


Risks & Challenges

The main risk is, of course, that no one buys the wine we make. (That would be bad.)

We are fortunate to have spent our entire working careers, 55 years cumulatively, learning about wine and developing lasting relationships in the food and wine community. In short, we feel that just as our first vintage was placed in restaurants in short order, our second vintage will be successful finding it's way to wine lists and retailer's shelves. With your help, Savage can ascend from regional curiosity to nationwide phenomenon!


Short on Cash?

If you can't contribute to the campaign at this time, you can still help us out, we'd really appreciate it!

  • Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter
  • Share this campaign with and spread the word to your friends! #letsmakewine

We're launching this campaign in the hopes that our community will join us in delivering two unique wines representing what the Happy Canyon AVA has to offer. 
With your support, we're aiming to raise $15,000.  We've personally invested our own savings, as have many of our family members. Savage is a bootstrap endeavor, in every sense. This campaign will help us launch our second vintage by securing the purchase of bottles, caps and labels and paying for the bottling of our wine (not to mention the renewal of state and federal licenses, which ain't cheap). Then, we can deliver it to more restaurants and retailers across the United States! Wouldn't that be neat?!
